reviews.description: We just left and I'm SO confused... I don't know how our experience can be so different from all the other Yelp reviews. We just parked, shared a tasting and left in about 15 minutes because we felt kind of unwelcome and found the wines to be awful. And we wanted desperately to love this place, because it is GORGEOUS. I'd have been very easy to please to be able to spend time in this beautiful place. But the owner was kind of frosty, barely spoke to us (but was more vocal with others), didn't tell us anything (not even the names) about any of the wines. I complimented him effusively on the place when we first got there and tried to get him to chat during the tasting, but he didn't thaw. I don't know if we made him mad because we chose to share a tasting?? We would've gotten a glass or two once we found a wine we liked. We felt like we weren't wanted, which when you're sitting at the little wine counter right in front of the guy, is really uncomfortable. I could've ignored all that if one of the wines worked for us, but I hate to say it, we thought all 4 were terrible. We drink a lot of wine, not cheap or sweet ones, and none of these tasted like anything we've ever had before. I'm confused that every other reviewer LOVED them and we had such an opposite reaction. We are at a loss for the experience we just had. The winery is so so beautiful though, it rivals CA wineries. So bummed. :(

reviews.author: Marty C.
reviews.description: Go here. The wines are mostly made from grapes grown on the property by a gentleman who has studied wine making in California and France. Tasting is a good value, and the property and tasting room are gorgeous. If you like to taste and talk about fine wine, you will feel right at home. If you don't know much about wine, but want a nice country drive and wines that appeal to a variety of tastes, check it out, too.

reviews.author: Brett B.
reviews.description: One of the most beautiful wineries you will find in Texas! Very well done, it is a must see if you are anywhere close! The owner is a hoot, and the wines are very unique. This is the kind of place you could just sit at all day.

reviews.author: Mia F.
reviews.description: Had Mako's for dinner. We had gone before when they first opened. It's wasn't great, but it wasn't bad. I went a second time, and it got better. For our third try, we went on February 26th for a 9 pm dinner.   We order the following:  Share: shrimp campechana Salad: traditional Greek salad  Savor mako's bacon cheeseburger and creole fried chicken.  Signature cocktails: cucumber mako-Rita and whiskey sour.   All I can say is everything was amazingly delicious. The server was terrific. She had great recommendations and knew the menu well. She made sure things got filled in a timely matter. I still can't stop thinking about the food! They also have delicious fermented red jalapeños made in-house. OMGosh! I'm obsessed! I can not wait to go again.

reviews.author: Gilberto R.
reviews.description: The service and the food should have been way better for the prices they charge.   Salmon appetizer was the saving grace of the night.  Seafood Paella was a bowl of grease soaked rice with a few bites of seafood and some shrimp.  Pork shoulder had some weird sour flavor to it.  Tried to save it with a chocolate cheesecake at the end but nope. It was a chocolate brownie, nowhere close to tasting like a cheesecake, it was dense and dry, also had some strange flavor that we were trying to guess but couldn't figure out what it was.

reviews.author: Natalie M.
reviews.description: Update: I've come here two more times since my initial review, and am upping the stars to five! Though it is pricy, it is very worth it. Last night my experience was awesome sitting in the bar. Our server was Paul, the bartender, who was extremely friendly and quirky.  Makos will definitely be my go to for higher end cuisine moving forward. I recommend everyone check them out!

reviews.author: Dezeray C.
reviews.description: So this is my first time here, to make a reservation online was easy but I did pick a time that I knew wasn't going to be busy to have a great experience. The food was amazing however the menu is very limited but during Covid I have seen that restaurant menu have become limited. I enjoyed the wedge salad added shrimp, I know salad uhh but nope it was amazing they had croutons that were bacon omg it was yummy. The started was a shrimp campechana with some tostada, the size is a little small but it was great because I got to finish my whole entree. The only complaint I would say was our waitress, at first I did give her a benefit of the doubt, but as she countined to get tables it just felt that she ignored me more and more. The reason I put three star was because the food was amazing, the servers who were not our server were helpful wish I could have tip them instead. She just seem to avoid the table, said she would be back and just took a while. At the end she did completely forget about us which left me upset, I did wait a few days because I wanted to clear my head before writing a review. The food was so amazing that I might be back but might do take out next time which is sad because it's a nice environment to enjoy a meal I just don't want to experience that kind of service again. Placed the new menu on here because it does seem like the stuff on yelp are older. The waitress did stated that everything on yelp was old so here something to help. Wishing the restaurant the best, maybe it was just bad timing for me, we'll see on my next visit

reviews.author: Patty H.
reviews.description: First off, the place is a very relaxed atmosphere. The hostess/waitress was super nice.  The place looked clean inside and the outside patio too. Don't expect to see or hear the creek though it's kind of a ways away. We went during brunch hours and we had the place to ourselves considering it was already 2pm. Brunch ends at 3 and dinner starts at 4pm. I had the oyster mushroom omelet and the lentil soup. I wish they served bread for the table. It would go great with my lentil soup. The soup was perfect! The roasted potatoes could've been a little less roasted. My omelet was a little bit over fried. I'm not sure if that's the way they always do it. The waitress mentioned a happy hour from 3-6pm during the week with some $5 drink specials. I would return to try their  dinner menu.

reviews.author: Deanna J.
reviews.description: I chose to dine alone this evening. I used the Yelp app to help me decide, and Mako's ended up being the perfect location. I made a reservation; it wasn't needed, but I wanted to be on the safe side. I was seated quickly at a high top near the bar where I could still enjoy the peace of dining alone, with the background noise of quiet conversation from others and ESPN playing above the bar.   I'd made it just in time for the Happy Hour specials and decided on a $5 old fashioned and the $5 Gouda ranch wedge ($1 with grilled shrimp1). I added the butternut squash bisque after placing my initial order, and it was the right choice. The funny thing is I can't quite describe what made it tasty, but I cleaned the bowl! The salad was pure perfection...seriously...you canNOT go wrong. I'm not sure if it was the tangy pickled onion, the smoky lardon bacon,  or the perfectly grilled shrimp that made the salad so scrumptious, but I'm already planning my next visit for that one item alone.   Since I wasn't stuffed from my satisfying meal, I decided to indulge in dessert. I chose the poached pear with the Portofino wine reduction and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. It was delicious, but SUPER sweet. So, if you're not into that, pass on this dessert. Even though it's a small dessert, it's perfect to share because it's probably too rich for one person (except me!).   This will not be my last time enjoying happy hour here; I've already text a friend to suggest this as a new monthly get together spot! Next time I'll sit outside!   Side Note: I definitely recommend the "Smoked" old fashioned made with star of anise, juniper berry, and mesquite chips. Ask to see a demonstration to add to the overall experience. It was a pure delight. It somehow took a simple $5 cocktail to the next level.

reviews.author: Alecia B.
reviews.description: We were in the area for a volleyball tournament and wanted to find somewhere for a good drink and lunch. Let's just say we stopped by again for dinner on the way home! The food is exceptional and the chef is talented. We loved the bartender and our servers. Highlights were the burger, salmon tartare and the delicious market salad. Thanks for having us!

reviews.author: Melody C.
reviews.description: We found this new trendy spot in Cibolo, Texas. The host was very accommodating when we arrived, if you wanted to wear a mask then they wore mask and if you were comfortable and not wearing a mask then they would not wear a mask.  He sat us all down as we were still waiting for three people from our party. Once our full party had arrived, we had to wait. Unfortunately the waitress took over 10 minutes to come to our table to at least offer some water.  Overall our experience was very great! Unfortunately I did not take a lot of pictures because it was my sisters birthday. But I did manage to sneak in a picture of my cheeseburger which was very light. And I don't mean light in a bad way I mean it as in a satisfying way. Must try!   Their cocktails are also very delicious. I had the cucumber margarita cocktail if I'm not mistaken, and it was very light and subtle at the same time. But boozy!   The only part that I was not super happy with was that the waitress mentioned to us that she had ordered a special surprise for my sister which was their almond cake. As a gift from her. So to me that means that the dessert is on them. But surprisingly when I received the ticket the almond cake was on there. I did not feel like I really wanted to argue over the almond cake but as I stated the way she mentioned it to me is that she was covering the cake. So for that reason I did remove one star.  Something that I really liked about this place was the bathroom. As a first time Mama i've noticed that many restaurants don't have a baby changing table. Or if they have a baby changing table it's very dirty. This place had a very awesome baby changing station. They had diapers, they had wipes, they had waste bags. You think of it and they had it!  Thanks To their management for this!   Great place to eat! Enjoy!

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: Mako's is a really nice restaurant! The staff was very friendly, the restaurant was nicely decorated and had great ambiance. The food and drinks we ordered were delicious. One of the previous reviews mentioned the Aunt Bees Knees being delicious so I decided to try it and it was really good. My wife got the salmon and I ordered the Pork Shoulder. The salmon was delicious (probably not worth $30 but it did taste very good) and the pork shoulder was also very good as well. One thing I will caution in regards to the pork shoulder is that it is very fatty. There was a lot of fat on the sides of the lean pork that added flavor for sure but wasn't very healthy. We also ordered the Brussels sprouts as an appetizer and they were delicious. A lot of good flavor.   We enjoyed our time at Mako especially since the staff was so nice. However, the price was really not worth it. I'm going to give it 5 stars bc there isn't a 4.5 star option and the experience was worth more than a 4 but I don't think I'd be coming back mainly because of the price of the food. It was good though; so if you don't mind paying extra then this is a good spot for date night or to enjoy a nice evening dinner.   Overall: 4.5 stars

reviews.author: Nancy G.
reviews.description: If you're looking for fine dining , a place to celebrate something special, or just want fantastic food and feel extra special them look no further than Mako's!  We celebrated our anniversary and wanted to experience a place we hadn't been to.  Walking in we were immediately seated.  Wait staff was jovial and attentive.   Our appetizers were very good and filling (we should have only ordered one but couldn't decide between the two) fried Brussels and Levantine trio. Our entrees were equally difficult to choose but ultimately my husband ordered the 1855 beef coulotte, medium rare.  It was cooked exactly how he wanted with red on the center and juices running in every bite.  You could even taste the hint of coffee spice.  The turnips and carrots were prepared in a Marchand de vin sauce, complimented it nicely.  My entree was the chickpea crusted salmon.  I loved every bite!  It had a slight char on the outside but very moist on the inside.  The tomato and eggplant stew it came with also delicious.   Easily a five star restaurant that I'd recommend and plan on returning to.

reviews.author: John K.
reviews.description: We had a party of about 25-30 people, talk about organized chaos. The servers were on top of it as we were changing seats, walking around, it was definitely professional.  The booking and reserving was so easy too.  Everyone enjoyed their food, my paella was awesome. I also tried their steak and their fried chicken...I would order it all if I could afford it. There is no competition with flavor and quality of their ingredients.  I thank the restaurant and we all enjoyed our time.

reviews.author: William V.
reviews.description: I don't usually leave bad reviews, but unfortunately I feel compelled to in this case.  We ordered the butternut squash bisque, scallops, and paella.  Butternut squash bisque was basically flavored oil with some seeds... there was literally a layer of oil on the top when it came out... I still pressed on and gave it a chance though... it tasted ok at best... In general I'm a human vacuum cleaner so I ate the entire thing, but I would not recommend it if you're looking for an actual bisque/soup.  The scallops were tiny and it only came with 3.... The bed of risotto that the scallops were on had a very odd taste... not like an old taste, or like the food was rotten, it was just seasoned horribly. Again I stomached the entire thing, but the portion size was so small that I was done with the entire plate in literally 3-4 bites.... Total rip-off for the $34 price point.   The Paella.... my mom sent it back.. i tried it before she did though and I wouldn't have been able to stomach it. It was absolutely horrible. Terrible flavor, overcooked seafood, odd tasting sausage, and about 1/4 cup of rice... we couldn't even see the rice when the plate first came out because there was so little. Is this shrinkflation or just normal for this place? I have no idea...   I would not normally have even posted this review but.... After we told the server we'd be sending the Paella back, she stopped by the table that the owner was sitting at and let him know... He never came over to talk to us about it.... and when the server came back, she said the kitchen agreed that it was bad LOL. What?   They were nice enough to comp that dish, but again, the owner/manager/whoever never came by to talk to us about it, apologize, ask how everything else was, nothing.... On our way out we walked past the table the owner was sitting at... he said "sorry about that, have a good one." LOL  Never again

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: The Food and atmosphere is awesome. We have been coming here since they opened. Have never been disappointed. They have a great brunch and Happy Hour. Best old fashion in town!

reviews.author: Tamara N.
reviews.description: Went here for my birthday dinner and really enjoyed the ambiance. The drinks were tasty and the food was good! Service was a bit slow considering how little people there were and the food portions were a bit small considering the price. However, it was overall very enjoyable and would recommend for a cute night out!

reviews.author: Antoinette H.
reviews.description: My husband and I went here for the first time and luckily arrived before happy hour was over.  We ordered the deep fried brussel sprouts and they were the best tasting brussel sprouts I ever had! I had the salmon meal and my husband ordered the seafood paella.  Everything was fresh and delicious.  We are looking forward to coming back in the near future and luckily it's close to where we live.

reviews.author: Brandon M.
reviews.description: I'm only giving 4 stars because you need a reservation, but when you show up the place is empty. We tried just showing up with out one and Theo place was empty, but they said we could not be seated without a reservation.

reviews.author: Terri M.
reviews.description: Great place. The food was excellent. Staff very friendly and funny.  Beautifully decorated. Nice patio.  Say they have music. Did not for brunch, hope they will.  Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Eagle E.
reviews.description: "Mako on the Creek"I pulled into their parking lot which was super full of cars, things were really happening here! I called from the parking lot and asked the hostess the question "can you accommodate a party of one,   the hostess said hold on one moment let me check with my manager and see. She came back shortly and said yes we would love to have you, however,  we are extensively busy and there might be a longer wait for your dinner than normal. She then went on to say HOWEVER,, we will make sure that your drinks are right on time.    OMG, this place is amazing, the drinks were amazing the food was amazing and funny enough there was no long wait for my food, Mako on the Creek was amazing! I wish I knew the hostesses name to compliment,  the amazing bartender's name is Sara and the general manager is the most wonderful person....and, the  Chef gets huge kudos for his expertise in his craft. The Ribeye was amazing! Mako on the Creek is amazing!

reviews.author: Ofelia C.
reviews.description: My husband made a reservation here for my birthday and everything was amazing. From the service to the aesthetic and especially the food. Our waitress was very attentive and on point with everything. The food was amazing, I really enjoyed the strong yet delicious whiskey sours while waiting for our food.. The rib eye was tender and very tasty, the octopus was tender and divine! My girls (daughters) enjoyed their food as well considering they are picky. I would absolutely come back. Definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Tyrone B.
reviews.description: This is a nice and very good restaurant a must try if your in Cibolo. The tomahawk steak was delicious and the mussels were awesome. Would recommend a try.

reviews.author: Warren P.
reviews.description: I give this place a 5 star just on the restaurant ambience alone. Industry is open, fun and relaxing. The food is outstanding. We had the pork tacos and quesadillas which were excellent. The sweet tea is also a nice drink if your into teas. They have a patio area which is comfortable and allows for a cool indoor - outdoor experience.   I'm new to San Marcos but this is going to be my first " go-to" when I need a great taco. Hands down a highly recommend!

reviews.author: Larry C.
reviews.description: Good food, TERRIBLE SERVICE! My daughter finished her lunch before mine showed up. I had to ask the waitress where mine was, she checked and said it was next up. 10 minutes later still no lunch. I checked and it was behind 4 other orders! Their excuse was that mine had to be cooked, but it doesn't take 30 minutes to tear up a couple tortillas, heat them in salsa and fry a couple eggs to put on top!  They won't have another opportunity to provide me with bad service and excuses!

reviews.author: Deya Z.
reviews.description: Food was amazing but service was eh. I've been to my fair share of food halls and similarly set up places, but this one was a little confusing walking in. Think hop daddy or a similar restaurant. Once you order at the front, grab your seat and make yourself comfortable. I stopped by on a Saturday early afternoon, and luckily enough it wasn't super busy. If you if anyone was wearing a mask. But since this is Texas I guess COVID doesn't exist.  Onto the food! I ordered off of their brunch menu which was super delicious. The Chilla Quiles were enormous l!!    I sat down at the bar, which was OK and really where my four-star review comes from. The bartender was nice enough, but really didn't seem interested in actually serving people. She's definitely one of those bartenders that wants to give you your drink and then get you out of her face. It wasn't super clear to me how to check out so I asked another random person that came by and they were kind enough to explain the process to me. Being from out of town, folks in Texas sure aren't as nice as we say we are. And I say this as someone born and raised in Texas.

reviews.author: Jes T.
reviews.description: Randomly ended up here.  Great environment.  I ordered the pork pancakes and it was definitely something different.  I also accidentally ordered a breakfast shot, which I thought was just a drink.   It ended up being good and unique but got me buzzed so I had to chill a bit since I'm not a big drinker.  I was mostly passing through on a lazy Sunday but would enjoy coming back.

reviews.author: Kimberly G.
reviews.description: We happened to be in the area and stumbled across Industry as a brunch option. First, today is pretty cold outside and their wall windows (?) are wide open. I get it, it's their design. We were considering finding another spot, but decided to stay and try it out. I ordered the chilaquiles w/ chicken, hubs got the chicken sando, and we had a side of the green chile queso. The food came out at a decent pace. The queso was barley luke warm. Why? It tasted okay, flavors are nothing special, but I was expecting it to be warmer than what it was. When our order came out, my chilaquiles were also luke warm, if not almost cold. Is the cold air chilling the food quicker than normal? Probably not. The side of beans and rice I had was piping hot and I ate that towards the end of my meal. The chilaquiles were made w/ the chips that they serve with their chips and dip; not a fan of that. The hub's sando was good. Overall, 3 stars cuz the flavors weren't that bad: I was willing to overlook the cold dining room, but not the almost cold food.

reviews.author: Heather R.
reviews.description: TLDR a-ok to I'm a fan despite some bumps  My first time ordering for pickup. Everything was delicious, it was ready at the time promised. The big flaw was I didn't get the beer battered squash I ordered and paid for, but as Mr R didn't check the bag before leaving we cannot lay that all on them. It was a very busy night and mistakes happen.  The other error was I didn't get the 30% off to-go booze still advertised on their online menu which is why this isn't 5*  Mr R is besotted with their black bean veggie burger. I think there must be spice in the patty as none of the other listed ingredients explain its lovely low heat. He also likes the texture of the bean patty, he wanted me to mention that.  The salmon burger was good, huge, nice fresh veg, I love the spice in the aioli and poblano ranch, but I REALLY wish they still did the smoked salmon bagel I had one brunch there long ago.  The farm beet salad? Gorgeous. Mr R gleefully ate most of it on his own and he often eats salads with a sense of duty rather than joy. I loved the white balsamic vinaigrette it came with, I'm going to need that more often in my life.  The drinks to go? Hooray! One note, bring your own standard brown pulp drink tray if you think you'll need one because they didn't provide one. The pours were fabulous on our mimosas, The Closer and White Box. Ice was the perfect amount.  The transaction could have gone smoother, but the meal went down great. This remains a place Mr R wants to go *every* time he's in town.

reviews.author: Josseline R.
reviews.description: We ordered from UberEats and after having them call to say they were out of the Salmon Burger and Catfish with Chips we opted out for the Chicken Friend Chicken and Fried Chicken Burger. The order was delayed by 35 minutes which is understandable since they had to switch out our meals. But once we got our meals we realized the sides that come with the entres were missing completely as well.  Starving my friend dug into his Chicken Fried Chicken and I took a few bites of the sandwich. He was basically done with it when he cut into the last bits and realized that the food was indeed cold and fleshy. I stopped to look at mine and I was baffled by the underlying pink on the bottom of the chicken patty. He immediately regurgitate it back up and I stopped and threw the rest of my sandwich away.    We spent over 70 dollars on a meal that had to be thrown away. The only things we did eat were our Brussels sprouts and cheese fries.   Will not be eating here again.

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Great burger and fries. Mixed drinks very good. Service also very good. Definitely will return!

reviews.author: Valle K.
reviews.description: This was my first time to have brunch at Industry. I gave them an over all three stars only because they lost one star on my dish, I ordered biscuits and gravy super dry not enough gravy for the portion of the biscuit. Then they lost the second star because half way through my meal, my mimosa never arrived! I was parched and when I asked the waitress she said " I lost your ticket, I will put in your  order" I don't understand how that even works when you order at the front of the restaurant.  The food could be warmer came out cold. The presentation of the food was great, customer service was great, the ordering process smooth.

reviews.author: Dawn M.
reviews.description: Hip spot for beer, cocktails and satisfying pub grub with a twist. The burgers and fries are tops, and the salmon burger is very tasty. The loaded nachos are over the top and amazing, can feed an army. Great corner hang with friendly bartenders and staff.

reviews.author: Brii R.
reviews.description: I was on a road trip and decided to stop here and try it out. I stopped during brunch time. The menu options were limited. The food was decent but I enjoyed the atmosphere the most - very chill and open.

reviews.author: Skih N.
reviews.description: First time here was pretty okay. I ordered the brisket tacos which were $13 with a side of chips, i thought the proportions were way too small given the price. I also expected the tacos to be a bit bigger but were still good tasting. The mac and cheese tho, was p bomb ngl. Overall, the restaurant and staff were nice, I might come here again.

reviews.author: Holmes O.
reviews.description: Madison ... Madison... Madison! She was absolutely wonderful today. Welcoming.. knowledgeable and provided an amazing customer experience today. Can't wait to see you guys soon!   - Holmes

reviews.author: Halee G.
reviews.description: MANNNN, this place is such a vibe and even better...the food is amazing. I ordered a little from every food genre and each of them hit the spot. 10/10 will definitely come again!

reviews.author: Catherine I.
reviews.description: The Moscow mule was amazing!! So I'm new to exploring San Marcos and I looked up most reviewed or topped reviewed. I am not disappointed. This place is great!

reviews.author: Mark C.
reviews.description: This place sucks! It's not satisfying nor flavorful. The chili is like soup no meat or anything in it! Yea it may look good but it's not.

reviews.author: Taylor B.
reviews.description: We came down from Dallas and made industry our 1st-night-in-town place for drinks and dinner. We had an awesome time with Thor as our bartender last time we were in town. He was there this time and we got to say hi again. We sat at the bar and Raina took great care of us! We tried 2 lagers from different TX breweries and had some great shots. I could not decide among 3 choices for dinner, so I let her pick and surprise me. She chose the al pastor tacos. They were delicious! We are only staying in San Marcos 4 days and are already planning to go back for dinner on Monday! Ps if you are a whiskey drinker, try this! It was so smooth!

reviews.author: Gem T.
reviews.description: This must be a very popular place. Came in for Sunday brunch and it was packed! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The $11  mimosa carafe special immediately got my attention. I knew I had to have that. Found us a booth on the left corner by the bar. Ordered the mimosa, 2 industry burgers, Parmesan fries and the tater tot casserole. The mimosa was disappointingly room temperature. The burgers were bordering on salty but were good. We especially liked the chips and salsa that came with it. The fries were good but a little expensive for what you get. The tater tot casserole , we didn't like at all. Very salty and the hot sauce did not go with the dish at all. Don't think we'll come back.

reviews.author: Leslie C.
reviews.description: There were mixed reviews...the adults loved their food! We had the CFC w queso - gave it two thumbs up!! We also had the chicken tacos and the person who had those raves about how good they were! We also had the queso, salsa, fried squash, loaded fries and Brussel sprouts for appetizer and all were a huge hit!! Most of the teenagers had the burgers and did not like them. They said they tasted like sausage. I think the issue is the burgers were very, very lean and smoked so they were a little dry.  The BIGGEST COMPLAINT were the flies...OMG!!! So freaking annoying to have to constantly be waving your hand back and forth so a darn fly does not land on your food!! Do something about that bc we would never come back solely for that purpose!

reviews.author: John L.
reviews.description: Loved the smoked brisket! Andi was so helpful and the atmosphere was chill. My daughter will attend TXSU in fall, I'll definitely be back to try other dishes like the pancakes... Great locally owned restaurant/bar. My wife is happy :)

name: The Growling
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: This is a really cool place to stop by and get a pint of a regional beer or refill your growler with your favorite brew to take home (growlers only, no crowlers here).  Friendly, and more importantly, knowledgeable tap masters that can match your beer tastes to the selections on tap.   You can order a pitcher of beer at this place!  I don't see this in many growler stations.  All in all, it's a very fun place.  The staff and the customers are very chill and down to earth.  It's in a strip center at the corner of LBJ and East Sessom Dr.  The address is listed on LBJ and while you can enter there, it's a lot easier if you enter from East Sesson Drive.  And there's a LOT more parking on this side.

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This is a great little dive bar in San Marcos with lots of local beers on tap. The bartender was very nice and knowledgeable and it was not very crowded at all. I love the music they play there as well. It is very low-key so if you feel like just sitting down and having a couple beers in talking with the regulars it is perfect perfect

reviews.author: Karma R.
reviews.description: We were just gonna share 1 beer and go but Ted was so cool that we sat here and talked with him and kept drinking until their first karaoke night  back since last year !!! Yassss!!! Good times good vibes good beer good peeps and good space !!!

reviews.author: Kyle S.
reviews.description: The decor of this place is very unique. You pretty much just have to see it for yourself. The walls are loaded with artwork for sale from local artists. Very interesting pieces. But enough about that.  This place is loaded with craft beer from Texas. Texas is apparently pretty big in that regard (and nearly every other regard). For a place as small and intimate as it is, there's a lot of seating packed in it and even some outdoor seating. There's games, lots of games. Card games, board games, darts, pool, and sometimes even a live DJ.  If you dig the craft brew scene this place is surely right up your alley. If you find yourself in San Marcos come check em out!

reviews.author: Laura K.
reviews.description: Part of what makes The Growling so delightful, is the atmosphere. I'm new to the craft beer scene -- and this was a perfect welcome.  The staff is friendly and can also help me decide what to order if I'm unsure. I've had fun trying to new beers and discovering what have become my go-to selections. (Bonus : All the beer they serve is from Texas!) Between the mix of good people and good beer - this has become my favorite bar.

reviews.author: Taylor M.
reviews.description: Went to this local brew house last night and I was absolutely blown away. They have all Texas craft beers, 28 on tap, fresh, and they even have a few selections in cans and some wine!      I was shocked when I saw they had The Infinite Monkey Theorem Rose' ....impressive.   The vibe is awesome. Super laid back, chill, artsy, and hipster. Loves it.       The owners are lovely people. So nice, great service, and very informative on every single beer. They make it their priority to get the perfect beer for you.   They have some savory oyster crackers for you to enjoy while you booze it up. Cards Against Humanity is also available to play for free!        The decor was my favorite. I was super into the refurbished wooden pallets, the art work, the baby succulents, and the colors!   Will definitely be returning many more evenings.

reviews.author: Michelle O.
reviews.description: I love this bar! There are dogs! I repeat, this is a dog bar! I wish we had dog bars in San Antonio. I had no idea San Marcos was so cool. This is the first bar I visited in SMTX and I was very impressed. Very cool vibe, lots of dogs to pet and neat art on the walls. I like that they have board games and such. I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: Dustin W.
reviews.description: This place has the best tap selection in San Marcos, hands down. No place in town even comes close to getting the quality beers that this bar does. The owner is always a great help for beer selection and a super cool dude. Try a craft beer or get your growler filled. I highly recommend The Growling!

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a variety of beers in a laid back spot- this is the place. We tried a variety of beers from a variety of places and the bar staff was very knowledgeable in guiding our visit. Definitely enjoyed, and will be back!

reviews.author: Brandee A.
reviews.description: In San Marcos for the weekend and checked this place out for a few beers based on the great Yelp rating. Yelpers are definately right on the mark here. Great selection of Texas beers. Very helpful staff who encouraged us to sample several based on our likes including several blends we may not have thought of trying. 2 beers led to 3 and then 4. Sad to leave but had a game to catch. Until next time, keep up the great cheer and beer!

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: This place is super duper dope! Great selection, continuously changing taps all from Texas. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff, free street fighter, and chill vibes. Great place to hang out and drink delicious Texas beer.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: As far as growler places in San Marcos, The Growling is as good as it gets!  With that being said, I've been to growler places in the greater Austin area and IMHO, I think The Growling is better than most of them.  As previously mentioned, there are 28 beers on tap, all Texas-made stuff, but unlike other growler places I've been to they have a bar and you can drink a pint, invite friends, and just hang out. The owners are super friendly and work hard to set you up with the perfect craft beer experience! They even have a stage setup for live music and get live acts mostly on the weekend.  Also, as previously mentioned, there is no kitchen but they allow outside food and with Pie Society, Bobcat nation, Dos Gatos, Mocas/Javas, Rose Garden (Chinese), and Thai Thai in close proximity; you won't have to go far to fight off those hunger cravings! They haven't been open very long (less than 2 months) so they're off to a slow start but hopefully as word gets out they'll start getting busier and maybe even expand on what's an already great start! If you're in San Marcos for the River, the Square, the Hill Country, or in school looking to skip class, The Growling is every bit worth checking out!

reviews.author: Toni V.
reviews.description: Nothing like a craft brew to quench your thirst any day of the week! What a great spot - the staff is very welcoming and friendly and are very knowledgeable about the different brews on tap to help you find the right one to fit those taste buds. The beer flight the bartenders picked/poured for me were great and I look forward to coming back and tasting the other brews on tap. Looks like I found a great alternative to overcrowded beergardens in Austin so cheers to more trips I'll be making to San Marcos!

reviews.author: Lianne S.
reviews.description: The Growling always has good vibes, smooth tunes, and awesome art/entertainment selection tasty brews and great company with Manny and the undrownable countess !

reviews.author: Tabitha G.
reviews.description: Great place to hang out at the end of a long day! There are games to play on the tables, cool music, and good films running on the tv. Sometimes they have live music which is always great! Come by and check them out!

reviews.author: Lucy H.
reviews.description: So glad to discover this place! Excellent selection and awesome atmosphere, bar guy, and fellow customers.

reviews.author: Amrendra K.
reviews.description: The place is amazing, you can walk in with your dog and order food from outside. Barman is amazing, actually they take turns, the one I like is the one who lets a scorpion and is super crazy. He will always recommend the right craft beer for you. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Phoebe M.
reviews.description: Best selection of beers in sm!! They have electric jellyfish. they'll give you samples till you find what you want! Amazing service. A little pricey for a drink in a college town, but appropriate for the establishment I think.

reviews.author: Pasha C.
reviews.description: Great selection! Very relaxed and mellow atmosphere. They always have tons of beer on tap and they are all Texas beers. Plus the staff is very helpful at suggesting beers.

reviews.author: Travis W.
reviews.description: Seriously awesome local beers.  The bartender is extremely knowledgeable. A true hidden gem for craft brews of Texas.

reviews.author: L S.
reviews.description: Awesome place!!!! Great selection of spirits!! The people there are very friendly and knowledgable. We also like giving our support to this locally (non franchised) business

reviews.author: Ju L.
reviews.description: Long overdue review, but I appreciated the gentleman who wrapped my last minute Christmas gift. I just asked for a paper bag but he went the extra miles to make it all nice with wrapping paper and bow. Thanks :) will be back

reviews.author: William D.
reviews.description: Nope, will not return here.  Barely a mumble from store employee after entering their store that was empty of patrons.  I remember coming here at their Grand Opening and they were a lot more enthusiastic about their customers. Hopefully, they will find better help soon.

reviews.author: Mike K.
reviews.description: Will not be returning here. Selection is ok not great, service is ok, however , these days most do not carry cash and to be up charged for using a debit card to pay for the CC service is a joke, and pay attention to the amount  almost 4% of the total, I am thinking another way to profit a little at a time. Just bad business not whiskey business

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: I waked into this store not expecting much.  Boy, was I wrong.  He has a really good selection of bourbon.  I walked out with a bottle that I've never seen on any other shelf, anywhere else.  It wasn't much more expensive than the larger stores, and he actually had it.  I didn't even check out the scotch selection, which I  need to go back and do.  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Karen P.
reviews.description: They have a good selection but they are kinda pricey. Perfect if you just need a bottle but not if you're looking to restock several items.

reviews.author: Sarah E.
reviews.description: Came in to make it quick liquor store run, left with two welcoming friends and a much greater appreciation of all the options at my fingertips. Waylon and Weston where more than available to answer questions and make recommendations and overall create a hospitable and enjoyable shopping experience. I look forward to going back and taking some friends with me because I know we won't be disappointed in the party they help supply!

reviews.author: Geary H.
reviews.description: One of the first things when I entered their store, their dog "Whiskey" greeted me, then the owners. Handshakes when you show up; that's Texas! Whiskey Business has a diverse, quality, well-priced inventory. They had everything I needed. Even took home a six of Boerne Brewery's Old Courthouse Ale at the owner's suggestion. It's like he knew what I'd like. He did. One of my favorites is an Irish dry stout {think Guinness}, and I've now found a new favorite. Love it! I'll make Whiskey Business my go-to. Thank you for your hospitality!

reviews.author: Kodi S.
reviews.description: A new liquor store in town! Great selection, I put in a few requests and they had them in by the next visit. The staff is awesome, very friendly folks. I wont lie, I'm a regular now mostly because of their dog- Whiskey. ‍

reviews.author: Nechelle D.
reviews.description: Knowledgeable and courteous service. Definitely where I'll always go and send everyone!

reviews.author: Adam W.
reviews.description: Come ON! How much fun is your own private, traveling bar? Serving only the finest of beverages, you'll have a quality time with these quality brews.

reviews.author: Rita M.
reviews.description: When you hear the word BUS one would normally think about a city bus or there like. This is not the case for the Crafty Thirst Beer Bus, no it's a VW van that is being used to serve beer. We were passing by and noticed a sign that said Grand Opening. We stopped to check out this Grand Opening. We were approached by this creepy guy smoking a cigarette as he said do you have ID, we showed our drivers licenses and instead of saying thank you, have a nice day anything he just stared at us. We were reading the list of beers that were offered. It was a little confusing as there was no direction on what the beers were are how much they were. We decided to order at the VW "BUS". We were asking what different types of beers were available and how much they were. The guy that was helping us (later found out was the one of the owners) passed us to someone else. We thought that was rude but the lady that served us made up for it. The beers were $7.00 dollars for a 9 ounce or you could get 4 -  7 ounces for $10.00 dollars to me that is extremely high. Most of the places in Canyon Lake have beers for $2.50. The beer we had, had more of a foam head on it and we were not offered to top it off. Another guy was serving mixed drinks one with Pecan Rum. The mixed drinks were $7.00 dollars, high for the area and the amount you get. I will confess that the rum was one of the best I have had. A few times I heard other people saying that the price's were too high. If you can get a beer for $2.50 then why would someone pay $7.00 dollars. The band was the only entertainment and they were amazing. There was suppose to be a raffle for the VW BUS but when I asked about it I was told that it was not going to take place. This was troubling being that I was told by the owner that it was the main giveaway.

reviews.author: Gene H.
reviews.description: Stopped in last weekend for a drink and some good curry, we were not disappointed.  Beer selection is good, we ordered two trios so we could get a taste of everything, it was all delicious.  Nice being able to sit outside too.  Thanks for a great meal!

reviews.author: Julia G.
reviews.description: North Street is a coffee shop, beer bar, and Indian restaurant... and it's amazing.  We went late (well late for us, it was 8pm) on a rainy Saturday night. It was medium busy, most of the indoor tables were filled up and the bar had a few other people. We sat at bar seating and were helped right away. Being so close to the university, it's a college vibe.   I ordered a chai hot chocolate, it was amazing. Something about hot chocolate on a rainy day.....  We ordered loaded samosas (Vegetable samosas topped with chana masala, curry queso, cilantro walnut chutney and cucumber mint raita) and a sampler trio. We got spicy powder on the side.   Great flavors. We left full and happy. If we lived in the area this would be a regular spot for happy hour.

reviews.author: Woodley P.
reviews.description: I walked in and made myself "home" by taking a seat at a table and waiting 15 minutes to be served on. The two servers walk by my table and didn't make eye contact, as though they had never seen someone with so much melanin before. They continued to serve other seated and even folks coming in for the first time. It was embarrassing. It's 2022 and the last thing I want to assume is that it was because of race. Frustrated, I walked to the bar and asked for a manager. The bartender (Josh) informed me it was the dark hair gal and that is when I was acknowledged. Josh was very nice and served me and took my order.  Josh saved the day, but they need to work on their customer service.   I had their taco and the fries were absolutely delicious! The food blunted my frustration. I will come back because I believe in 2nd chances...and of course the food.

reviews.author: Mitchell T.
reviews.description: We really wanted to like this place.  It has a great casual ambiance and we loved the place when we walked in.    We went on a Sunday, and it wasn't too busy.  There wasa couple with a great dane there, so it's dog friendly.  My bride ordered the samosas, and I ordered the curry trio with saag paneer, butter chicken, and chicken tikka masala.  We got north street fries as a appetizer.  So, the samosas came out nice and warm.  My wife thought the bread was overcooked, but she was hungry.  Perhaps it was old oil on a Sunday evening after a busy weekend.  The fries were warm-ish and a bit soggy.  The seasoning was very good, though, and the basket of fries was a good size for two.  The curry trio was disappointing.  The saffron rice was hard and warm-ish.  I don't know how else to describe it.  The Saag paneer was kind of tasteless.  I've eaten great saag paneer, and this ain't it.  The Chicken tikka masala was similarly underspiced.  The butter chicken as well, but I expect that from butter chicken.  I had ordered it as a counterpoint to what I had hoped would be some spicy dishes.  At this point, I'm wondering if it's us.  I've worked with Indian nationals that have taken me to some hole in the wall Indian places in Irvine, CA, and they absolutely knocked my socks off.  We go to many places in Texas that have a good yelp rating, and we get a lot of bland food.  We really like to patronize smaller places, and I hate to give poor ratings, but have to be honest.  We really liked the people and the place, so will give them a try again in the hopes the stars align for a better experience.

reviews.author: Andrew R.
reviews.description: I came here to meet a friend for drinks and a light lunch -- we both got appetizers since we were planning heavier dinners later that night -- and when it comes to the food and drinks, I was not disappointed.   I got the vegetable samosas, and the samosas were nearly perfect, with the potato and pea filling having just the right level of seasoning. They came with beautiful mango chutney whose chunks were visible and a lovely green chutney. Both were so delicious I was hard put to decide which I wanted to put on each of the three samosas.  For drinks I had two of the Wasatch Polygamy (a nitro porter), and it was fantastic. It had a hint of sweetness, but wasn't as overwhelming as a milk stout, but also the delicious flavor of a porter.  The patio dining was great, with plenty of shade.  The only reason I'm not giving five stars is that service was... slow, with respect to both drinks and food. Otherwise, the whole thing was outstanding.

reviews.author: Jeri T.
reviews.description: My mom and I were looking for a new place in San Marcos. We come here often from Kyle and tire of the places right on the interstate. The establishment is adorable - informal seating inside and out.   I first got some pappadum and a few chutneys-tamarind and mint. They were spicy! Caught me off guard but delicious for sure.    My mom ordered the Curry Trio with chicken curry, paneer tikka masala, and saag paneer. I ordered  a beef kabob curry taco. Every bite of every dish was delicious. While I loved my taco, I highly recommend the Curry Trio because you get a great choice.   When we first got there, I was like meh. Only a few tables were seated outside and the inside was empty. But right after we ordered, the place quickly filled up! Wow.   The service was superb. I couldn't have asked for a better server. I'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Laura R.
reviews.description: The food here is amazing and the staff is very friendly! The idea of putting a Tex-Mex twist on Indian food is brilliant.  I was very pleased with the variety on the menu and how tasty everything was. My children loved the curry queso, saag paneer, and the paratha.  My husband and I enjoyed our paneer tikka masala tacos (I had chicken).  The Mango lassi was different as it is icy and minty, but we really enjoyed it, and so did my children.  I can't wait to go back! One thing that was also really surprising is that the coffee was super good! Please remember this is a fusion restaurant, so it is not your typical Indian. I noticed a lot of lesser star reviews complained about it not being Indian food. Yet, it is Indian Tacos. It is a fun twist and something different. I highly recommend.

reviews.author: Maribel D.
reviews.description: Visiting San Marcos and North street popped up on my Yelp top restaurants.  Restaurant is in a renovated older house with super cute outdoor patio seating. We sat inside it's smaller but very cozy. They have a bar with many draft beers, wine and specialty drinks.  We started with the vegetable samosas and it came with side of mint sauce and mango chutney that was so tasty. Both complimented the samosas in a wonderful way. The flavors were amazing.  I ordered the tiki masala taco that was filled with so much flavor and very filling.       A must try!! And hubby had the trio which he choose tiki masala, curry chicken and butter chicken along with coconut rice. All three were fantastic.  Service was good and food was fantastic and very reasonably priced.  I'm excited to come back and try something new on the menu and I HIGHLY RECOMMEND North Street!! #supportsmallbusiness

reviews.author: Deepa S.
reviews.description: Nice patio, cool vibe .. we ordered below food- Chicken tikka - 2/5 Panner butter masala 4/5 Saag panner 2/5 extremely bland no flavor  Samosa 4/5 came with good chutneys

reviews.author: Irma D.
reviews.description: Ok. Here comes another Indian restaurant review. But wait! Its TexMex Indian!  Went to lunch with coworkers on the first day of fall, so we got a table outdoors, never stepped foot inside. Service was slow, but it seemed it was only one waiter, so no points taken away for that.  Server was detailed in explaining what everything was and the level of spice and comfort. We had one vegan and one spice sensitive guest in our group, so he pointed out what would be best for the group to order. I ordered chicken nachos, and paneer tacos, wanting spice and meat. Other guests ordered samosas with mango chutney, vegan nachos, and spinach paneer. It was filling enough with a beautiful presentation! The jalapeno cream mixed with tamarind on the tacos mixed perfectly with the Indian spices.  The curry on the shredded chicken and tortilla chips (couldn't tell if they were made in house or store bought) had me trying not to lock the bowl. Will definitely go back to try more items on the menu!

reviews.author: Emily P.
reviews.description: I'm not sure if the "authenticity" of the food at North Street, but what I can say is WOW it's delicious, regardless.   The building is absolutely adorable and beautifully decorated. Bathrooms are always spotless and the women's bathroom kindly offers hair ties, feminine products and occasionally mints. (It's the little things!!)  They only offer beer or wine cocktails but even the wine cocktails feel and taste pretty craft cocktail-y. The ginger lime spritz is my fave!  Being a self proclaimed queso connoisseur, I was hesitant on curry queso. Why fix what ain't broke? I was wrongly hesitant, North streets curry queso is liquid gold and oh so delicious.   I don't think there's a single bad thing on their menu.  The Katz brothers truly do no wrong

reviews.author: Josh Y.
reviews.description: Hilariously good Tex/Indian fusion. The chicken Tika and curry tacos are out of this world. The queso is ok. But seriously, if you're not already in San Marcos, come here. And eat this. It's that good. If you think you're a foodie and haven't tried this, fix that. So incredibly good. And for $9 per taco that's basically a meal and a party in your mouth, it doesn't exactly set you back much. They have a great beer selection too and cool ambiance and attentive service. But the tacos are the draw. Come here. Eat the Indian style tacos. 5 stars.

reviews.author: Abby Abby M.
reviews.description: Great food, friendly and casual ambiance. Loved my curry queso and nachos! Yum! Guillermo was super friendly and helpful with our experience.

reviews.author: Akhilesh B.
reviews.description: Hidden Gem! I have never had so much authentic flavors of North Indian food in the whole of US until I tried this small Indian place close to Texas State University. The food is great, the staff very friendly and the ambiance makes you feel you are in India!

reviews.author: Sarah S.
reviews.description: If you want Indian food, this isn't the place. And if you want to know anything about the menu, I hope you get a different waitress than we had. Nothing was spicy, everything tasted the same and our order got messed up. Would not recommend unless they changed their food and staff.

reviews.author: Catherine I.
reviews.description: I got a to go order here. The place was super cute with a nice ambiance. The food was amazing! I'll be back to dine in!

reviews.author: Rebecca P.
reviews.description: Unique spot with a mix of great options of drafts and curries!  We enjoy having different types of beers and this place has a good unique assortment of drafts to try.  I was able to get some lavender cider since it was pretty early in the day, but the porter and stout options were very tempting (some at over 12% alcohol).  The dogs were with us so we settled outside in their spacious yard that has a lot of shade and a fan blowing.  We ordered curry fries as an appetizer and they were wedged exactly like chic fil a fries seasoned in a curry mix powder.  These were good, but can do with a pinch of sugar and lots of extra spice.  I had the chicken Tikka masala plate and my husband got the chicken 65 taco.  The taco looked more like a wrap and wasn't as filling as what he expected, but tasted pretty good.  Fried chicken seasoned in sauce inside the taco had a good kick to it.  My chicken Tikka masala plate was delicious, but a little extra spice would help.  Also, I think the restaurant can do better by adding naan! Great concept to check out!

reviews.author: Rachel M.
reviews.description: This is my absolute favorite spot in San Marcos for dinner! I take all my friends here when I get the chance. It's a must any time I'm in the area!

reviews.author: Justin B.
reviews.description: Have gone twice. Service was good both times and the food is fantastic. I enjoyed and would recommend the curry trio; it allows you to try a little bit of multiple items to decide which is your favorite. Good vegetarian options as well.  Definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Adrienne E.
reviews.description: A Gem. Concept is to sit outside under the big pecan tree, eat great Indian food, watch the dogs play in the "dog park"  seating area, drink lassis or craft beer, enjoy great service and listen to their fun music selection. So relaxing and satisfying.

name: Zelicks
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Lindsey S.
reviews.description: I really love their burgers and those cheese fries are to die for. Ive also tried their pulled pork quesadilla, steak @ their steak night ( $16 every Tuesday!) and those are solid choices as well. I liked the chicken sandwich but it didn't wow me like the other items i've listed above. Bartenders and staff are super friendly. Overall a great atmosphere, especially now that it's getting chillier out!

reviews.author: Diana V.
reviews.description: A must stop in San Marcos. Really great chill vibes, good drinks, and good company. Haven't gone at night but apparently super fun!!

reviews.author: James H.
reviews.description: The staff is awful here, plenty of other places to drink in San Marcos ... look elsewhere! Also the place stinks up front, smells like sewage

reviews.author: Kimber B.
reviews.description: I love this place. Consistent good drinks, good food, good music and outstanding atmosphere.   Intimate Live music scene, chill vine with yard games check it out.

reviews.author: Griffin S.
reviews.description: Amazing spot. Great staff! Good social media presence as well... @zelicks on Instagram.

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: Hands down the best neighborhood bar in San Marcos! Tuesday night steak night is amazing. The flavor, texture and price is absolutely amazing. Best steak in town with the best signature drinks around. A great mixed crowd of really cool people, not just college kids, but true locals from all walks. Owned and run by two amazing brothers - They are deeply rooted into this community and really give back in soooo many ways. I love this place, centrally located with great drinks and fun clientele!

reviews.author: Natasha B.
reviews.description: Perfect dog friendly patio, lots of out door seating, drinks where good. Staff was nice

reviews.author: Cheech A. C.
reviews.description: This place was sick, drove by it multiple times and was a huge fan of the aesthetic. Great visuals and vibes for a nice day. The staff was however, sus. They seemed to have attitudes of a bar that is not in a college town but a boujee downtown bar. The bartender who was close to my age charged me for regular priced drinks when we ordered 2/3 of our drinks in the happy hour range. When I came to close out and order our (3rd) last drink. The bartender said "do you mind if I close you out?" I thought this was very odd as it was a Wednesday evening and I was purchasing not only alcohol but food. I do believe they have an amazing food truck that supplies great food. I am sure this was a one time fluke as the rest of the experience was great. I do stand by my opinion that the staff maybe biased to certain crowds so be weary.

reviews.author: Kimberley M.
reviews.description: Love this place!  The Blueberry Sangria is THE BOMB!  Steak night is FABULOUS!  Bartenders are awesome and the atmosphere is fantastic!  I love how diverse the clientele is, and it's just a cool place to be!

reviews.author: Jan B.
reviews.description: I love the queso and fries. I'm addicted. And my bevs are always great. Service is always timely and it has such a relaxing vibe. I always look forward to coming here....

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This is a great local San Marcos bar that has great service and some really good drinks. It is a fun place to hang out after floating the river! I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Patty T.
reviews.description: If I lived in San Marcos, THIS would be my local go-to spot. Great service, I felt very safe with their COVID rules and regulations. Loved the atmosphere and customer service and ice cold beers. My bestie and I had a mini day in San Marcos as a girls trip within in COVID rules and we loved this little spot. We found it while looking at houses in the neighborhood surrounding the bar. The staff was kind and courteous and the misters and fans were a nice cooling off touch with the Texas heat.

reviews.author: Kerra S.
reviews.description: My favorite hangout bar for casual day drinking and hanging with friends ! Always something going on from live music , art displays , to crawfish boils! They have happy hour everyday from 2-7 ( and all day on Sunday) which include a big 4$ strawberry margarita that I could dieeee for! If you are under 21 you can't stay past 7 which has always been a little upsetting considering some of my friends are underage and they are very strict about it , but still one of my favorite bars on the square .

reviews.author: Adison H.
reviews.description: Awesome spot to hang out and have some drinks. Breezy open feel with plenty of covered seating as well in case of rain. Service is fast and bartenders are very attentive.

reviews.author: Nathan T.
reviews.description: An extremely laid back bar experience. Great place to either start or end a bar crawl. A little crowded at times but that's every bar on the square. Definitely worth checking out

reviews.author: Kendall M.
reviews.description: Hands down my favorite place to get a drink in San Marcos. Great service better drinks, and atmosphere

reviews.author: Terese O.
reviews.description: Awesome bar that really has something for everyone no matter what your age is. They have a great large indoor and outdoor space making it a perfect spot to hang with friends. They even have a food truck that serves tasty bar eats. I love the michelads and bloodies. They offer many beer variations and tasty cocktails. Also, a bonus they offer HH/drink specials!

reviews.author: Stevie K.
reviews.description: Best Bloody Mary around! Cool atmosphere and love how they have their own herb garden out back. Great place to hang with friends, watch sports, and have a good drink in or outside.

reviews.author: Cheyanne H.
reviews.description: Great service, the only bar near downtown that's not riddled with frat guys and sorority girls. Dog friendly, but keep them on the leash! Friendly staff, good environment, easily my favorite bar in the area. Also, the neon sign in the women's bathroom is great, I hear the men's bathroom neon sign is pretty funny too. You must visit this place!

reviews.author: Alto G.
reviews.description: Coolest bar in town. I wish it were less crowded, but you can't be a hater when they do so much right!

name: Phoenix Saloon
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jennifer H.
reviews.description: Phoenix salon gives you all the feels of a small town (hometown bar) always great service! Open mic night on Wednesday, and always has some awesome bands playing through the weekend. FYI- chili cheese dog and some cold beers is the way to.

reviews.author: F M.
reviews.description: First time in the PS was to see Three Man Front. It was a great performance, the beer was cold, the audience and ambience was terrific, Ive heard a great deal about the Phoenix chili and how its made with sirloin, and have been eager to try it, but the kitchen has such erratic hours, that i cant seem to find out when it's available, even if i call ahead. Definitely an oppty for improved consistency.

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: Neat historic place to eat and have a beer or mixed drink. We are the angus burger with fried green tomatoes and potato wedges. The burger was dry, but that may have been due to the lean meat. The tomatoes and potatoes wedges were absolutely delicious. Have to add that we sat outside on the patio on a sunny day. The table was filthy and sticky. The staff should check outside ones in a while, or leave cleaning wipes for the guests.

reviews.author: Jena C.
reviews.description: This place is awesome!! I love old bars though I don't drink anymore but I would definitely have a beer here! This time however was just for lunch on a wonderful rainy afternoon! The hubs went with the chili and cornbread and I went with the chili fries to go!! It was so damn good!! We didn't talk to each other the whole time hahaha I say if you like sour cream get an extra one. Other than that I can't wait to eat there again!!! Love this place!!

reviews.author: Jason S.
reviews.description: Stopped in with my parents after walking around to a few other places. It was nice, cool, and the beer was cold! Bar tender was friendly and served us quickly, really glad we found this place. Looks like it could be a bit more lively at night, but for us at this moment it was perfect!

reviews.author: Kris F.
reviews.description: I loved the band! They were so fun and amazing but the bar staff was incredibly rude. Took forever to get waited on and then was told we were yelling at the bartenders which was completely untrue. If I owned this bar they would all be fired. I guess it's slim pickings with Biden as president!

reviews.author: Britney G.
reviews.description: Cool spot. I love it when owners come in and re-purpose historical buildings like this one. They have live-bands on the weekends and a decent drink list to choose from. I see a lot of people have posted about the bar food, and unfortunately, we didn't get to try it. But if we are in town again, I am eating here next time!

reviews.author: Jaclyn P.
reviews.description: They have a chili burger that will make you cry it's so good. Their menu is small but everything is so full of unique and amazing flavors! Not a huge selection on tap but we love what they do have and will be going a couple times a month now that we have found it.  Side note, their cobbler is the ish. They make it to order so it's so fresh and hot.

reviews.author: Mark O.
reviews.description: A must visit bar and restaurant in downtown New Braunfels. The Phoenix Saloon has a rich history being registered as a Texas Landmark as well as being on a tour of haunted places! They've kept up that 1800's saloon feel, very cool!  That aside, their menu is delicious. Top shelf "bar food". But the must have is their homemade chili and cornbread. It's to freaking die for! But be warned, it comes in three levels of heat. The hottest would tear up the toughest of Texas cowpokes! They also have a full bar with a multitude of craft and domestic beers on draught.  The Phoenix is also well known for their showcase of local music talent. From a laidback guy strumming a guitar on the small stage during the afternoon, to full on rock and country bands on the big stage at night on the weekend. That said, the ONLY drawback is the music (during the afternoon) can be too loud at times. Still, add the Phoenix Saloon to your list to visit (or comeback for another visit!) you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: Great place great food. We took the whole family and all liked their food and drink. The grandkids loved playing the two arcade machines. We put alot of quarters in those machines, but it was worth it with the fun they had.

reviews.author: Tania C.
reviews.description: I never give any food/drink place five stars regardless of how good they are.  Also, four stars because it's a little dark in there.  Otherwise a great place to go and be seen without getting talked about, unlike at The Faust.  Nice to visit during the day for lunch and a beverage.  Definitely has a nighttime music vibe.  Very loud, be warned, but you can take your drink outside and sit on the patio and people watch.  I'm not a beer drinker, but I'll order a screwdriver.  I go so rarely and am always amazed that the barkeep knows what I drink!  I'll grab a stool and she'll ask if I want "the usual."  Uncanny!  They could add some modern conveniences like purse hooks by the bar stools, but it's no big deal for me.  It actually keeps me from forgetting my purse if it perches on the bar counter.  I love this place so much that I have the urge to go tomorrow!

reviews.author: Carol I.
reviews.description: The Phoenix Saloon is conveniently located just off the main square on the corner of  San Antonio and Casteel with huge windows to look out to the street. I've been here several times over the years since they have opened. It's always a stop on the pub crawls!   What's not to love...  Long bar along the way for all those bar flies to hold up Lots of seating which is also great for groups Huge band stand for those night with live music Food!... how about that history of chili???  The history according to their website: "Since 1871, our building has been home to various bars and saloons, most famously the original Phoenix Saloon. It was here in 1894 that William Gebhardt, proprietor of the back room cafe, invented chili powder! Prior to this, chilis had only ever been used fresh, but Gebhardt devised a process for crushing and drying them. Gebhardt brand chili products are still widely available today. The original Phoenix Saloon was reputedly the first bar in Texas to offer service to women. No lady who valued her reputation would dare be seen in a saloon, so the proprietor set up a ladies beer garden with bells in the trees for service. There was a deer pen too, and an alligator pit and badger fights. There was even a parrot on a perch just inside the front door that was taught to say, "Have you paid your bill!?" in German! Prohibition put an end to the good times at the Phoenix, which closed its doors on June 26, 1918. The Ludwig Building, as it was then known, was expanded and turned into a department store in 1922. In 1935, by now renamed the Schmidt Building, it was remodeled again. The building was home to a number of retail and service businesses until the Phoenix rose from the ashes, so to speak, on March 5, 2010. Like its mythical namesake, the Phoenix Saloon has been reborn! The new owners relish the building's flavorful past. In bringing the new incarnation to life, they've exposed the original 1871 brick wall, salvaged the old Phoenix Saloon beadboard paneling and re-used various old shutters, sinks and lights. Trying to celebrate all aspects of the building, they also constructed the 40-foot-long bar from the old department store cabinetry, flipped a mirror from the old shoe department upside down behind the bar and relocated a three-way dressing room mirror in the ladies restroom."  The Phoenix is also to be reported as being haunted... with such history, this shouldn't be a surprise.... Boo!   So go grab a local beer and some Texas Red with Fritos and a burger on the side... it's time to have a good 'ol time in downtown NB!

reviews.author: Michele Z.
reviews.description: The atmosphere was great and they had a full bar but they were known for the chili but they were out. The burger was good and so was the fried pickles but who runs out of their signature dish.

reviews.author: Patti W.
reviews.description: Horrible customer service.  We came to Phoenix to have a beer and a burger.  It was 6:45 pm on New Years Eve and there were only 18 people seated in the restaurant.  All the tables rest of the tables were labeled with a reserved sign for 7:30.  We were not acknowledged or offered any explanation why there was no seating available.  We felt as if the employees were staring at us waiting for us to leave. And that's what we did.  We walked across the street to KRAUSE's where we were welcomed.

reviews.author: Tache W.
reviews.description: Loved the vegan chili nice historic place for booze and food. I prefer my chili spicy! Didn't try other things as i was going vegan.

reviews.author: St C.
reviews.description: Went here after eating at McAdoo's on a Tuesday afternoon.  Enjoyed the South African bartender who let us try a couple of the drafts before picking out the right one.  There are a number of choices but I ended up with the Scotch Ale that was perfect.  We then wondered over and played a couple games of checkers.  Perfect afternoon!

reviews.author: Itsabout T.
reviews.description: Came for the chili and history.  They have 4 heat level chilis. They all start from the same base chili and then peppers are added ranging from jalepenos to ghost chilis. I stopped at habanero. Not blazing but good heat.  The toppings are pricy at $0.75 each for small amounts of onion, cheese, sour cream, etc. it adds up quickly.  The chili flavor is tasty. Large chunks or as they say hunks of browned sirloin (seemed like chuck) are widely dispersed in a thickened chili sauce. I prefer 80% meat with just enough reduced chili stock, theirs is more like 50:50.  Moved on to the blue burger. Menu says stuffed with blue cheese but it is actually mixed in the meat. It was well prepared and tasty.  The atmosphere is super chill and the Night Owls were on stage tonight, I'm impressed! Service is mostly order at the bar.  I'm pretty much a chili snob, I only like my own creation but theirs is pretty good if someone else is making it for you.

reviews.author: Lonnie R.
reviews.description: 4 stars for being a bar. Great band playing the night I was there. Reasonably priced beers. No table service but that was OK. They needed to pick up more of the empty bottles and glasses a bit more regularly.

reviews.author: Rose N.
reviews.description: My boyfriend asked me to write this review.  Eeks! Me thinks not. We came here for chili one night. 8/9 or 8/10. When we arrived the blonde bartender was assisting another customer for a hot 5 minutes. When she came over to us we asked to order food and she said the kitchen closed ONE MINUTE BEFORE. But ma'am, we have been standing here for a while... If someone took our order when we arrived, we wouldn't've been in this pickle. The place was not busy (2-3 3 tops max). I understand the kitchen is closed but I'm sure, positive even, that they don't throw out the chili as soon as the second hand hits 12. You could've asked the kitchen to scoop one bowl of chili out in exchange for money, and I bet $100 they would've done it. Why? Because I ask my kitchen guys all the time.   We will not be coming back and my boyfriend would like to speak to management/owners. Thanks.

reviews.author: Lindsey D.
reviews.description: We brought our family of 6 tonight. The food was AMAZING and the service was great. The only reason we didn't give 5 stars was because they didn't have a kids menu and you have to order your food at the bar, which is hard for a family of 6!  Burgers were perfectly cooked and the chili is the best I've had! The local beer selection was nice too!

name: Patio Dolcetto
accommodations: Street Parking, Private Lot Parking, Valet Parking

reviews.author: Eileen R.
reviews.description: Such a nice little hidden gem! Excellent service, super friendly staff. Yummy pizza and get the cheese plate!  Good nightly specials.

reviews.author: Erica N.
reviews.description: This place was so cute. Stumbled upon it as we were looking for a spot in San Marcos and went on a Tuesday night and dang, this place is poppin on a Tuesday!  All the outdoor spots were taken, so we made our way to the upstairs outdoor balcony, until we were able to snag a table downstairs (which is where you want to be). We quickly found out it was BINGO night. Yes, bingo night! No, it wasn't a bunch of boomers either! I wish I had gotten her name, but the girl hosting Bingo was incredible - great personality with lots of jokes and she def knew how to work a crowd!  Cons - sadly there are some. The sangria flight is awfully sweet. The pizzas are good but took soooo long to get. The food menu is very small so you better not come starving or with a picky eater.  However, if we're ever in the San Marcos area again, we will definitely be back to just enjoy a night on their outdoor patio!

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: We have enjoyed this place for years! Super nice atmosphere, relaxing vibe, great drinks and food. We celebrate birthdays here with a free drink! My favorite is the chocolate martini. The owner, Jean Paul, is very hospitable. My boyfriend has his art hanging inside.

reviews.author: Stacey S.
reviews.description: What a cool spot! Food and service was great. Everything was reasonably priced. Flight of cider was so good. Loved the blackberry one from a place in Sequin. Pizza was delicious but the recipe that I loved the most was the baked Brie! Can't wait to come back her and enjoy the very chill atmosphere.

reviews.author: Lori W.
reviews.description: Cute little place. Staff is always friendly! Drinks are super tasty and they have a great assortment! I love happy hour!! Their two level patio is very nice and relaxing!

reviews.author: Catherine I.
reviews.description: This place is absolutely amazing!!! It's so charming and romantic. The food is delicious. The drinks are great then the music is fantastic for the atmosphere. The staff are so sweet. I'd definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Mike A.
reviews.description: Great service and atmosphere. Plus they currently have a rotating $5 wine that is great for those feeling adventurous.

reviews.author: Patsy R.
reviews.description: Cozy and comfortable stop with fabulous wines and cocktails and a tasty little menu of all kinds of delicious eats. Service was really friendly and we felt welcomed from the moment we arrived. It was too cold to sit outside but looking forward to coming back when we can- the patio was beautiful.

reviews.author: Mildred A.
reviews.description: Shelby and Grace were great helps all night! Cider flight- problem the best idea i had other than ordering the pizza ! The blackberry mead was probably my fave cider! Also the cider flight is $10!  The pizzas are pretty good! I got the white blanc both times and added pepperoni and jalapeños to one and just jalapeños to the other!  Again, i place to stop by after floating the river( normal times) or shopping at the outlets!

reviews.author: Michele L.
reviews.description: We had an excellent meal and loved the buy a bottle get a pizza for free deal.  Everything was delicious and the outside area was perfect. I want to go back for the cider flight.

reviews.author: Cydnee R.
reviews.description: This place is AMAZING. We saw it while driving around looking for somewhere to go and it caught our eye so we checked it out. We were a bit more casually dressed as I would've liked, but it's okay because it was our first visit.   The vibes here are amazing. Everything looks nice and sophisticated. We both had drinks, a couple of martinis and something else that I can't quite remember.   The Brie was something new to my boyfriend, and we really enjoyed it. My Margherita pizza was perfect and my boyfriend Chicken Blanc pizza was also sooo good. I think his was better than mine, lol!   I recommend this place to everyone I run into. It's so cute and the perfect date night

reviews.author: Dana C.
