reviews.description: We popped in early for Valentines Day and enjoyed a bottle of sparkling rose' with the baked Brie. The service, wine, Brie, and ambiance were quite good. We will return...

reviews.author: Ashley R.
reviews.description: Obsessed with this place! I've been many times before but we went for my friends 22nd birthday today and loved it. The pizzas are AMAZING and our waitress, Kennedy, was so nice and patient. Everything on the menu is 10/10 !!!

reviews.author: Lacey P.
reviews.description: We arrived around 10:30pm on Saturday, and we could sit wherever we want, minimal people there. Our order was taken quickly and the drinks/food were super fast as well. I highly recommend for a place to get drinks and talk with friends, but be mindful that the food is finger-food and limited!

reviews.author: Lilly V.
reviews.description: we loved Shelia!!! she was amazing. she took care of us and made us feel so comfortable   love pat dolc and love Shelia!!!!!

reviews.author: Koral R.
reviews.description: Baked Brie and white sangria was a must. Order a flight of beer for the friend. We all enjoyed the ambiance and the fact that there was heaters outdoors for us.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: Tonight we tried out this quaint wine bar for the first time. For a tapas bar, they offer a limited menu. This is the only reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars Bec we expected more selection. They have a few cheese plate options and small gourmet pizzas. I chose the pear and bacon pizza, which was delicious. my husband had a pepperoni pizza. I also ordered a sangria flight, which was quite nice. On Thursday nights they offer a free lava cake with the purchase of a flight. The lava cake was tasty. The servers were friendly and the decorations were nice.

reviews.author: Madeline C.
reviews.description: Pizza is amazing, definitely individual sized. Try the pear and bacon! Drinks were good priced and were amazing. Had a great night here! 100 would recommend. Loved our server! The lights were too cute on the patio!

reviews.author: Kelsey B.
reviews.description: I stopped here with a friend on our drive from Austin to San Antonio and will definitely be making the trip back to San Marcos to visit again! I ordered the white sangria, which fair warning was very sweet but it was still delicious. The menu said the white sangria had ginger in it, although I didn't taste that specific ingredient I was hoping for, it was still a good choice. They do wine flights as well, and have a pretty good happy hour.  We ordered a cheese board and sat at the bar. The cheese board was generous and filling, the service was great, and the atmosphere was on point. It is a casual wine bar, and they had live music outside which would have been nice to watch aside from the cold weather. They have a lot of seating outside, and a good amount of community seating inside.  Overall, great experience here and will be hopefully going back!

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: Nice environment and atmosphere :)   Better service the second time around.

name: Taproom Pub and Grub
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: F M.
reviews.description: The beer selection is fantastic. The food is is equally fantastic: good portions, tasty. One of my son's and my favorite places.

reviews.author: Ricardo J.
reviews.description: In response to Samantha S. from my previous review - I am glad that my description was accurate in allowing you to identify the employee to whom I was referring. You said I was "punching down for laughs" when he was greeting me to your establishment.   First of all, he was the one "punching down" since he kept making his jokes loud so that all the other employees around could have a laugh. He never greeted me to the establishment. Also, I kept my mouth shut, took his rudeness in stride, manned up, and moved on. Apparently his and your feelings were hurt by my relatively insignificant review and you just had to make a public display.   I neither live in the area nor will return to your business, and in the end, neither of us should really care.

reviews.author: Tyler E.
reviews.description: Wing size is terrible. The wait was a little longer than I'm used to but that's ok. I just don't understand how small the drum sticks are. They are baby chicken size. WTF.

reviews.author: Stephanie B.
reviews.description: I used to love this place as a young college kid but now that I am older it just didn't cut it for me.   The food is good but it's super sloppy and too much.  The service is okay.  They have a good drink selection.

reviews.author: Anna T.
reviews.description: We were in town and decided to stop by for lunch and reminisce on the good old days. We came in knowing it was under new management but wanted to still give it a shot. The waitress was very attentive and checked in on us often, and when she gave us the menus we instantly realized NOTHING WAS THE SAME. I had always ordered (and was craving) the jalapeño queso burger but that was now named something else, and based on the description I knew I wouldn't be a fan. We both ordered their 1/4 smash burger with grilled onions and a basket of fries. When we got our order we both looked at each other and knew this was not the Taproom we had during college. The food itself was okay (not great as before) and the amount of grilled onions was significantly less... unless we are in an onion shortage I feel more could've been given. After we finished eating we both agreed this would probably be our last time coming for a while. Just not the same.   Again, the waitress was very attentive, checked in often and food was okay, but it's hard to not compare the past to present.

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: Food was great, beer was cold.  Place is always noisy, but as it is a pub, I can get past that.    We were seated at the bar and were served by the bartender.  He did a great job, was wonderful to talk to, and made great menu suggestions.    Excellent appetizers...great burgers.    A great stop in SMTX.

reviews.author: Lindsey S.
reviews.description: I like to get The Works burger with some barbecue on the side! For fries i prefer the wedge cut fries. my partner tried the mac n cheese burger and chili cheese fries and they were huge! The don't skimp here, and the service is nice as well.

reviews.author: Sanaz D.
reviews.description: Wonderful burgers! We were a group of 19 people, went in all hungry and got out super happy with the food. Amazing taste of burger and really good service in spite of the busy hour we went in on a Saturday.

reviews.author: Hira S.
reviews.description: Mixed feelings about this. I came with a party of seven so I expected the service to be a little delayed. That being said, we all got burgers so I feel like it could have been faster? The food hit the spot after a day on the river but just to get the waiters attention was hard work as they only had 4 people on duty. Then to pay the check again it was another long wait. I can't recommend this place if you're hungry, but if you have the time, sure you should go. Prices were reasonable.

reviews.author: Johanna J.
reviews.description: This review is long overdue. First time visit last month and we were pleased with overall service and food. The burgers are huge (in my opinion) and they have a nice selection of beers/cocktails. Staff were super pleasant and prompt - it's nice spot for a quick fix at reasonable prices.

reviews.author: Jose M.
reviews.description: Waited over an hour for food to come out and it was just ok. The brisket didn't really have any flavor.  I would not come back to eat at this place

reviews.author: Jeremy B.
reviews.description: Salty with a side of Micro transactions.   I have had a few items here and I would have to say this is the saltiest food in San Marcos and not in a good way.  Their menu is very over priced and boy do they love their micro-transactions or add-ons.  Fries are extra with their expensive and average burgers. BACON is like $2 extra.  They charge you for using a credit card and so much more.   Their queso is Velveeta and rotel and not even that good. Most of their chips they serve with the queso is tiny broken scraps and they get annoyed if you ask for more.   The staff is either uncaring or over-worked. I have had many incidences where I am eating solo and am ignored in getting service initially and after.  This is most likely because the server is more interested in dealing with the beer drinking frat guys. Almost every time I have been there I have been left without a basic refill of water. Many times i have also sat waiting for my food with no sight of my server.   The only saving grace of this place is the half price wings on Wednesday, but even then I would get them to go.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: I really enjoy this bar.  It is outdoors and there is ample seating.  I also love looking at the huge variety of plants that cover every inch of this place.  The drinks are good and the staff is friendly. Overall, a great place to unwind and socialize.

reviews.author: St C.
reviews.description: Drove up to San Marcos from SA to meet sister and niece to help move into dorms.  They were running late, so decided to stop here for some drks and grab a quick bite.  Place was not that crowded (in the front) and the tables were spaced out.  View was nice to enjoy those strolling by  the sidewalk.  The sign at the front said $3.50 bloody mary's, so I ordered one and it was the bomb (see pic).  Perfect drink that had all the fixin's.  The Chicken and Waffle Bites caught my attention, so I ordered that to hold us over.  These were really good and worth the appetizer! The reason for 2 stars knocked off were the service that was absent throughout our time here.  He disappeared all the time and couldn't find him once my sister and niece showed up.  This service made me decide to go somewhere else for lunch.  The other star was due to being charged full-price for the 2 bloody mary's.  I didn't say anything, as I wasn't sure when the waiter would come back and also felt small businesses need any extra cash during these times.  I still tipped the waiter, since they need money too but not sure how he was so busy with a light audience in the place.

reviews.author: Pam B.
reviews.description: Most delicious burger I've ever eaten!!  The bun is homemade with a hint of sweetness (think Hawaiian Bread) and the patty is thick and cooked perfectly. The fries were also to die for, crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside and perfectly seasoned. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Rebecca C.
reviews.description: They've got a good selection of beers and ciders (for the non-beer drinkers like myself). I come specifically for the pizza burgers. They are my go to burger when I get a burger craving. However, I have heard that all their other specialty burgers are amazing as well.   My one complaint is the service. It's mainly a bar, it's going to be busy- I get it. I've worked the industry. But every time I've gone, something is wrong with my order, I'm double charged on something, or the waitress hardly ever comes to check on us.   I'll keep coming for the amazing burgers- and they deserve the stars, but the service needs some improvement.

reviews.author: Amber F.
reviews.description: Chad was an amazing bartender/server! He let us know his name and was very responsive when we needed him. I would not say we waited for anything really, the food was reasonably priced, and everything was delicious.

reviews.author: Amanda C.
reviews.description: Look for my previous review y'all.  no resolution was ever made for that experience to ever be forgotten by me or them. They refused to serve me and I refused to stay quiet. I escalated to the owner after his employees all worked together to ensure that customer service is not important to them at all. I spend a lot of money eating out especially to try new things and I support local businesses. But I couldn't try their food because they don't accommodate properly to accept mastercard payment on a to go order (which they now claim they do allow). Hope you all decide to go somewhere else that values you as a customer. Support black owned businesses.  I hope the COVID hits them hard in the pockets.

reviews.author: Dori S.
reviews.description: The server was nice but the food took 45 minutes to come out and was bland. My friend enjoyed his chicken club, but the Guacamole Queso Burger was baaaaad. Just a flavorless burger, buns, meh guac and velvetta queso.  The drinks were very good though. I'll probably only come back for the drinks.

reviews.author: Sara S.
reviews.description: We love the Taproom! The new owners are great. 5 stars all around! Great burgers, tons of draft selections.

reviews.author: Gilberto R.
reviews.description: Great service from Alex, how come she's always training? Logan did a great job as well, give them both a raise.  Good food and atmosphere too

reviews.author: Samantha M.
reviews.description: Loooooove this place.  Very small inside so if you have a group call ahead or sit outside. Awesome atmosphere, lots of TVs to see the games, great cold drinks and yes kid friendly but if you have little little ones, may want to take something for them to do.  The wings are awesome!  Place is loud but that's what your there for!  Great food, clean restaurant and good service.

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: Now I know this is a chain place, but the wings deserve to be talked about. They are crispy, the meet inside is moist, and the sauces are flavorful.  If you live in the area and work from home, this is a must for Favor. It's often available quickly without a delivery fee.   The fries are very tasty. They have a good selection of on tap beers and the wait staff is friendly.   Prices are fair, you get a good amount of food for what you pay.   Where this place falls short of a Five star (well four star) are the other menu items quality. Wings are good, but the other menu items are nothing to be excited about. They'll do if you're hungry, but not if want flavor beyond bland.

reviews.author: Tiffany G.
reviews.description: Today we were taken care of by BRYANNA She was absolutely phenomenal! She provided amazing service she was enthusiastic and she made sure to check on us several times throughout our meal Im very excited to come back and see her again she definitely made our experience worth coming back for! If she is new keep her around I will share my experience with my friends!

reviews.author: Stephanie F.
reviews.description: Ordered using delivery service. Food was great, but both drinks were super light on alcohol. For the price I paid, I expected a little zing. Could barely tell they had any booze in them. Just tasted sweet. Pretty disappointed.

reviews.author: Beth S.
reviews.description: Ate at anchor bar at schertz and Alexandria was awesome!!!  She was a great server!!!

reviews.author: Deanna J.
reviews.description: After getting over the $67 bill for myself and my three boys, I realized that we did have a good meal. We ordered fried cheese  balls that were delicious. Two of the three boys ordered wings and fries, and cleaned their plates. My youngest ordered chicken tenders from the kid's menu and they were huge; he was only able to eat one before he was satisfied. I had the pecan chicken salad with a blueberry pomegranate vinaigrette. The salad was basic, but a solid choice. The dressing wasn't as flavorful as I'd hoped for, but fortunately the chicken and the candied pecans were good enough to carry the salad. I also ordered a pina colada at the advising of the young waitress; I won't do that again.  Overall, it was a good, and we definitely enjoyed ourselves.  Whether we return or not will depend on the boys suggesting it again for our Friday night outings.

reviews.author: Autumn H.
reviews.description: Amazing wings. Cool atmosphere. Nice staff. You can sample sauces here which is great considering there are tons of options.

reviews.author: Natalie K.
reviews.description: Bryanna was awesome!!! Great food. Great service. Patio is an excellent spot to have a bite to eat

reviews.author: Kristin W.
reviews.description: Anchor Bar is the spot! I invited my friends here on game days and now they're hooked too. There's nothing better than enjoying a plate filled with delicious wings underneath their shaded patio! Add in some football and y'all're in HEAVEN. Nom, nom, nom!

reviews.author: Raven H.
reviews.description: Pretty standard bar bites across the board. We had wings, a burger, macaroni, and loaded fries along with a couple brews. It wasn't packed for a Saturday afternoon but they did seat us back to back with other tables before capacity was supposed to be opened up to 100% so that was a bummer.   Our server sort of left us to it. Didn't relay any info regarding happy hour or food recommendations despite noting it was our first visit. Every time we looked up he was across the restaurant working on something else until a larger party was placed in his area, then his focus swung to them.  Nothing really stood out, food-wise. If you want something crunchy and you're already in the area, maybe swing through, but I won't be going out of my way.

reviews.author: Colette E.
reviews.description: Shaunea was amazing! Food was good, timing was much better than usual (usually slow from the kitchen)   Shaunea made sure our glasses stayed full, our food was as desired, and that we were pleased with everything. She's a real asset to the team.

reviews.author: Erin L.
reviews.description: We decided to go to Anchor Bar after seeing it on Texas Eats.  We've been there a few times since then, and we absolutely love their wings.  They've got quite a variety of sauces, and we have tried the mango habanero, spicy garlic parmesan, honey siracha, honey bourbon bbq, and the extreme.  They were all really good,  but the spicy garlic parmesan and honey siracha are our absolute favorite.  The spicy garlic parmesan has a light hint of spice to it with a nice garlic parmesan kick.  The honey siracha is sweet with a light kick of spice at the end.  I personally like the honey siracha the best out of both of the sauces.  It's the perfect combination of sweet and spicy.    We also get the mac and cheese balls appetizer, which is fried macaroni and cheese served with a side of ranch and a side of honey siracha sauce.  They pair very well with the wings we get.    If you enjoy wings, I highly recommend Anchor Bar.

reviews.author: Lisa Marie W.
reviews.description: Love their mild buffalo wings! Super tasty and full of flavor!!! This is our go to wing place

reviews.author: Katlyn C.
reviews.description: Sad that I did not enjoy Anchor Bar.  I will say, I read some reviews about them not adhering to Covid guidelines, and they must have changed since then. They did temperature checks for all guests, tables were very spread out and masks required! Some of the best I have seen at a restaurant the past year.  Some positives: the music playlist was the bomb, really loved that. The boneless wings on my meal were good, and I would return for that! My husband got the Buffalo chicken wrap, which he said we alright, but he would try something else if we went again.  Some not positives: I love Mac and cheese and was not a fan of theres at all, just not my type. I also got the queso and chips, and I think it should've been hotter, because it was already thick (not runny) by the time it was brought to our table (I would give this another chance if I knew the cheese would be dippable, because the flavor was good, just hard to eat)  Overall, we might go back and give it one more chance!

reviews.author: Gilbert R.
reviews.description: Great service by Bryanna she is  very attentive and friendly. Recommend her if stopping by Anchor bar in Schertz.

reviews.author: David M.
reviews.description: We normally get great food and service there.  Burger had a long female hair in it and the milks they served my 7 yr old was spoiled.  They made new  the burger for us and replaced the spoiled mike with water.... The least they could have done was not charge us for the spoiled milk. We asked for a to go box since my son did not finish his burger... well I ended up having to ask another server for the box... I grabbed my own bag on the way out from the servers station.

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: I really like that you can be added to their waitlist from  Yelp! That saved up some time of waiting in the restaurant for a table, when we could be added to waitlist prior to arriving!   Once arrived, we were greeted and seated almost immediately.   We sat outside, they have a nice covered patio area, with heaters and fans. The wait staff was extremely attentive and friendly. The wings are delicious!! Cooked perfectly, with the right amount of sauce.

reviews.author: Sherri W.
reviews.description: Our server, Bryanna, was so friendly and took great care of our group!  We had the Mac n cheese balls and drinks. Yumm!!  Highly recommend for happy hour.

reviews.author: Torri H.
reviews.description: Brianna was amazing!! The quest was yummy and the chips crispy! The atmosphere was great too.

reviews.author: James R.
reviews.description: Great new brewery that just opened up in the Universal City area. The food is phenomenal and the beer is exceptional. Has incredible staff and a nice outdoor area that includes a kids area and is dog friendly on the patio.  Service dogs are welcome inside.   From burgers to chicken sandwiches, Korean brisket tacos, crispy Brussels, all their homemade dipping sauces and the best fries I've ever had, you can not miss this place.

reviews.author: Austen A.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this place! It is just what Universal City, and the east side, needed. It has your typical brewery vibe with indoor seating and outdoor seating, and although the weather now may be a bit chilly, once the spring and summer weather comes around, I can see the place popping off. There is a cute Instagram worthy decor wall that says "Beer Is Better Together" so bring your cute outfits.   The beer selection on tap is vast and has something for everyone. My gf got the mango milkshake IPA, and it was a hit for her. I also heard talk that even if you don't prefer IPA, you'll enjoy it, so give it a try. I'm a dark beer guy and I tried pretty much every Belgian on the list along with the coffee Porter, my personal favorite. I bought a growler with the Porter to take home and I plan on using that growler many many more times in the future. My least favorite was the quad Belgian, but to each their own. It still wasn't terrible.   The food was great quality! Brewery and bar food always hit good to me, but this place really did it well. The Korean fusion theme was great. At the time, there was a special menu ramen item that my gf ordered but it was too spicy for her, so avoid if you're sensitive. I scarfed it down, however. I personally ordered the Boar Burger, and would recommend that to anyone coming in with a burger craving. Their fries are made in house. Also, try the Brussels sprout appetizer.   I'm very excited to see where this place goes. I'm hoping for seasonal brews and more menu specials down the line, but I know they're trying to just establish themselves and that's perfectly fine. I'm rooting for this place! Keep it up.

reviews.author: Heather M.
reviews.description: 15 hours agoNEW  An absolutely delightful experience! The staff was friendly, and engaged while managing an incredibly busy dining room. The beer options are well curated, and I personally enjoyed the single IPA (abv 7.1). Citrus forward, with hints of floral, a classic. The soft pretzel and brussel sprouts are amazing. Looking forward to going back!

reviews.author: Cassandra M.
reviews.description: I came here when this place opened and I was so impressed because even on such a busy day service was great and the food was delicious! I love the different options that they have with drinks. I even saw a seltzer! I loved all the food that I got. This is the perfect spot for this area since there isn't many breweries on this side of town.

reviews.author: Inga C.
reviews.description: Gather Brewing Co. is going on my list of go-to places to eat and drink in the Schertz-Cibolo-Universal City area. I've seen the sign from Highway 78 for a while, but I heard they were open and wanted to check it out. We enjoyed a delicious meal on the patio. The restaurant was busy and we're still not exactly sure how ordering, pickup, beverages, etc. are supposed to work, but the staff are helpful and friendly, and everything worked out.   "The Big DIPA" is an IPA that comes in a lovely branded tulip glass with a long stem. The beer has an amber color and rich taste, but is also clean and refreshing. It tastes like it comes from a scrupulous brewery.  We enjoyed a variety of delicious sandwiches. The kimchi and glaze added just the right zing to the Korean chicken sandwich. The crispy chicken sandwich is classic and satisfying. The smashburger is loaded with beef and nicely garnished. We enjoyed the brioche buns and crispy/toothsome chips/fries.  Gather Brewing Co. is a winner and fills a niche in the Universal City area. We are looking forward to coming back to try more brews and appetizers.

reviews.author: Scott G.
reviews.description: Despite the wait the staff is very good. Beers are tasty but the food is overpriced and the chicken is burnt beyond recognition.

reviews.author: Troy H.
reviews.description: This is a really nice place to have a drink and eat some food with friends. They have a really nice warm vibe, and all the employees are very friendly. They have a moderate selection of drinks. But I think their food is way better than any of their drinks. Their Korean tacos were surprisingly very good but I think the star of that show is the small bowl of noodles you get with it. But I think the best thing I've had there was there gather fries with the white truffle sauce. That sauce makes me want to come back over and over again. The parking here is kind of meh but the food is worth it.

reviews.author: John K.
reviews.description: I'm glad we have one of these places in our neighborhood.  Their food AND beer is very legit, really feels like you're somewhere else but Schertz.   Proud of this place and what it brings to our neighborhood and the Air Force base.  Great service! Great price! Really great service!! Really got it going on.

reviews.author: Misti S.
reviews.description: Lovely place!  While I never like ordering at counters, the process was relatively straight forward.  I didn't know you ordered food and drinks at the same counter, but that's how it's done.  My husband is a beer snob and wasn't especially impressed.  I like a spiked seltzer and I enjoyed mine quite a bit.  Our experience with our meals taught me that simple is better.  My fried chicken sandwich was simple but tasty.  Their fries won the show.  My husband's Korean Fried Chicken Sandwich had a lot going on and none of it was to our liking.  It didn't get eaten.  I love that Gather is local, not a chain, is in a lovely building and is veteran owned.  We will likely go back eventually, after prepping ourselves a little better on what to try.  My husband is hoping they will add a hazy beer to their offerings.

reviews.author: Lien K.
reviews.description: This brewery was on my list of places to check out on my next trip to Texas. I was able to check it off my list during my latest visit.  There is a lot of outdoor space, my preference on a sunny TX day but it was a bit chilly when I  stopped by so I sat inside.  The decor has a modern farmhouse look with long tables for large groups or beerhall seating in the center, bistro height tables for mid-size groups on one side and cozy tables for 2 by the stainless fermenting tanks.  You order your beer at the counter near the taps and pick up food near the back. Easy! The staff was friendly and welcoming. Everyone working appeared happy to be there. I ordered an IPA and the pretzel. The beer selection isn't extensive but covers a range of types so finding a beer is not an issue. I enjoyed my IPA, an American IPA-the Brew-S-A. The pretzel came with 3 sauces, a mustard, cheese and caramel-this was different but delicious. The food menu is similar to the beer menu, not big but will have something for most. I'd like to come back for lunch next time I'm in town so I can try an entree. I had a great visit to Gather and will be back. It's low key and casual with great food, beer and smiling faces behind the counter.  The street the brewery sits on is under currently under construction but it's an easy detour and worth the extra few minutes drive.

reviews.author: Raul Z.
reviews.description: I have driven by this are for about two years waiting  for this brewery to open.  The just opened up, and we had a chance to come by. The place is clean, plenty of room to sit, indoors and outdoors. The staff is friendly and helpful.    We are always looking for a good place to come hang out and be social. Good place to bring the kids, they have an area for the kiddos. Very kid friendly.     There were four of us, so we started with a hot chocolate, with marshmallows     I got the noble wheat, has a great taste, but it is missing an orange slice. Still great tasting beer.     Also had the trilogy, which is a Belgian triple ale style beer. Has a great smell, and a great tasting beer.     Had the cold front quad, omg, wonderful smell and great taste. Highly recommend this one.    Next one was the morning glory, a coffee porter, smelled is great, the taste is good, not too heavy on the coffee, which is good.   The last beer we had was the "takes two to tango", an ipa, not a fan of too many ipa's, but this one for me is very drinkable.    Also tried the pretzel, with the spicy mustard, the whiskey caramel, and beer cheese dips. This pretzel comes from Uwe's bakery in New Braunfels. Great pretzel.

reviews.author: Chad L.
reviews.description: We had an amazing time at Gather Brewing yesterday! Delicious beer, tasty treats and an amazing staff led to the overall great experience. It took some time to finish building the brewery but the end product is worth the wait. If I had to choose a favorite it would be Brew-s-a (IPA) but all of them are delicious. Can't wait to go back for more!

reviews.author: Nancy G.
reviews.description: I really wanted to like this place.  The decor was contemporary and the place itself seemed to have a nice vibe.  It's close by and the only brewery within a 10  mile radius.   Service was inconsistent.  There seems to be miscommunication between the people behind the bar and the waitstaff. One said we could only order at the bar and another said they could take our orders. Who knows, either way, we had to be constantly reminding them of what we'd ordered, or bringing us basic items like water, silverware, and our check. They're not as attentive but we felt that having 2 people might have been overwhelming for the inside of the place. Let me say I'm not much of a beer drinker.  I tend to stay with pale ale and ciders.  My husband on the other hand, loves stouts, lagers, and other types.  This was a soft opening and we were told limited types of beer were available.  Of the 5 that were available, he liked 2.  They offer 2 wines (cab and zin).  Stay with the cab.   They also offer food.  It was a hit or miss on what was served.  The Korean brisket tacos tasted like 2 separate items.  The little bit of "Korean" slaw on it was ok, not much flavor but at least refreshing.  The brisket was dry, hard, and tasted like nothing.  It was served with rice, let me rephrase- soy sauce and some rice.  I eat and make rice frequently,  I took one bite and pushed it aside. It was soy sauce with rice, no other flavors came through.  The pulled pork bites were "eh". My husband ordered a chicken burger.  That was tender and flavorful.  The Korean wings were good.  I'd order that again.  We will give this place another try but the 3 stars are because some beer items were good and a couple of food items hit the spot if you're hungry.

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: My husband really enjoyed the beers, as I am pregnant, I can't speak too much more on that. I did like the glasses, but I can tell you, the best pretzel I've had in a while was here. Their sauce game was impressive, though some of the staff were a little on edge it seemed, but we'll chalk that up to covid and the world basically falling apart over the past two years. The Korean wings were delicious, and the garlic aioli was super tasty, I would put that on anything. I'll definitely come back for food alone, and partake in some beers!

reviews.author: Antonino T.
reviews.description: This place was quite the experience went in hoping for the best and we got just that the service was impeccable super friendly staff and amazing quick service! The beer is on point they also have craft soda which I will try next time with a few more beers we just made a quick stop for dinner. The food was wonderful fries crispy and amazing the burger buttery bread juicy meat and the pork belly bits were a great shareable Item OH AND I can't forget about the beer cheese that came with the pretzel sheesh that was great!!!! I will be back with some friends to enjoy more beers and great food with a cute friendly ambiance

reviews.author: Cheryl B.
reviews.description: Amazing food and fun atmosphere! The craft beer is some of the best around. There's a play area for kiddos. We loved the Boar Burger and the Crispy Brussels sprout!

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: Fantastic brewery producing excellent beers and elevated pub food! Came w/ a fairly large group for some holiday celebration vibes and had a fantastic time gathering at GBC! The beer is great, with a wide array of options, all made well. Several fun seasonals that I really enjoyed. We spent time both inside and out and and great vibes in both spaces. Very kid friendly, but the way it is setup if you prefer to stay away from little ones, you certainly can. The food was great, with all in the group mentioning how great it was. Great service, efficient but still that central Texas charm. Drink local!

reviews.author: Angelique C.
reviews.description: This is an exciting addition to Universal City!! It is located across 78 from RAFB, right off Pat Booker and Aviation!! The beer is delicious and the food was fresh and flavorful!! Make sure to stop by and try it out!

reviews.author: Candelario H.
reviews.description: Enjoyed meeting the owner and brew master Michael Boeller!! We enjoy the cristy chicken tenders and the crispy chicken sandwich. We WILL return, and the next time with friends!! Doc

reviews.author: Reese M.
reviews.description: Often times breweries forgot about the people who don't drink. This place caters to everyone. I do wish they would put their custom made sodas, teas and coffee choices on their online menu so people like me know this place offers these items. The main reason we checked out this place was from a previous review mentioning something about their sodas as well as showing food pics. Either way because they offer non alcoholic beverages this will be our new brewery, I don't drink and my husband does. I got there blueberry soda and smash burger, both were fantastic. My hubby got their IPA beer and Korean tacos.... Whhaaaaat?! Those were amazing, such great flavor. Also we split a pretzel and I have to say I'm kinda a pretzel snob and tried many, this by far is the best one yet. The buttery coating on the outside and cooked to perfection on the inside. They served it with 3 sauces that my husband said was really good, he especially liked the caramel dip one. If you're reading this you should go check this new place out at least once and then you'll find yourself to be a returning patron haha.

name: The Downtowner
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Kristina B.
reviews.description: What a charming place this was! My friends and I decided to come by on a Wednesday evening for happy hour. It wasn't very busy and we were immediately seated in a nice booth that created the illusion of separation. I couldn't see anything behind me! This is a good thing btw!  We ordered some drinks and apps for the table. A couple Old Fashions, Mexican tea, and a drink off the secret menu that was delicious but I can't remember the name. The drinks were beautiful and tasty.  For the table we had the lemony hummus, the charcuterie, the hot Nashville chicken sliders, a cheeseburger, and honey butter chicken biscuit.  The lemony hummus came with fresh, crispy carrots, watermelon radishes, and celery. The hummus was creamy and tangy. It has a lot of dill, but I didn't mind that at all.  The chicken was a tad burned, but it was good the biscuit was soft and yummy, but it could have used a little more honey. I think the cheeseburger was the star. It was perfectly cooked and just hit the spot. The fries were also good. Just what I wanted!  The charcuterie was tiny, but it had some great treats.   And our waiter was phenomenal. He was attentive and super engaging. He gave us lots of information and we had a lot of fun small talk with him too.

reviews.author: Gloria S.
reviews.description: Food took f o r e v e r  to arrive. Server was nice but food took so long at one point she said it would be here but then It didn't come for another 30 minutes, this was around 4 pm  When it arrived, the scallops had enormous amounts of sausage like ham. Not sprinkled but probably a third of the dish. This was NOT in the menu. It was hard to push aside there were so many and we were afraid to send any food back due to the time it took to arrive. We had 2 orders of scallops around $35 each for only 3 scallops.  We also ordered the special meat loaf, that was good.  Bring a sweater, it is freezing in there and certain booths have the air blowing directly at you.  Interesting place, but too pricey for what you get... not much.

reviews.author: Jeanne D.
reviews.description: This was our first time at The Downtowner and it was great! Had to wait a bit for Saturday brunch which can be expected. Our waitress was phenomenal and the food was impeccable. Best was the bloody Mary's! We will definitely be returning! Excuse the photos my camera is messed up. The only reason I did not give it five stars was the interior was not as great as they made it out to be.

reviews.author: Don P.
reviews.description: 1st off. The atmosphere is amazing. The bartenders are fun, energetic, and welcoming. Signature made from scratch drinks to compliment the scratch made food. How can you go wrong?! Meatloaf!!! honey butter chicken biscuit with a fried egg on top with Tallow Fries! Delicious. Housemade lemon and dill hummus. Amazing. You cannot go wrong with anything on the food or drink menu. You will not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Jenn H.
reviews.description: We use to go here once a week 2 years ago but it has gone downhill. Fried Chicken was burnt, mashed potatoes cold, grilled chicken was steamed not grilled and prices are not worth the quality. Service and drinks were good. Save your money and time.

reviews.author: Danielle A.
reviews.description: Great spot . Cool bar and menu. Ate here twice in 24 hours. Amazing biscuits!  Had the veggies omlette twice it was so so yummy. Great cocktails, atmosphere and staff.

reviews.author: Jeff H.
reviews.description: Awesome place.  Mostly locals with incredibly friendly staff and super mixed drinks. Well situated in the heart of downtown New Braunfels. Stop by after browsing the farmer's market.  Great place to catch a game and have a snack. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Laura G.
reviews.description: They have lost their passion. Pre-Covid I will say this spot did do a great job on drinks but we visited 1/22 and it definitely was not the same as it was in the past. We had the charcuterie and meats that were on the board were extremely thick. We also had the crab cake and it was mediocre. Not bad but not great. During Covid I do wish they had updated their hours and even now on yelp it states they are closed which is not correct. During Covid it stated they were open when they weren't. No one is monitoring the marketing for what it seems. Hostess cared more about being in the phone Vs caring for guests. Such a disappointment when there is so much potential.

reviews.author: Ardnas D.
reviews.description: I had high hopes based on the menu choices but egads it was bad. Even if their prices were cut in half it would not be worth it. Sometimes places have an off-night, but I would never give this one another chance.

reviews.author: Charlynne A.
reviews.description: So this place always comes up on my searches so my husband and I decided to give it a try. When I go to a restaurant I like to evaluate it not only on a basis of food, but also the theme. The servers are in character - they are dressed as if they are mechanics with trucker hats. Nice touch to the restaurant given that it has an overall vintage gas station/industrial look.   Space/layout: Definitely a fun place to go to for brunch. They can accommodate large parties and have a bar. The decor around the restaurant are instgrammable, so if you are into that go ahead and cop yourself a pic.  Food: Not gonna lie, the food we order was a little bit more on the saltier side (Dirty Hash and the Shakshuka). Not sure if it was the cook that day or if the cook over shot the salt, but my husband and I had a difficult time finishing our food since it was a tad bit salty. Portion is great, presentation is amazing, but too salty. I am willing to give this place another try. Other than the saltiness, the food here is really good. But come thru and see how the food taste yourself!   P.S. Order a biscuit, it's really, really good here! Homemade and fresh.

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: The food was incredible.  The shrimp and grits were out of this world.  Everything we ordered was amazing.  The staff was top notch.  Shout out to Taylor and Chad.  You guys made our experience so enjoyable.  Thank You!

reviews.author: Jill B.
reviews.description: Dinner for the first time since they reopened. They did not disappoint!! Scallops were simply amazing.  Best I've ever had!  Son had the meatloaf and it hasn't missed a beat!   Classic Old-fashion was spot on.  Took home the Wagyu burger for husband and lemon Strawberry shortcake for dessert.  Plates are all clean! Thanks Chad and team for a fabulous dinner!!

reviews.author: Brandon R.
reviews.description: Went by the Downtowner on Saturday to try the new brunch menu. Had the Chilaquiles with pork belly and the meal was absolutely fantastic. Brought my wife home the avocado toast with eggs and bacon and that was also delicious as well. Overall just a wonderful experience!

reviews.author: Mirta F.
reviews.description: Food was ok.. nothing special. ‍  mimosas were good and location was GREAT.  Service was pretty good. Not sure it's any place I'd be super anxious to go back to any time soon.

reviews.author: Amber S.
reviews.description: Hands down one of our favorite places to eat. The food is outstanding all made fresh and the bartenders are so fun! We love Stephen when we go. They are currently open Thursday and Friday nights and for Saturday and Sunday you got to try their brunch! They can make any drink you want!

reviews.author: Layce H.
reviews.description: Our normal breakfast place was packed so we googled and this hidden gem popped up.  It was a bit pricy but OMG that French Toast is 100% worth it. Service was on point too. Our server was Danni and she is a keeper. Will be back.

reviews.author: Ian S.
reviews.description: We didn't set out to dine at this establishment as we were staying overnight not to far away but it started raining and we tucked ourselves into this restaurant. At first glance the menu was a little too fancy for my wife's and kids palate but the food wowed us. Best meatloaf I have ever had and the fried chicken was great. Well done , definitely check this place out! Well worth a drive.

reviews.author: Louis S.
reviews.description: great food and specialty drinks, great art everywhere, owner was a great guy, showed us around

reviews.author: Debby J S.
reviews.description: We went to the Downtowner (First Timers) on Saturday evening to have dinner before our show at the Brauntex ... 'Elvis' ... And he did deliver ... He paid a Tribute to the King!!  So, when we walked in, there were two hostesses at the front. They asked if we had reservations, which we did not. I told them it was fine, that we could walk next door to Krause's and next time I would make a reservation.  Well, all I can say is that those two hostesses moved heaven and earth to accommodate us! They perused the seating chart and came up with a 'plan' for us. As long as we could be done by 6:30p they had a table for two. We told them that we had to be at the Brauntex at 6:30p, so all was good.  At first, we thought they were just going to sit us in the back room.  LOL  We didn't realize that the restaurant went that far back.  And our waitress (Can't remember her name!) What a hoot. She was a pleasure to have. Answered all of our questions about the menu, etc. She brought water out in this cool bottle ... She told me I could have it ... And then wrestled it out of my arms when I tried to leave ... Just Kidding!! And then our food came. It was delicious!  And we were walking out of the restaurant at 6:30p.  KUDOS to everyone that took care of us!

reviews.author: Lizzette C.
reviews.description: My husband and I love this place for brunch on a Sunday Funday! Service is always great, the staff is friendly. Our very first experience, we sat at the bar and Steven was our bartender. He was great and showed us his take on a mojito, which was delicious! The food is great as well, I honestly can't say a bad thing because we've never had a negative experience here.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: It's about time we got one of these! My husband and I used to frequent them in San Antonio. We love the large amount of drafts from all over. Greg was so awesome and fun to talk to while we were there. They have growlers and crowlers you can get filled, as well as bring in your own growler for a fill. The inside is dog-friendly.  My only meh about this place is that there are 3-4 taps with Guadalupe Brewing's beer. Don't get my wrong, I love them, but they are right down the road, so to me it doesn't make sense to have that many of theirs on tap, especially since my husband and I frequent local breweries.  Can't wait to see what else they bring in and are excited to go back!

reviews.author: Chad L.
reviews.description: Had the opportunity to hit up Big Hops here in New Braunfels yesterday and had a great time. The young lady behind the bar was awesome and you could tell she loved working there. Nice selection of beer and a fun environment definitely says I'll return for more visits. If you are in New Braunfels definitely stop by and check them out. First Beer is Melted Snowman Winter Ale by @whitestone_brewery and second beer is Battle of Hops by @viva_brewery

reviews.author: Greg M.
reviews.description: This place is awesome. Great beer and great service. Sports on TV. The owners are present and super friendly. Two restaurants in the strip so you can order food to bring in. Definitely the best spot in the area!!

reviews.author: Chris A.
reviews.description: Awesome place! Huge TV area and plenty of board games to play! Also offer a variety of seltzers in the fridge if you aren't a big beer drinker.

reviews.author: Diana C.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere! Sparkling new and fun family games! Plus, great beer options -- especially IPAs! :-)

reviews.author: Joshua M.
reviews.description: In the latest wave of gentrification in this town, it seems like all I can find are hipster breweries that serve "craft" beer and overpriced food served on rectangular plates. If you like that kind of crap, go to aqua brew, you animal. If you want to go somewhere with cheap drinks and cool people (and if you live north of campus like this guy), look no further than Treff's. Some highlights.  You call it nights and you call it week:  Every Sunday, Treff's does $2.50 you call its, and $2.00 you call its on Tuesday. In addition to that, Treff's picks one week out of every month to be You call it week. That means $2 you call its all week. Going there, getting piss drunk, and stumbling back to my apartment, is among my fondest memories.   Atmosphere:  This place is dirty and divey in the best of ways. I used to go here with my friend from work all the time, and I always enjoyed seeing the bartenders and regulars. Really interesting people. Another upside is the patio, which allows filthy smokers like myself to smoke, drink, and have interesting conversations with other people. Another thing to mention, though, is that Treff's is much more of working people's bar. If you're a frat bro or sorority girl looking to blow mommy and daddy's money on a night of partying, you probably won't have a lot in common with the people here.  The glasses: This is just a little nitpick of mine, but I always hate going to the square and getting served drinks in a plastic cup. Treff's gets ridiculously busy some nights, and they still manage to serve all of their booze in glass, which is something I like. On another note, the bartenders here are absolute rock stars, and they don't take shit from anyone.   I haven't gone in a while since I don't have anyone to go with, but you can bet your ass the first place I'm taking my girlfriend when she turns 21 is gonna be Treff's.

reviews.author: Todd B.
reviews.description: I wandered around the square and didn't find anything besides frat boys doing brunch. Found my way to this place and it was great. Not for everyone but if you want a local crew and a few cold drinks and shots this is your place. I loved it and it will be even better when the upstairs is open. Not for children. Adults only in a drinking sense.

reviews.author: Kick I.
reviews.description: Patrick T. is full of BS- he did not open The Tavern when he was 25.  It was in existence way before he blew into San Marcos, and was known as the coolest, anti-frat bar in San Marcos.  That's why he bought it from Andy and Ben Linn, original owners.  He has expanded, added alot of TV s and updated the interior, but it will never be the place it was in the late 80's.  Keep blowing smoke, Patrick, - the Green Parrot is calling your name.

reviews.author: Enrique T.
reviews.description: They obviously water down their liquor. Had 7+ shots and only felt buzzed. We are not heavy drinkers in general.

reviews.author: Janeisy S.
reviews.description: Treffs is a nice casual spot to hangout, drink, play games and have a good time. It's a nice gem away from the square. They have $2 you call it week once a month! Can't beat it. Karaoke is also offered on Sundays, which is my favorite day to visit. Different events are hosted just about every day of the week. Although they don't serve food, they allow you to order at the restaurants near by and enjoy it there while washing it down with a cold alcoholic drink. Pretty awesome!

reviews.author: Estefania Z.
reviews.description: I loved Treff's until they kicked out my brother.ñ for some lame excuse. One of the bartenders is racist af and he should be kicked out.

reviews.author: Re'Ven S.
reviews.description: I love the $2 you call it weekalthough not all drinks are $2 and they fail to inform you of this before ordering it. I was willing to look pass this until I went in around 12am and had a few drink and was allowed to order a drink at 1:52am and they close at 2am. At 2:03 they bouncer was stand at our table demanding that two of my girlfriends and I chug our drinks and leave when we stated we'd like to not get drunk and drive the entire bar staff proceed to attack us and demand we finish our drinks, that we had just got and paid for, and leave or they'd take them. I felt very uncomfortable and attack so my friends and I just left. It was not a good way to end my night.

reviews.author: Eva R.
reviews.description: The bouncers and bartenders are always so friendly and have always enjoyed going to get a drink and chill. 10/10

reviews.author: Travis M.
reviews.description: It's Treffs.  Great owner and bartenders. It's got a ton of $2 you call it weeks and every Tuesday.

reviews.author: Lee W.
reviews.description: 3 stars because the ratio of ADULTS to college kids was surprisingly good. i.e. greater than 3:1. Im 48 and looking to not be around college kids every time I go grab a beer. Im kinda done with that nonsense, ya get me? I'll know more next time. Cool place.

reviews.author: Alyssa C.
reviews.description: My friends and I were here this past Friday with other work friends and we ordered a round of drinks. A few minutes later another friend met up with us and brought a round of shots. Within 10 minutes of being there a bouncer came up to us and told us we need to leave because we were "too drunk". I told him we weren't and we hadn't drank at all before we got there, we had all just been at a work function. He told us the bartender saw us walking to the bathroom "looking drunk". He wouldn't let us finish our drinks that we had just been served and only made the 4 people with shots out of my friend group leave. I think the staff there is racist just like other reviews are saying. Won't be coming back.

reviews.author: Anon A.
reviews.description: Well liquors were $2 tonight, and we were served well vodka and charged $6 a shot! The bartender who is also manager and share-holder DID NOT MENTION TO US  that well vodka in the form of a pickle shot would be $6. As a longtime bartender being served by a long term bartender, when I'm told "wells are $2" I trusted that Chad would be honest with us. Instead, he took us to the cleaners. If I could give no stars I would. I have been in San Marcos for over 10 years. About 6 years ago I was man-handled by a door guy for no reason. I did not return to Treff's for almost 4 years. Since then, I have gone back a handful of times in hopes that it was just "one bad apple", but now I see that the employees at Treff's are out for nothing more than money. Even the door guy tonight was short and smile-less. I have received nothing less than awful service at this bar and I will not be returning.

reviews.author: Taylor M.
reviews.description: I would definitely love to give Treff's more stars but to myself it is a solid 3.5.   This was my second visit to Treff's because the first time i had been there i did not have a great experience. However, I am a big fan a second chances because who knows what might had been going on that night.   The drink prices are very reasonable. Whiskey Sours only $3.50 and then they have some killer drink specials during the week I believe on Sundays and Tuesdays they have -You - Call -  Its- for only $2!!   The upstairs bar area has a bunch of darts to play and even a pac-man arcade game to entertain with.   As for this little dive, I would return.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: As a graduate of Texas State, I lived up the street from Treff's and spent moderate amount of time and money here. Great little place. A toss between "dive" and "college bar", this establishment has cheap drink specials and the students know it! Beer selection is moderate, but for a college hangout there's a few local and craftbeers in the mix of domestic "moneymaker" beers.  The bar gets super busy, especially during "$2 Tuesdays" when everything is $2 and I mean EVERYTHING! With other various specials during the week, this is a must if you're a student looking to have a good time and stretch you're student loan/ scholarship/ college fund/ or emergency credit card that mom gave you just a little more...

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: Monday: $5 Pitcher Beer Night  Tuesday: $2 You Call It  Cool joint, cheap drinks and usually always pretty full inside. Oh yeah, and Happy Hour starts Early @ 2pm.  Parking is a little limited but there is more behind Grins.   Good place if you just wanna get away from the Square or try something different.

reviews.author: Karson E.
reviews.description: Cheryl is great. Prices are good. Happy hour deals are fantastic, and games are available to play upon request.

reviews.author: Mindy N.
reviews.description: Awesome bar with a great, casual, cozy environment. It's perfect for nights where you just want to be in the comfort of good company and drinks. The people are what really makes this place! Brandon, our bartender that night, was a blast to get to know and talk to. Excited to come back!

reviews.author: Alicia D.
reviews.description: Love this bar! It is fun and down to earth. Great drink specials! Best nights are 2 dollar u call it Tuesdays and Sundays! Sundays also has karaoke and they play all the football games!

reviews.author: Lindsey H.
reviews.description: So I went here on a Saturday.  The inside was wayyyy too loud, and very little people were inside. Their selection of beers was so/so, although I had heard that they had more than what they actually had.  The parking lot was awful. Construction going on and one way in and out. Only about 10-13 cars could park and you can forget it if you're driving a truck, as the guy driving a f250 found out after hitting the parked Mercedes.  Not a great place for a huge group of people, but not bad for a San Marcos bar. When visiting just be wary of the parking lot and crazy drivers.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: So I'm usually at Treff's on Tuesdays for $2 you-call-its (best deal on the best night to go) but tonight was a friend's birthday and she wanted to have a few drinks there before heading to Austin.   Well, as usual, we squished into a parking spot in the front of the tavern, walked in and sat at an open bar stool. I ordered an Ace pear cider and started chatting with friends while the jukebox was going with a vast array of music choices! Thats the beauty of a jukebox and I love the diversity!  Okay so I decided to check in (via Yelp) and saw that they had an offer for $2 drinks which really excited me because it wasn't a Tuesday and I still could get some $2 drinks? HELL YEAH!  WELLLLLLL.... it was more like a HELLLLLL NO because the bartender didn't allow me to redeem my deal. He even said he texted the owner and that the owner had no idea what kind of deal I was talking about? Well, the offer is still open on my Yelp app and I plan to find the owner next time I'm at the bar and ask him about it because that offer didn't magically come to be!!!  Anyway, yes Treff's is a super chill, casual and cool bar but they lost some points with not accepting my Yelp offer (I mean that's what the offers are there for hellloooooo)!! Guess I'll stick to only going in on Tuesdays...

reviews.author: Matt J.
reviews.description: Very tasty burgers, and basically anything fried there is a winner. French fries? Yup. Fried okra? Delicious! Onion rings? Yum! Can't go wrong with Landa Station!

reviews.author: Tony J.
reviews.description: Hmmm. It happens. Stopped in to grab a drink while at swim meet nearby. In my vodka and tonic was a long hair that I didn't see till I was eating my ice. Bartender was serving us and she was unavailable. Saw some lady tucked behind the fountain machine on her cell phone and when I asked for help she said she wasn't on the clock. I'll assume that to be true. Looked outside and saw the bartender having a smoke and putting on makeup. I walked outside to let her know about it and didn't request anything in return. She apologized and offered to reimburse my card (I paid cash prior to my finding and a 30% tip to which I should have taken back, but I did not).   Hope this isn't indicative of their sanitation practices and overall service, but know I won't return as a result of my first experience with this establishment.

reviews.author: Mirta F.
reviews.description: First time visiting yesterday and loved it. Service was great, nachos were great... even the giant Dr Pepper I got was great! Will definitely be going back- often.

reviews.author: Melissa L.
reviews.description: My food was horrible. It was like eating freezer food.  I expected homemade food like they advertised

reviews.author: Jim H.
reviews.description: The best crispy beef tacos I have ever eaten. Meat was perfectly seasoned. Shells were good-sized and crunchy. Salad, onions and cheese were fresh. I'll be back here again for sure!

reviews.author: Hope C.
reviews.description: Have to admit, I was underwhelmed. The BLT Wrap would have been better had the tortilla been warmed up just a tad. The crumbled bacon was cooked perfect, but cold and greasy. No wine. Bummer!  The outdoor sitting area is nice. Our waitress was friendly and eagerly shared her suggestions. Will go back because the burgers looked good.

reviews.author: Franklin P.
reviews.description: I went this past Sunday at lunch.  There were maybe three tables sat when we got there.  We ordered the onion rings appetizer.  They were very good except for the ketchup tasted spoiled.  We ordered three burgers where they charge you for the cheese and a different bread if you want it.  I chose the Jalapeno cheese bread.  After waiting about 40 minutes our waitress comes out and says they ran out of hamburgers but rest assured they were making some and ours would be fresh!  My family laughed and said, what had they not ran out would they not be fresh?  Needless to say and hour passed by and our food finally came out.  Trusting the yelp 4 start review I'm ready to eat!  Well my Jalapeno and cheese bun came out and it had no Jalapeno or cheese in it and it was the type that is old and falls apart and was fermented.  I almost asked for my $1.50 back for the upgrade but my family said let's just get out of here and forget about it and not come back.  So for $52 we received an order of onion rings and three burgers and no drinks.  A sign of the situation as well, the table next to us complained of the hot sauce for their tacos being spoiled.  Their 4 star review may have been earned in the past but this place is not something I will ever be looking forward to.  ****Update*****We used my Mastercard here to eat and didn't use the card anywhere else.  I've received two fraudulent charges on the card now.  A girl by the name Jessica used the card to buy pizza in Seguin.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: This place is hidden in plain sight. I live close by and have always wanted to check it out. It's a smaller restaurant with plenty of seating and a full bar (although pretty simple draft choices).  The prices are good, and the food is great! I had the buffalo chicken sandwich on sourdough. It came out fresh and melted in my mouth. I can't say I have had a chicken burger this fresh and moist...ever! My husband got the Texan which was great as well- not too much bbq sauce and the flavors went together great.  While we didn't have room for anything else other than beer, I would definitely be back. Very dive bar feel with what seemed like 98% "locals" or return guests as everyone was mingling with the bartenders a lot. I am happy to say this didn't affect our service since the bartenders were the waitstaff as well.  Definitely check it out! Also karaoke on Saturdays!

reviews.author: Holly B.
reviews.description: This is a hidden gem.... LOVE their hamburger steaks!!! Customer service is great. We have been bringing family members back to this place since we found it two months ago and they all love it...

reviews.author: Cameron T.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and great friendly service! Try the green tea shots! Nice place for a beer after hanging out at Landa park for the day.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: This should be your new "regular" spot for lunch. The only problem is that it's already the regular spot for a LOT of people so you better start taking lunch breaks early.  I came with a work friend and got a decent table ala "seat yourself". Lots of burger options and that's what they are known for. I had the Texas burger on a bun. Usually, it comes on Texas toast (of course). It was ginormous and well done. The pile of bacon on it was - it amazes me to write this - almost too much. I think there was more bacon than beef. Also a couple onion rings and bbq sauce made this an awesome meal.  For a side I had the tater tots which were tasty and well cooked.   I would have liked speedier service, but the three women serving this place were flat out slammed and doing an impressive job of keeping up with the flow. So go, be patient, and don't fill the place up!

reviews.author: Christine M.
reviews.description: Incredibly substantial menu for a dive bar, a ceiling-to-floor menu of shots, super friendly staff, AND , amidst the DosEquis and Lone Star and Bud, a single tap reserved for local Guadalupe beer...LOVE!  Drawn in by the media buffet above the bar (football, football, football, Simpsons, football, football...something for errbahduh!), we parked it there.  There's a great list of pre-built burgers, but also a long list of carb jacket (definitely go for the jalapeño cheddar! Definitely. ) and topping choices from which to build your own. He orders the Australian burger and I beer, I go for a much more Texan option: chicken fingers and fries basket, white pepper gravy duh, and a sweet tea (Don't judge! We had just spent all afternoon at  brewery, and I hadn't eaten. Adultin' like a mofo!) The waitress was kind enough to suggest that the fries in my basket would be enough for both of us. .."*if* I felt sharing", lol. Well played, ma'am! And much appreciated tip, seriously! ...and indeed they were. A very short few minutes later, a veritable mountain of food was placed in front of  us.  Burger: Super!! Chicken and gravy: Really really good. Fries: Old eff'n Bay!!! Yaaayyyy!  Sweet Tea : holy shit, use the lemon! Super sweet and delicious with it. Without citrus...drinking Karo sizzurp through a straw lol.  Bellies : full.  To-go box: also full.  Bartender: Badass

reviews.author: Bud C.
reviews.description: Food quality has steadily declined over the past 4 years. Placed a phone order to go today. Burgers looked less appealing than Whatburger. Formerly juice tasty meat tasted like reheated dried leather. All three orders of fries were cold.  This was once my goto joint. Sad to see how it's gone downhill

reviews.author: Desiree M.
reviews.description: I believe in always starting off on a positive note...  that being said, they played good music while we were there.   We heard the burgers were supposed to be good. Decided to try it out for Mother's Day. NOT for us. Burger was large, but very greasy and lacking in flavor. We asked for extra crispy sweet potato fries, I've had more flavorful and crispy sweet potato fries frozen out of a bag. Menu was a la cart, so we spent way more than we should have for in my opinion, poor quality food.  Customer service (if you can even call it that) was non existent. Will not go back. Pat's Place is definitely much better, unfortunately they're closed on Sunday's.  For the lovely folks letting their small kids scream and fight over the pool table, pool sticks/balls, AND use a stick with no tip on the felt, unsupervised, I'm thinking Chucky Cheese is probably a better choice next time.

reviews.author: Brit W.
reviews.description: 3 crispy tacos for lunch is the best kept Mexican food secret in NB.  LS is Always perfect and it remains a total Hidden Gem.  Outstanding burgers as well!

reviews.author: Jarod M.
reviews.description: Service was great and drinkspecials realky good! I would recommend the fried pickles, but the chicken fried steak and grilled chicken salad seemed frozen out of a package. Would recommend for,bar atmosphere but not much for food.

reviews.author: Lauren W.
reviews.description: This place has so much potential.  Its bar food but its decent bar food. It has a cool patio to drink at. The problem is the service.  We have tried 3 times and every time the server is so put out. It is not ever busy when we have gone so I can't understand it.

reviews.author: Jesse J.
reviews.description: Wanted a burger.  Came here for it.  Was not disappointed.  Tried the blue cheese burger.  #Delicious. Fries were great.  No complaints.  Wife had Buffalo Chicken Ranch sandwich bc that's how she rolls.  She said it was "really good".  Son asked "why are grilled cheese so good?"

reviews.author: Teresa H.
reviews.description: Wanted something diff for lunch at our shop and had heard the burgers were good. Boy are they! Healthy size burger is an understatement! Excellent burger, fresh fix'ns, and the bun options are yummy! I went with sour dough. Co worker had the the patty melt and said it was one of the best he's had. My favorite thing though... CRINKLE FRIES! :) Yummmmm  Burger fries and large sweet tee was 8 bux after tax!   We will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Daryll B.
reviews.description: Today, for 8 hours, I've been thinking about downing a hand-formed, griddled hamburger. Where to go? My criteria: new place, no tips, local, inexpensive, and at least a 1/2 pounder,   There are not many places to get hamburgers over here. There is Smashburger, which has been getting horrible ratings, Chilis (my favorite), Texas Roadhouse, Gruene River Grill, the Phoenix Saloon, and Pat's place. Now, places where you can get away without paying a tip--whether that is through the drive though or takeout--are GG's Corner Cafe (Marion), Blakes's Cafe (McQueeney), Kirby's Korner (Seguin), the Longhorn Cafe (New Braunfels), and today's addition with Landa Station.     This dive bar is located about a block past Landa Park. While looking at their menu online, I noticed that all of their burgers are 1/2 pounders (plus); they have one pounders also, chicken sandwiches, and Mexican food (cool). This is a bar folks!  I went through the drive though, after phoning in my order 10 minutes earlier. I ordered a patty melt ($5.75) because I haven't had one since I was a teenager, ions ago. The patty melt was described as a 1/2 pound burger, grilled onions, and swiss cheese on a buttered, Texas Toast. I must have arrived 5 minutes too late because my "toast" was no longer toasted. Either it was not toasted enough, or it steamed in that Styrofoam box and turned back into bread.      The burger was huge, juicy, and was cooked medium, as I had ordered (plus), the onions were great; however, the cheese was a white cheese sauce, or poor quality cheese (I think the former). The cheese seemed almost like white cheese whiz. If these burgers could be improved, I would only serve Wisconsin cheeses. I would pay 75 cents more.  They also have chopped pork, chicken, and many burger combinations. Because of the price, the drive through, and hand formed burgers, I will definitely be back. Oh, and on Wednesdays, when you buy a burger, you get a beer for 10 cents (probably inside only).

name: 54th Street Restaurant and Drafthouse
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Friday

reviews.author: Angelina C.
reviews.description: I've ordered the double smashed cheeseburger 3 times already. It's delicious and the fries are EVERYTHING! I've also had their New York cheesecake and it's a game changer. Will continue to order from here

reviews.author: Stacey S.
reviews.description: Let me start off and let you know my husband is very hard on his critique of restaurants. This was our first time here. Thanks to a friends recommendation we tried it today. Seriously the best steaks that we have had in a restaurant. They were literally cooked perfectly. It was the right amount of portions. I also got the basil lemonade. Our waitress was super sweet and efficient. Both my husband and I give this place a two thumbs up.

reviews.author: Linda K.
reviews.description: Service was great. Food was delicious. We had the steak, and the soup and sandwich combo with chicken tortilla soup and the turkey sandwich.

reviews.author: Kim H.
reviews.description: We've been coming here since it opened and it never disappoints!!  It's our go to place with kids or without!  Cold *ass beer, amazing sangria margaritas!!  Food wise -  Heathy option - the protein bowls are great!   Comfort - the chicken Madeira, Prime rib sandwich, Buffalo chicken salad.  Extremely affordable - kids love it!  Great staff!

reviews.author: Mimi D.
reviews.description: I can't review the food but the front staff service is rude and hostile.   We put our name on the wait list and when we arrived we were told we were mistaken.   She even said we must not have clicked the confirm button.  Then she rudely said it'll be a 45 min wait!  Well if we didn't successfully complete the process, how did we get this text??   You don't treat your customers like an inconvenience and that's exactly how they treated us.

reviews.author: Monty W.
reviews.description: Leaving the Outlet Malls and headed back home via Hwy 21, we needed a lunch spot on the "right" side of the interstate for easy in/out. 54th Street hit all of those needs.  We were promptly seated by a super sweet hostess. We have a toddler and we were able to grab the booth highchair on the way to our table instead of getting to the table and then waiting for a highchair. I know that doesn't mean a lot, but 90% of the restaurants we visit, we have to wait for them to seat us then they bring a highchair to our table. By them having the booth highchairs at the hostess station, they are "working smarter, not harder". Big kudos the them for that.  Our waiter was (forgive me for I didn't catch his name) was extremely knowledgeable of the menu and helpful for all questions.   I had the Cherry Limeade to go along with the Gringo Dip and Chips we ordered for our appetizer. Both the limeade and the chips/dip were outstanding. I would recommend both.  For entrees, we had the Prime Rib French Dip and the Havana Club. The French dip is the first sandwich listed and I didn't read any further. I'm a sucker for a good French Dip and this sandwich delivered. The wife commented that her Havana Club was delicious as well. The kids had grilled cheeses with fries. All looked great and they devoured them.  All in all, this is the spot you're wanting for an easy off/on when traveling north on I-35. We'll be back when we are in the area.

reviews.author: Kristy S.
reviews.description: An hour and half wait for 3 adults 3 kids so I'm expecting great food and service.  Overall it was good.  Food I ordered blackened ribeye and pina colada.  Cooked and seasoned perfectly.  My daughter ordered the butter penne pasta with side of sweet strawberries, ice cream and strawberry lemonade. The lemonade was fresh and not overly sweet.  My husband had ribs. My friend had ribeye with blackened shrimp. Everything was tasty.  Waiter tried but kept forgetting stuff. We didn't get straws till 20 min after our drinks were served. Like no one got straws to drink.   then he kept forgetting the refills and my glass of water.  My 5 yo noticed and commented on the server's forgetfulness. He was nice but he's obviously new-- he didn't know the menu well at all. But it's fine, we had a good dinner. Price was very decent.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: We tried out 54th late on a Sunday night. It is nice that they have extended hours while most others still have reduced hours. I checked in online before we showed up, and we were seated immediately. We both had the vodka strawberry lemonade cocktail, which was very sweet and weak. I ordered a chicken avocado sandwich with sweet potato fries.  My husband ordered the chicken quesadilla. Our food was prepared quickly. My sandwich was tasty, as well as the fries. My husband said the quesadillas were spicy.

reviews.author: Melanie G.
reviews.description: My first time trying this place, as it was one of the only places open late tonight, and it was really good! I had the Havana Club sandwich with the Chicken Tortilla Soup on the side and the Key Lime Pie for dessert. The sandwich was great! Pretty big and definitely worth the price. The soup was also good as well. The pie was great and unlike any other pie I've had, tangy and with amazing crust.  Overall the atmosphere of the restaurant was great, especially for the night time. Its got a cluttered pop-culture type decor style, similar to that of Beyond Burger, nice dim lighting, and huge comfortable booths. Our waitress was also very kind and did a great job. I highly recommend this place, especially in the night time for the atmosphere.

reviews.author: Rick S.
reviews.description: One of the coolest places to take someone to with great food! Look at the awe in my nephews face

reviews.author: Carolina S.
reviews.description: Food is great and Maria's service was amazing. We enjoyed our visit, we'll definitely be visiting again.

reviews.author: Erieser C.
reviews.description: The waiting time was less than expected, the waiter was very attentive.  To start we ordered a Four Play, I regret not having a photo, but I can tell you it was delicious, the sauces that accompany this order were excellent, all excellent, the fried potatoes, the mozzarella, the spicy chicken but with a good flavor.  In addition this time we ordered the same Plate, Flat-iron steak and shrimp with mashed potatoes, I found the steak cooking to be perfect, as well as the shrimp just right.  We recommend a delicious beergarita.  Only you have to prepare your wallet, it is not cheap, but you will enjoy it.

reviews.author: Alyssa P.
reviews.description: Sat at the bar for about 1 hour and was never once ASKED for what we wanted. Had to get their attention both times, and sat for 15 minutes with empty drinks. Then proceeded to charge me $.25 for Tito's in my strawberry vodka lemonade(after he told me he wouldn't charge it because of the wait. Hope the $.25 charge was worth the $8 tip buddy.

reviews.author: Christopher M.
reviews.description: If I could give ZERO stars I would. My fiance and I are regulars here, have always loved the food and drink selection. After tonight we will no longer be returning to 54th street restaurant. We had family come in from 2 hours away to try the food we always talk about, and were turned away, REFUSE us service because our party of 13 was "too large". Yet there was a party of 12 that didn't show for their reservation and still we were refused service. It was supposed to be the graduation dinner for my fiance and this is how it turned out. It is not our fault that the restaurant is understaffed, but losing us as loyal customers definitely is their fault. Save your time and $ take your family somewhere else.

reviews.author: Melissa W.
reviews.description: My sister and I came here for lunch today. Restaurant was clean and service was very fast. I ordered the loaded fries with gringo sauce and my sister ordered chicken wraps with ranch. Food was awesome! Our waitress was on top of things as well. I would definitely plan on coming back this was my first time here. We also had sweet teas and they were good as well.

reviews.author: Kristen N.
reviews.description: Went in for lunch and forgot how yummy their food is! We had a couple of chicken protein bowls. One was blackened and the other grilled and I added Buffalo sauce.
