The chicken was cooked perfectly! And the veggies has a nice grill and char! Fantastic, fast, hot and plentiful! And the staff is very nice! Hubby had a Reuben that was huge and great seasoned fries!!!sorry no pics but trust me it was good!

reviews.author: Skyler B.
reviews.description: I wouldn't recommend this place at all. The salad tasted soapy and all of my tables food was cold. When we brought it up to the waitress she was nonchalantly rude. We tried to come to a conclusion but she thought it was best to walk away while I was in the middle of speaking with her. Service was laughable and food was mediocre on a good day. Save your money and time.

reviews.author: Casey R.
reviews.description: This place was a jewel of a find! Just 4 miles up from the San Marcos premium outlets this place is well worth the stop. A gentleman from North face recommended it to us and we are thankful we listened. The best way I can describe this place is a pub like feel with amazing pub like food and even better personal service! The gluten free menu was AMAZING and I felt safe eating here as a celiac! The rest of our group had plenty of option as well. Two of us had burgers and the other had soup and sandwich and we enjoyed every bite! Jeanne was our server (hope I spelt that correctly) and she did a great job helping us choose menu items! If we ever come back to Austin/San Marcos this will be a stop on our list!! The gluten free burger was so good, the bun was not crumbly or taste like cardboard but perfect! I actually took home half of the bun to eat later... ha! Thanks 54th Street, it was great!

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: Surprisingly good drinks and comfort food.   I had the loaded tater tots and a pina colada. The tater tots were filling, and made me feel full despite the order only giving five tater tots or so.   The pina colada was good too. I am usually not a fan of alcohol, but this pina colada was actually good to me. Not too bitter, which was pleasing. However if you have more mature tastes, then the drinks here might not be satisfactory. College students like sweet alcohol, and this restaurant gives exactly that.   Parking is plentiful, and the demographic of this restaurant is mostly college students. This place gets loud too.

reviews.author: Bradi S.
reviews.description: We are not from here and needed suggestions on what to do here while we wait for our table. Kiara and Brenda at the front where amazing. They were so nice and suggested so many choices. It was so fun and chill didn't even realize we where waiting for a table. I recommend this place and haven't even been here. I've been to so many places and the hostesses are never this nice. Definitely have great staff here!

reviews.author: Michelle M.
reviews.description: cons: I didn't order it but apparently the flavored lemonade was more so like lipton than fresh.  The crispy calamari wasn't crispy (but it tasted fine).  pros: The greeter and waiter were both polite from the start till the end.  The alfredo pizza was yummmmmy. The price was reasonable.  The interior was nice.  We went mid day during the week so it wasn't busy.  Their timing with the food was good.  overall: Very nice.

reviews.author: Mati L.
reviews.description: I ordered online for curbside. I pull in and call to let them know I'm there. Stephanie tells me she will be out shortly. 7 minutes later I get a text saying my food is being packaged. 20 minutes go by so I call back. Stephanie nicely apologizes as it was sitting there for about 20 minutes. I get home and the order was not correct. $30 with tip for extremely cold, incorrect food. I tried to eat it but it was awful. I was trying to be so nice, but I just want to cry lol

reviews.author: Jocelyn M.
reviews.description: Took the family out for a graduation celebration. They took our large party in with very little wait. The prime rib was delicious and my kids enjoyed their pizza. Love the mini pizzaokies because you can try 3 different kinds. I had the strawberry shortcake pizzaokie and it was super delicious!

reviews.author: Bill B.
reviews.description: This review is just the staff and not the food as the food was good along with the cold beer. We went into the New Braunfels BJ's in the afternoon on a Sunday, not real busy. Sat down and waited about 15-20 mins before a server came by. I asked him they were busy and he said no, I responded with oh I thought you might be since it took you so long to come by the table. So that may have come off wrong but bear with me. With that comment the waiter said oh I must have been getting someone's food. Ok I can understand that. He takes our order which is Nacho's for my wife and I to share and drinks. The food comes out quickly and looks great! The gentleman that brought the food (not our waiter) asked what else we needed, plates please. About that time our waiter stops by and asks what else we needed and I said napkins. Ok, so here we have a large order of nacho's and no, plates or napkins or even waters? After about 30 mins the waiter comes back by and asks us what else we need. My wife asked for a water.  More than 5 mins later he brings it out. The entire time this waiter never smiled and for that matter none of the servers smiled at any of there guests. We watched them all while we ate and it was unreal how unhappy these people looked. To be honest, I left a $1.87 tip on a $35.00 ticket. I usually would have tipped $7.00-$10.00 on that if it was good service but he just made us feel like we shouldn't be in his space. I'm old, 68 and maybe getting a little mean but a smile and a "I care" attitude would go along ways! The bad is that no one will do anything about this, look at the corporate Facebook page and it's negative after negative comments and no responses.

reviews.author: Anna W.
reviews.description: The cauliflower and quinoa bowl was perfect for a light yet filling meal. The server was super prompt and helpful throughout our dining experience.

reviews.author: Melyn G.
reviews.description: Early dinner seems to be our thing these days as that seems to be our most comfortable level of dining in .. also great to take advantage of any happy hour apps or bevs when you dine early  So first things first, YES the staff are masked and gloved. YES social distancing is enforced, YES there is sanitizer available at the entrance.  Service was great, beverage selections always great here esp if you like craft brew. My choice here is Jeremiah Red if you like a bock or amber beer.  The calamari we ordered for appetizer was plenty to share between the two of us..could definitely split three ways and fresh and not rubbery or tough. We also split the delicious Ahi Tuna salad and a small pizza.  The tuna could have had a better sear, like the salad  I had here couple years ago.  Now I will say the pizza is deep dish pie, and I felt fell a bit short on the cheese, but the buttery soft crust was delicious.  The pizza did take nearly 20 minutes before arriving to our table...good time for conversation with company and enjoying your drinks, so be prepared for the wait.   Menu is online and paying your bill is also taken care of online.  No exchanging paper or using a shared pen to sign your tab.

reviews.author: Jill D.
reviews.description: Took our daughter for birthday dinner. Our server was great but the food was not. Soup was not warm, fish was burned and overcooked, all fries were cold.  A bummer for sure.

reviews.author: George A.
reviews.description: I ordered the gluten free sweet pig pizza. I wasn't quite sure on what the size was of if there was any size options but I gave it a go anyway. Coming in at about $16 I was expecting a little more pizza for my money. The crust was good. It had some crunch and a little chew. I was disappointed that they forgot to add one of the standard topping of this specialty pizza.

reviews.author: Katlyn P.
reviews.description: We love our pazookies! It just so happen that we got our pazookies 1/2 off because of a special they had! We were in for treat! We only paid $3 for one!   I can't write too much about my visit because we were In and our pretty  fast. The dessertt was great! And the service as well.

reviews.author: Katlyn C.
reviews.description: Updated review: Since our original visit last year, my husband and I have visited BJ's MANY times. I would say that the speed of service has improved since our first visit. My new food favorite is the ribs. They are SO GOOD. (Literally had them 4 times the past month) I have also discovered their happy hour food specials and very impressed with the prices and quality.  Overall, still highly recommended. Get the ribs!

reviews.author: Fox E.
reviews.description: I think everyone loves BJs except for me. There are very few people who don't love BJs. So since everyone is obsessed with BJs I'm going to focus on the positives of BJs instead of listing what I don't like about BJs.  Really enjoyable sports pub in the north burbs of San Antonio (far north on I-35) which I visited on two occasions - mostly because it's right off the highway, so when we're in this part of town and somebody wants to meet up with me (a specific dude, basically) this is usually his choice because he thinks it's more convenient for me. I told him on a number of occasions that I'd rather go five miles off the highway to some amazing little ethnic hidden gem, but he's always like, no this one's easier and it's my favourite place anyway - I think it's easier for him more than me, 2 mins drive and he's right there.  I do like it though, and good memories here for us. For a sports bar it has pretty good food and he's all about the alcohol and they have a good selection, and pretty decent prices as well for that matter.

reviews.author: Ally K.
reviews.description: we had the server anna, and she was the best server i've ever had she was so funny and personable. it was the best experience i've ever had at bj's i will never sit with another server again! she is AWESOME!

reviews.author: Lucinda V.
reviews.description: The food and service was great.  However this review is for the manager of thr establishment.   A gentleman sat at the bar and was either psychologically going through something or simply on drugs.  The bartenders were women and immediately we all noticed something wasn't right.  One of the ladies asked for the manager...but apparently because of his size or i don't know what he did nothing and eventually sent the chef out to talk the the guy.  This didn't work and the man continued talking to demons and requesting wine. Finally the manager came out and talked to the guy and walked him out.   But i feel like it should have been handled more quickly as the employees obviously didn't feel safe.

reviews.author: Travis N.
reviews.description: Just an update to my last review of this restaurant. The manager and staff are class acts. The manager reached out and they have made adjustments to the New Orleans Jambalaya so t hey don't have the same issues in the future. Customer service at this restaurant is very important and they will go the extra mile to ensure their actions speak loud and clear.

reviews.author: Brian M.
reviews.description: Horrible experience!! After a long stressful week my family and I wanted to have dinner here on a Friday night. The hostess told us it was going to be an hour wait. Which was unfortunate but we were fine with waiting. We asked about getting drinks for our kids while we waited and the hostess told us no. We said even water would be fine. Just something for our kids while we waited an HOUR for our table. She looked at our kids and very coldly said absolutely not. What kind of horrible place won't even give kids a glass of water while they wait an hour for a table?

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Concept is good.  Execution is not. Double pork chop was good as was the side of broccoli. The baked potato was room temperature.  The avocado egg roll appetizer came out with the main course.  Egg rolls were a miss.  A disappointing experience.

reviews.author: Evan G.
reviews.description: My wife and I are absolutely disappointed in BJ's for the service we were provided this last time we visited. The wait was said to be 15-20 minutes and it was 38 minutes. Our food took forever and our appetizers came out cold with our main entrees, thank god avocado rolls taste fine semi cold. Our waitresses were rude, my wife said one was Brooke and she couldn't catch the hostess's name. It seemed like we were bothering both of them for even coming to eat there. We have never had an experience like this before with BJ's Restaurants. Please chat with your employees about their attitudes and figure out an actual time frame.

reviews.author: Sheila C.
reviews.description: Put a order for delivery in by Grubhub.  Ordered at 8:06 it didn't arrive until 9:15 pm. I only live about 2 miles away. Pizza was ordered with instructions to please do not drizzle with garlic aioli sauce and put on side, but there its is drizzled.  The pizza was already cold and nothing else had to be cooked so I am guessing the delay in time was grub hub but when the only Instructions you leave are please don't drizzle, then unless you are Mother Nature, then please don't drizzle.

reviews.author: Tracie W.
reviews.description: I ordered the lunch personal pizza and it was pathetic!  No sauce, little cheese, and 4 pieces of pepperoni!!  Embarrassing for BJ's!!

reviews.author: Sarah A.
reviews.description: My mother, son and I visited this location Saturday evening. We were able to get in even with limited seating due to the social distancing. My son has multiple life threatening food allergies. The server and manager were absolutely awesome with them. The manager went the extra mile in making sure my son could eat the fries by having some made on the side to avoid any cross contamination. He also double checked labels for us. The service was top notch. We will definitely visit this location in the future.

reviews.author: Jane R.
reviews.description: Amazing everything!  Friendly staff, great outdoor ambiance, freakin good food!  We got the Santa Fe and The Alamo wrap, with group beef. The ground beef used it the same for both, so the difference is really the other topping inside. We also got the fully loaded fries... Hands down, best fully loaded version I've had! The fries was prepared well, the toppings were generous. Just typing this out makes my mouth salivate already lol!  I wish we were close to this place, I'd always get their fries!

reviews.author: Samantha D.
reviews.description: They took our money and promised food but they weren't open!   The online system took our order and charged our card, but when we went to pick it up, there was absolutely no one there. Everything was dark and shut up tight( even though online it said they were open) with no sign or anything. We have repeatedly phoned them to check but they don't answer. While we figured out what to do, several other cars pulled up to pick up their online order, but of course, no one was there. Very unprofessional of them and disappointing. After I reached out to my community, I found out this is actually a very common thing, so I don't understand how they can remain in business. This is absolutely unacceptable, especially since they charged my card already.

reviews.author: David G.
reviews.description: If you take 3009 from I-35, as if you're following the signs to the Natural Bridge Caverns, on the right side is a place called Wraptitude, which features amazing burgers, gourmet wraps, seasonal salads and tacos. There's even a kids menu so, just about everyone in your family will be happy.    Wraptitude is a rustic place with most of the tables outside either on a small deck or, fenced yard which includes a playground for the little ones. There's also a small sit down bar inside as well. I had The Maverick burger which includes cheese, avocado, bacon and 1000 island dressing. There's also a Goose burger (are you noticing a theme here?), Viper Tacos and so much more.  This is not a fancy place so, don't get all gussied-up but, it's a nice family place to bring the kids out, meet up with friends.  The staff are extremely friendly and polite.   I hope you have a chance to enjoy this very casual place and with the weather beginning to warm up, eating outside will be fun again.

reviews.author: Patricia L.
reviews.description: Found this gem while treating a Veteran to a lunch on Veterans Day. It's a nice small indoor/large outdoor restaurant. Upon arrival parking was easy and they have plenty of room. You can see a lot of picnic tables and small playground set.   I'm giving 3 stars because the lady who took our order was super rude. I would ask a question and it was met with so much attitude and unwillingness to help. If it wasn't for me treating a friend to lunch I would have completely walked away from this place.   The bright side was that the food turned out really good. We split an order of sweet potato fries bc it's a huge serving. I ordered the Santa Fe wrap which is Pepper Jack, black beans, corn, rice, chipotle spread with avocado (vegetarian option). It was really pleasing, wrap done right. They also have a nice selection room of craft beers.

reviews.author: Casey P.
reviews.description: Great food... wraps, burgers and fries are the best. Couple that with an amazing drink selection and it's a great place to hang out with friends or family. they're a return spot for us!!!

reviews.author: Raul Z.
reviews.description: I recommend this place, cause when it is nice outdoors, this is a great place to be. Also the food is great. To me, once they change the buns on the burgers, I want a burger now. I didn't like the buns before, so I started getting the wraps, which are delicious, now I'm hooked on the BLT. Plus this place has a friendly staff, they do get busy, so the wait for food may be awhile, but the beer selection is pretty decent.   One draw back is the bathroom, just one.

reviews.author: Laura Grace K.
reviews.description: Always love coming here! Food is fantastic and has its own unique flavors, and the staff always make you feel at home! Would highly recommend!

reviews.author: Kristin N.
reviews.description: I've been here a few times now and I've thoroughly enjoyed each visit. Parking is a little strange but I haven't had any issues. Way more outdoor seating than indoor. (Which I love). You can sub a beyond meat patty in any of their burgers. The food is yummy, the beer is good, and the staff was super sweet.

reviews.author: Mechila B.
reviews.description: If I could give half stars, I would give this place 3.5, but it just didn't deserve 4 stars.   The staff was nice. They weren't wearing masks or gloves, so keep that in mine when going.  The had a little park thing and a bunch of outside seating, so it's great if you have a family!  We didn't get to try any of the beers.  The Cali club was good, but there was nothing special about it.  The maverick was good but again, there was nothing special about it.  The loaded fries were good, but it wasn't as presentable as I could make it myself at home. It also felt like it had waited out for a while before it got to us.  There was nothing really special about this place, but the food was ok.

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: We had been wanting a try this place for a quite sometime and since we were in the area, we did. We had the Cali wrap and the loaded fries. Both were okay, nothing that I would go back for.  Also, there is very limited parking and inside seating. So if it's crowded and hot, cold, rainy etc., you will be sitting outside.

reviews.author: Maria D.
reviews.description: Why did I wait so long to try this place? Wraptitude was on the way to the lake so we finally stopped by.  The outdoor seating is nicely shaded. This place is also dog friendly. Our waitress greeted us and introduced herself. I am horrible with names, but the receipt said Martha. She was friendly had the Rattlesnake Burger Bowl and my husband had the Greek Wrap.

reviews.author: Megan J.
reviews.description: Came in for a quick lunch with the hubby. The waitress at the bar was nice. We both hd tea and it was good nothing special. My husband had the 46 burger wrap. It was ok. The sauce tasted like thousand island. Nothing made it special. The menu stated it came with fries, but he didn't get any. I ordered the Hollywood taco. The shredded chicken was GREAT. The price for what I got was high. Just a normal sized taco you would make at home. The tortilla tasted like an H‑E‑B tortilla, not bad just ok. The meat was topped with a few kernels of corn and fresh diced jalapeño. The verde sauce was mediocre. Again nothing special. I added fries to my order and they were good, Very crispy. They were out of fried pickles which was a huge let down since it was one of the reasons we chose to give this place a shot, but I'm not holding it against them with the supply shortages going on right now.  Overall everything was ok, but didn't seem worth the drive or the price.

reviews.author: J H.
reviews.description: So we're heading to the caverns and wanted lunch.  We ARE NOT chic filet kinda people!!  Found this place on yelp and it was along the route we were taking.  OK yes, it is somewhat of a hole in the wall, or for that matter quaint, picturesque, salon, on the side of the road. Walked in and were greeted by Heidi (one of the owners), she told us to pick where we wanted to sit, so we saddled up to the bar.  Yes, small bar, but very adequate, plenty of tables to sit inside, and outside.   Craving a burger, but not wanting the bun, started reviewing the wraps.  My husband and I both ordered wraps and a order of onion rings.   My Santa Fe with ground beef was wonderful, the cheese was creamy, the beef tender with just a hint of spice.  My husband enjoyed the Alamo wrap and it disappeared.  OH, don't let me forget the salsa she gives you with the wrap, I don't remember what it was but it was super with kick!  The onion rings we shared (small order), was the perfect amount for two people, they were fresh and hot!  We are not dippers, so we did not take Heidi up on the sauces she offered for the rings. If ever back in this neck of the woods, we WILL be back!

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Came here with the family after doing Natural Bridge Caverns. First, be prepared to sit outside, there's not much room inside, especially during the social distancing times. However, even though it was over 90 degrees outside the shade and breeze kept it cool enough to be pleasant. Kids had a playground to okay on - though it was a bit past it's prime.   The ordering seemed a bit haphazzard, which seemed to be due to only have one employee working front of house despite it being rush hour lunch time. This caused me to have to stand at the bar for considerable amounts of time waiting to order or when I went to get a beer. Hopefully this was just someone not showing up for a shift and not a perpetual issue.   Now for the food. I had a Santa Fe wrap. Standard Mexican ingredients, but all together tasty. My wife's burger wrap with fries in the wrap looked quite good. Kids chicken strips were solid quality. The fries had good flavor and crunchy outsides. Beer selection was surprisingly good (Blood and Honey automatically  means I'm happy).   Solid, if not spectacular experience.

reviews.author: Shelia C.
reviews.description: I was excited to try this place and loved the outdoor area. My friend and I ordered the Santa Fe wrap and we were quite disappointed. The entire wrap was rice, it was so hard to eat because of the amount of rice made the wrap so dry. It hardly had any chicken, mine had maybe a 3 little pieces of chicken bits and about 6 black beans. Just a drop of sauce and no cheese or corn. I should have taken a pic but I had to open mine up to remove the big glob of rice. Same with my friends. Our sons loved their burger and grilled cheese. Next time I will try a burger but for being called wraptitude, I was expecting a good wrap.

reviews.author: Sergio M.
reviews.description: Service could be better but I love from scratch good food always good and dope area for kids to play at

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: We stopped by after spending the morning at Natural Bridge caverns. We ordered a few burger wraps, chicken strips, and the surf burger from the kids menus. The food was really tasty and fries were delicious. The main issue here was that they seemed to be understaffed and weren't set up very well for social distancing. They have a very small seating area and bar inside and several picnic tables and outdoor seating options. While you can spread out just fine outside, you have to go inside of the crowded small building to place your order. It was a very small space with too many people inside close together. Also, the fountain drinks and cups were self-serve set up right next to where everyone was standing. If they had online or outside ordering so that you could avoid going inside, it would really improve things.

reviews.author: Andrea M.
reviews.description: This was the 1st meal while in Texas, and we dare say it was superb. The guy running the restaurant was super chill and energetic. The atmosphere was relaxing with the eclectic decor.  The hubs had the burger wrap while I had 3 tacos (pork, asada, and avutarian). We also shared the half-loaded fries.  The fries were amazing! Usually with these types of dishes, the fries become soggy or aren't even crispy to begin with. These had a crunch even to the last few pieces. And not to mention, it was loaded with a lot of beef and bacon pieces. What a value for the amount of meat that's in it.  His burger wrap was seriously da bomb. All the 46 sauce and ingredients stuffed inside the wrap was just oozing outwards. The wrap consisted of beef, bacon bits, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and onions -- pretty much what a burger is. Biting into this was a wowing moment. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.  My tacos were okay. They weren't superb (standard lettuce, cheese, lime, and tomatillo salsa). I wouldn't rec it as this place isn't known for their tacos:  * Asada: The avocados were creamy. This was prob the freshest and tastiest of the 3 tacos. * Avutarian: The flavors were faint at most. There wasn't much wow or anything that made this taco look nor taste diff. * Pork: The flavors were lacking, and the pork looked super bland (see the only close-up pic worth taking).  Everything about this experience was 5 stars minus my taco choices. The loaded fries and burger wrap were just mind-blowing delicious and at a great price.  Though there were limited parking spaces in the front, the back had plenty of nooks and crannies you could squeeze your car into.

reviews.author: Wilma K.
reviews.description: Just had a great burger. We love the Mavericks burger their fires are fantastic we'll seasoned and hot. My husband loves the beer here, McConahas.

reviews.author: Jonathan P.
reviews.description: foods good but as a black man im always accompanied with some death stares in short theyre probably racist

name: Huisache Grill
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Florencia Z.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere!  Turkey sandwich was yummy.  Great service. Love the decor and outdoor area

reviews.author: Roger W.
reviews.description: Thursday night we decided to celebrate my wife's birthday,  since they do not take reservations and did not want to chance sitting outside waiting for a table we went at 5:30pm. We were able to park close and was seated right away. We loved the look and feel of the court yard and restaurant.  Cozy is how we described it. Our server was attentive and we passed on appetizers but order a bottle of French sauvignon blanc wine. Very good wine at a reasonable price point. We both ordered the 7oz loin steak. I opted for chicken tortilla soup, tasty thick soup but it was not very hot (Temperature). My wife had the salad with blu cheese dressing (good quality). We were pleased that our entrees did not arrive until we finished our soup/salad course. Again a point of proper service by our server. Our loin steaks were proper Temperature and had a great char crust. Great tasting. Green beans were fresh and cooked with still a bite to them. Roasted potatoes were nice.  For dessert we ordered black coffee that was fresh, cheesecake and a chocolate cake with ice cream. Desserts were very good.  We highly recommend and we return soon

reviews.author: Keith W.
reviews.description: My new favorite place in New Braunfels! I had a work meeting here and I was looking forward to eating at a restaurant that I have not been to before. I had seen all of the great reviews and even had some friends that Have recommended this place.  I love the decor and the house feel to this restaurant. We were seated right away and the service was top notch. I got the tortilla soup which I recommend and I ordered the steak with the port wine reduction sauce with blue cheese. I am picky about my steaks partly because I think I am pretty decent at cooking my own. This steak did not disappoint and the sauce was amazing.  Afterwards I had the cheesecake which was not only good but also the perfect size. If you are in New Braunfels you need to make a visit here and check this place out!

reviews.author: Dezeray C.
reviews.description: This is by far my favorite restaurant; I do pick at lease once every two weeks. It's a great place to have a date the atmosphere is just romantic they have out side sheeting shopping in the area and everything on the menu is just amazing. I usually start off with the chips and three salsa, then my go to entree is the steak medium rare with blue cheese sauce, for those of you who don't like blue cheese still try it even if it on the side because I know I'm not a blue cheese love but this sauce just hits different. If you have room for dessert get the cheesecake that has melted Carmel with  pecans or take it to go it's a great breakfast. They are also kid friendly so it a nice romantic dinner even if you don't have a sitter. The service is always great no matter who's your server just expect a wait Friday, Saturday and Sunday but it's so worth it promise.

reviews.author: Kevin Z.
reviews.description: Great pre dinner drinks and a nice relaxed meal.  Very friendly service and good solid food.

reviews.author: Rhianna F.
reviews.description: Food - presentation was nice, although the food itself was okay.  It wasn't terrible, but the taste wasn't memorable.  The service was excellent though which made up for the lackluster food.  I have eaten here a couple of times.  Once was just for wine and cheese board, which this seems to be a much better place for, just not the full dinner.

reviews.author: Kelly B.
reviews.description: I love Huisache.  BTW, it's pronounced wesatche. Huisache has a great feel to it.  It's cozy and cool.  It's quiet and quirky. The people who work there are friendly.   The parking is difficult but the food is worth the trouble. Huisache's meals are one of a kind.  They take fairly ordinary recipes and add little twists.  Those twists make their entrees taste marvelous. Well done Huisache Grill!

reviews.author: Thomas P.
reviews.description: We came in on March 12th, around 3 pm. If I could leave 0 stars I would. First off it was a hassle being seated even though the restaurant was almost empty. The hostesses were very rude and non understanding. We asked to be seated outside near a heater and she threw a huge fit, returned outside and threw our menus and silverware and plates (which were filthy from the patrons before, they had not been cleaned properly and were covered in food). Then we waited for a good 10 minutes and still we're not seen by a server so we left. All in all terrible service and cleanliness.

reviews.author: Kay C.
reviews.description: My SO and I have visited several times for dinner and enjoyed each visit. Terrific wine menu and it is one of the only restaurants I've been to that doesn't overcook salmon. The baked brie is to die for. 5 stars for dinner. Lunch was not as wonderful experience, 3 stars for lunch.

reviews.author: Mccall L.
reviews.description: This is by far my favorite restaurant in New Braunfels! Their food is delicious, and service is incredible. You literally cannot go wrong in whatever you order so if you see something that looks good, go for it! 99% chance it will be the best one you've had.

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: Perfect place for a celebration, my realtor  and the owner of company she works for took me here  as a thank you for using there service.  The food was fantastic!   Service amazing .

reviews.author: Mary R.
reviews.description: Ok, maybe we came on the wrong night? I see this is a local favorite. It was super busy and I love love love the staff. Can't sing enough praises for the staff.   My issue was the food quality. I have run restaurants and I know what should and should not be on a plate, especially with such a busy place. The salad was wilted. My tomatoes were starting to shrivel. The bread had been frozen and not thawed all the way before they cooked it. The meat was a lower grade than we were expecting.   Sometimes it's hard for me to eat out having shopped for three cafes and been a chef for 10 years, so take this review knowing I'm very picky.  My expectations are probably higher than they should be.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: Friendly service and pretty yummy charcuterie to go for a nice picnic we had :-) would definitely like to come back here for an entire meal sometime! The patio area looked really nice.

reviews.author: Angela R.
reviews.description: The food and ambiance is perfect for a date night. I've been here several times and have never been disappointed. The shrimp and green onion cakes appetizer was excellent!

reviews.author: Susan C.
reviews.description: Went here for my birthday because it used to be my favorite restaurant.  The charcuterie board was the only thing that was edible.  The food was poorly seasoned. The mashed potatoes were dried out. The meat was over cooked. And the waitress was inattentive.    This place used to be a gem prior to the pandemic.  I would recommend it to people from out of town.  Now, I will just warn them to not waste their money here.

reviews.author: Andrea G.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time about 1 week ago. I loved the location, the atmosphere was romantic and cozy. My husband and I thought the place was beautiful, however the food was ok. We started off with some wine, the moscato was great and added to the ambiance. We had the broiled spinach and artichoke dip.  I was expecting a traditional dip, but let me tell you what we got was not average at all. The dip seemed to have a hint of lime in it. My husband loved it, it was not for me. I can more closely describe it to tasting like corn in a cup. They also serve it with bread and chips. For an entre, I had the parmesan breaded chicken breast. It was stuffed with mushroom's, spinach, cheese and  artichoke hearts, served with a side of penne pasta and broccoli. I wish that my chicken was stuffed significantly more. I could hardly taste the filling. The penne pasta was a little bland, but I did not mind it. The broccoli was cooked to perfection and I quite enjoyed it. My hubby got the 2oz mixed grill. He was satisfied, but mentioned it was not for him.   In conclusion, this place is worth a try, the location is beautiful, and they also have cats in their courtyard!

reviews.author: Bill R.
reviews.description: My wife and I stumbled upon this place today and it ended up serving the single best meal I've ever had in Texas: no kidding.  Starters, entrees, beers and service were excellent. I've already recommended it to friends.

reviews.author: Juliee D.
reviews.description: First time to visit.   Was difficult to find the entrance and where to park.   Menu had lots of things I wanted to try but I ordered the salad sampler plate.  Shrimp salad was delicious, the chicken salad was good but the spinach salad was drenched in way too much dressing. So much that I literally couldn't eat it.  I will know next time to ask for on the site.  Loved the ambiance.  Will definitely go back

reviews.author: Tracy S.
reviews.description: First time trying this place out and do glad we did! This restaurant is so romantic, a great place for a date night. Parking is a little tricky but they have a lot available at W. Cross St and this gives you the opportunity to walk through all the cute little shops in the area. The wine list was impressive; they have a wide variety to choose from. The food was delicious and the dessert was phenomenal. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Mike Z.
reviews.description: I ordered the tortilla soup and salad. The soup was thinner than other tortilla soups I've had in the past, but it was delicious. My wife ordered the penne pasta with chicken. Very tasty!!

name: Spec's Wines, Spirits and Finer Foods

reviews.author: Marie C.
reviews.description: Many thanks to the awesome staff for taking the time to answer all of our questions and making me and my husband feel comfortable!  I feel like going into specialty stores like this are intimidating, because everyone seems to know what they want. My husband and I don't drink often, and it got overwhelming looking through all the variety of fine wines and liquors.  We had questions about vodka, and thankfully staff came up to us to give us recommendations on both local and nationwide brands. We decided to try some locally made vodka and WOW! One of the smoothest drinks I've ever had.   They also sell frozen foods, horderves, plates and silverware, which makes this place a perfect spot if you're looking to host a last minute get together or date!

reviews.author: Christine F.
reviews.description: Quite the store. Dropped by to check out the beer options. Wow , do they have plenty of beer, wine, hard liquor and " snacks" . They offered both cold and room temp beer. Wines from all around the world . And "snacks" ; a wonderful selection of cheeses and other snacks. There were plenty of helpful staff about to offer suggestions or help you find a particular item.

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: Great selection of wines, beers, spirits and other items. This is one of their larger locations, but it's not their biggest location. The staff was very friendly.

reviews.author: John K.
reviews.description: Your typical community huge liquor store with affordable price and everything. They even have a cigar room in the back.  We come here for all our liquor needs.

reviews.author: Raven H.
reviews.description: Spec's has endless options to appease anywhere from a casual to an ultra refined palette. The majority of the staff really knows their stuff and are eager to help you hunt anything down.   If you're walking in for the first time, don't let how huge the place is throw you off your game. Everything is well sorted and sectioned off so even if you don't want direction from staff, a quick skip down any aisle will give you an idea of what that section offers. There's usually a couple tastings near the entry, incentive while you're shopping, and the first Wednesday of every month there's a pretty big wine tasting (Usually 7-10 sections, each offering several samples.)  Beyond beer, wine, and spirits, Spec's offers some pretty swanky snack sections. Its a great place if you're wanting to build a gift basket for someone, or if you're in a hurry they have some pre-built gift baskets up for grabs, too.   The prices are pretty fair, I've never bought something and found it astoundingly differently priced anywhere else. They do offer good deals if you're paying cash instead of debit or credit, they give a military discount, and if you're a Spec's rewards member there are perks like first dibs whenever hard to get items come in. Its a pretty great option to scoop up everything you'd need in one stop.

reviews.author: Larry S.
reviews.description: Been to this store MANY times; however, this evening was a terrible experience.  No registers (normally manned) were open so only checking out at the front where the half-pints/pints/etc. are located.  Waited in line a few minutes, which was no big deal.  When I was called "next" I quickly requested a pint, but the guy checking me out was a complete jerk!! Rude, condescending and generally, I guess, in a bad mood.  No business should hire people like that!  Didn't thank me for the business ... just remained surly.  So, too many other liquor stores to put up with that crap and it will be my last visit to Spec's.  Oh, by the way Spec's, the holiday season is closely approaching and I normally spend my fair share during that time ... not this year for you!  You're like the liquor store nazi ... adios!

reviews.author: Mike F.
reviews.description: Wine, beer, spirits... while located next to a graveyard not those kind of spirits (ha ha).    If you have not been to Spec's, take a deep breath before you enter and remain calm... this place is HUGE!  Overwhelmingly huge.  While it is impossible for me to say they had everything known, I find myself wondering if it's possible that they don't have something.    Wall to wall to wall to end cap of wines, spirits beers and nick knacks.  I thoroughly enjoy my time here when I visit.  Staff are knowledgeable more so than I expect.  Shelves are fully stocked, price is usually fair and, sales pop up from time to time.  Overall a great experience and a nice place to go even if it is to just browse.

reviews.author: Gera F.
reviews.description: Have gone to this store many times before no problems. Yesterday I went at 4:45 I got in line behind at least 10 people. Only one cashier. Employees all around the store. Two for curbside and no one was there. It took 15 minutes to check out one person.  No help for the one cashier. After checking the gentleman out he had to go get a box. I left.  Went to the one on Bander and 1604. More people in the store. Two cashers with someone assisting each cashier.  One person in front of me. Was in and out in 5 minutes.

reviews.author: Esther M.
reviews.description: This is a huge store! In addition to their vast selection of liquor and large array of wine options they have special chocolaty treats to purchase and lots of fun bar and party snacks. They have cigars and cigar supplies. I usually frequent the Spec's at the Villages at Stone Oak but the wine guy there told me this store offers wine tasting on the first  Wednesday of the month so we decided to try it out. It  was a nice little event, 5 wine stations with at least 2 wines but most had 3-4 options to taste. There was a little tiny sample of a cheese, onion, and olive and a bonus station of bloody Mary tasting. I really like being able to taste affordable wines before purchasing and they offer them at case price if you purchase during the event. Only thing I would suggest is either bring your own palate cleansing cracker, etc or maybe Spec's could offer a small palate cleaning option at each station. I understand this is a free event but a small option should be  to much to ask for. Also, the pourers didn't seem to know to much about the wine, they were just pouring. However, I think it would have been more interesting if they would have known more about the wine/region/etc. Additionally, one can bring their own wine glass. I ended up purchasing some wines that I would have never purchased otherwise. Over all, pretty neat little free event and I will attend again for sure.

reviews.author: Katie L.
reviews.description: Wine tasting on the first Wednesday of every month! It's my favoriteeee. :) Also, yummy salsa samples from a cool lady. The employees are rad. It can get crowded, but it's FREE!

reviews.author: Jack L.
reviews.description: Awesome selection and service. Michael Thompson was extremely helpful regarding the cigar section, which is one of the best stocked I have ever seen. They have all sorts of hard to find liquors, I found myself in awe of just how much they have to offer. On top of it all there is a military discount (thank you!) AND a discount for using cash or debit. This is truly a glorious place to shop.

reviews.author: Mia S.
reviews.description: Lots of variety here. Good prices. Just stupid to be closed on Sundays (I know it isn't anything to do with spec's)

reviews.author: Christine M.
reviews.description: I'm absolutely livid with the poor customer service practices at this Spec's in particular, and from this point forward will avoid Spec's altogether as much as I possibly can. Ugh!  I've been coming in to this store, in person, at least once per day for over a week, looking for a limited-release beer. On the first visit, a manager filled out a Special Order form with my contact info, assuring me that, while the beer would be sold on a first-come, first-serve basis with no holds,  I would receive a phone call when it was indeed in stock so I could haul over there in a hurry and pick one up. On each subsequent visit - the most recent being 8:30 last night - my phone number was confirmed and I was assured that I would receive a call when it was available.  With no call received, I stopped in this afternoon to check in, just in case, and was informed that the beer had come in this morning and sold out already, that they had deemed it, upon delivery, "not fair" to follow through with the promised phone call. Bullshit!  If that had been the case from the beginning, fine. 100% understandable. But given that it's acceptable practice for management to switch gears at the 11th hour and completely disregard their promises to me, I find that it would be *unfair* to my consumer conscience to continue to spend any money at store with such ridiculously poor customer service standards.

reviews.author: Dimona E.
reviews.description: This is my go-to place for a vast selection of wines and spirits at reasonable prices.

reviews.author: Rod B.
reviews.description: The best selection of liquor and gourmet foods, snacks, others.

reviews.author: Mad A.
reviews.description: Ladies and Gentlemen? I gotta give a mad shoutout to Spec's. But seriously folks. Can you really find something to complain about here? I tried to find the elusive bottle of Glen Deveron single malt scotch here as well. It was in the computer but I had no luck in procuring this Nectar of the Gods. But that is ok. The gentleman who assisted me took the time to look and found out he could not get it. I will not need to tell my own self to SHADDAPP!! because there is no need to whine or complain. In case you have not noticed the shelves are brimming with many other fine products to your liking. And not being able to find EXACTLY what you think you need is definitely a first world problem.   I would like to add that at this particular location I was able to procure some Absinthe spoons which I could not locate elsewhere. And this just made my girly man nipples erect with exhilaration. Otherwise I would have had to order the dang things online which I luckily avoided. And this is good because just like the rest of the crowd of habitually chronic complainers, I like immediate gratification. It is nice to see the object I wish to purchase. To touch it. Hold it. Imagine how good it will feel to impart it into use. Try this with a stripper in a club somewhere and you will get tossed out of there in a hurry. So this theory does not work everywhere. Be advised.   And the thing with Spec's is that you really can't beat their prices. And the selection of tequilas as well as wines is unsurpassed. I have never had a complaint for any gift I have purchased here for anybody here. Maybe that is because all my friends are alcoholics? NAH! It just means that I might be unimaginative when it comes to buying gifts such as liquor or cigars and resort to this. But it is great because my buddies can enjoy their cigars and liquor guilt free. If you have male friends who are married with three kids or more then always get them a good bottle of liquor and a few stogies for a gift. It will always hold you in the esteem of "righteous dude" status. Even if their wives don't particularly care for you.   And a few hours spent in their company for obligatory holiday visits will leave you invigorated upon departed their company. And you will also feel less sorry for your old buddy when you leave him with the ball and chain as well as the life to which he is fastened like a dog on a chain leash. What the hell else can you do? You told him not to marry her. Besides, you left him with a good bottle of whiskey. And now your work is done. You have been the best friend you can be!   I am your yelp buddy, Madman!! And you can always trust my reviews and I will never steer you wrong! Happy New Year! Don't be an idiot. Don't drink and drive! Unless you are swinging wood on the golf course. That's a much different kind of driving. There are other kinds of driving too. But I believe I have said quite enough already.

reviews.author: David B.
reviews.description: This Texas! I love this store with all my heart. If you have a question find the manager of that department and have your mind blown. They give a wicked cash discount everyday. Good beer selection and nice people can't beat it!

reviews.author: Jimmie R.
reviews.description: I've been going to Creekside for a while, so this was my first time in this Spec's in a while. And it will be my last. Pathetic selection of craft beer.  No Real Ale bombers? Seriously? No Guadalupe. No New Braunfels. Limited Branchline. They did have 5 Stone and Freetail. A few Austin breweries but very limited selection even from those.  Not much of anything. Skip this Spec's and drive to New Braunfels. Or back into San Antonio to Gabriel's or Total Wine.

reviews.author: AErik W.
reviews.description: The liquor manager is knowledgeable and easy to deal with. He will help you find what you are looking for even the hard to get stuff and if they can't get it he will make outstanding recommendations!  Thanks Victor!

reviews.author: Kevin H.
reviews.description: This is a pretty big Specs across from the forum. Beer guy out. Asst mgr helped a little bit. But I don't find anything exciting to try new. Ended up with Left Hand Sawtooth ( one of my all time favorites) and regular non nitro Old Rasputin Imperial Stout. Yum yum. HAPPY HUMP DAY.

name: Red Bus Food Park and Bar

reviews.author: Cynthia C.
reviews.description: Great food, great service.    The owners are amazing !!.  Can't wait to go back!!!!! Entertainment is on point and the variety of beer and wine options is great! You won't regret coming here!

reviews.author: Teresa C.
reviews.description: Awesome food park. Has a variety of food trucks and beer and wine. Tonight the entertainment has begun and it's a great evening to be outside. There's a musician and comedian. Fun!

name: Spec's Wines, Spirits and Finer Foods

reviews.author: Lorin C.
reviews.description: Went to this location with my sister. As I was looking for a bottle, I noticed a woman with her son also in there, and the son looked 6. I thought to myself, that's weird. Then I get to the register, and "Chenzira" is checking me out. She asks for sister's id and mine. She didn't have hers, so she says "sorry I can't sell this to you, and next time you buy liquor you should keep her in the car," and laughs. I just think if you're gonna follow the rules, I think you should follow all of them, and not make snide comments.

reviews.author: Joe T.
reviews.description: It's pretty disgusting that a business like this would allow an employee to proudly display a "F... The Police" tattoo to hundreds of customers every day. I will not be back ever again.

reviews.author: D'Anthony F.
reviews.description: Before coming to Spec's, every liquor store I had been to, in life, was just a place you went to grab and go. Spec's is like a liquor wonderland. When I walked in, I was amazed at all of the choices not available anywhere else. I found things here, that I can't even get in my home state. Did I mention the had Pandemic Survival Kits?

reviews.author: Tawnya V.
reviews.description: Stopped in to pick up some beer.  Spec's had a huge beer selection with pilsners, craft beers and everything in between.  They have a huge cooler area where they have a lot of ice cold beer.  They also have a wide variety of wines and liquors along with a humidor.  Spec's has a large selection of cigars.  They also have everything you need to make mixed drinks and items for your food and cheese boards.  Spec's carry and wide variety of cheeses including Yancy Fancy which includes ghost pepper and habanero.  They also have special meats, olives, and nuts and different kinds of snacks.  Spec's even had caviar and different kinds of crackers.  Try the olives stuffed with blue cheese which has been hard to find lately.  The Spec's in South New Braunfels also have the same items, it's on 35 in the same shopping plaza as Planet Fitness.  Spec's goes above and beyond with customer service, if you take the name of a certain beer, wine, spirit they will look it up to see if they have it or can get it in.  Spec's is the one stop shop for entertaining or having what you need to sit at home while in this pandemic in front of the television watching a movie.  I felt very safe there with social distancing, hand sanitizer, and everyone wears a mask while shopping at Spec's.  Thank You Spec's!

reviews.author: Christine M.
reviews.description: Deep Ellum beers... yay! ! Just a pretty great selection of beers in general, but the Deep Ellum - especially when their seasonal cherry chocolate porter hits shelves - will bring me back to this particular Spec's...I can't think of a single place in San Antonio that stocks it.   I've been gravitating lately toward San Anto mom n pop bottle shops (and Dr. Seuss, apparently) - local is better anyway, but mostly because of the option to build-your-own mixed-6... As per the norm with Spec's, that's 100% not an option here (*lame*, Bunny!). There's also no chocolates counter, and their deli consists of a small selection of prepackaged cheeses. Oh yeah, another thing that's lacking: a purse hook in the ladies room. ..Ain't no way I'm setting my junk on the floor, and the fine art of hovering is extra difficult when you're trying not to pee on a crossbody bag AND the toilet seat.  But...  The store is bright/shiny/new, very spacious, and there's tons of parking. I was greeted enthusiastically at the door, and subsequently asked by no less than 3 associates (and not in that annoying "what are you stealing? Watching you! " kinda way) if I was finding everything OK. Eye contact and a smile from every passing employee... very welcoming.   On the way to the river, get your Beaver Nuggets across the street, but definitely leave the beer purchase for here.

reviews.author: James D.
reviews.description: Great prices and very good service and my always enjoy this particular location. I highly recommend it to anyone.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Originally I gave this location 5 stars due to the selection and knowledge of the staff (the other location in town is lacking both). Sadly, I have to take away 2 stars due to them constantly having expired beer. A lot of times I do not notice it until I am home and have thrown away the packaging. This is very disappointing, since flavors of beer can drastically change.

reviews.author: Anita C.
reviews.description: Love this place! You are always greeted when you walk in. Staff is always ready to help you with questions you have.  They aren't trying to rip you off either. We needed two bottles of champagne and didn't know what to get. The manager suggested a great brand with a decent price and it tasted great. We've had help with wine choices too. Huge selections on all spirits and beers.  Once I had to use the restrooms and I was surprised with how impeccably clean they were! This is our go to place for our alcohol needs.

reviews.author: Justin W.
reviews.description: I come here for selection and they have it but today I found out they don't carry a common beer, leinenkugel sunset wheat. Another you can't buy any of the dogfish head beers individually. If you want me to spend a lot of money on a six pack an individual would be great first to try one. Trying to find someone to ask shouldn't be difficult but they hide around the corner talking amongst each other and not on the sales floor walking around helping people.

reviews.author: Jimmie R.
reviews.description: I love Spec's, even if it's only because it's the closest place with a decent selection of craft beer.  Pros: Decent selection of liquor, especially Texas brands. Decent selection of craft beer in six-packs and bombers. Friendly staff.  Cons: No singles or mixed six-packs on beer. And only Josh seems to know much about beer (I keep missing him lately, as well. Either he's got an odd schedule or he's moved on.)  If Spec's would start selling singles, I'd have no reason to drive to the Gabriel's in San Marcos. I'd still drive to Total Wine once in a while, though.

reviews.author: Katherine B.
reviews.description: I needed help for Christmas gifts on liquor I don't normally by and all the employees were very knowledgeable and helpful. Best prices I have found in town and always a great selection!

reviews.author: Michele G.
reviews.description: Oh how I love specs. They always have what I'm looking for plus items I'm not looking for. This location is clean and well organized. Tip...if military tell them as you check out for a 10% discount.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: The mecca of alcohol in New Braunfels. If you want something special, go here first. All the spirits, wine, beer that you can think of. I'm not sure of the beer selection, but it seemed massively diverse to me. I liked that they showed the Wine ratings on some of the bottles.

reviews.author: Courtney Y.
reviews.description: Awesome place!!! Very friendly staff! Was asked multiple times if we needed help finding anything! Very clean! A great selection of pretty much every beer, wine and liquor! Good prices too! Would definitely go back!! Wish we had one closer to home! Didn't really check out the coffee, food or cigars... But seemed to have a fair amount of selection..

reviews.author: Tracy L.
reviews.description: If you ever need a good wine recommendation ask Mark. He knows wine! Just tell him what you are pairing it with and what your price range is and he'll give you a great wine. Third time I have been completely satisfied with his picks!

reviews.author: Peggy E.
reviews.description: Fantastic intimate wine tour with awesome host, Matthew! Highly recommend to everyone.

reviews.author: Kai C.
reviews.description: Brandy was the best tour guide! My husband and I booked a tour/tasting for my birthday. Masks are worn and there is a plastic divider inside of the van.  The gentleman at Sister Creek who served our wine did great. Brandy was very knowledgeable, personable, professional and kind. She is a walking wealth of wine/vineyard information. If you're looking to book a tour, short or long, I highly recommend this company! We were given the option for her to provide a little info and just let us vibe or provide us with everything. I love all things wine so I went for it all! I wasn't disappointed. (Btw she took magnificent pictures for us as well).

reviews.author: Monica A.
reviews.description: What a great wine tour. Our guide Matt is personable, knowledgeable, funny, friendly and professional. Our group was small. The wineries were great! All cute , the fun one was last; FAT ASS !!! Matt chose wineries based on our taste and personalities. Yes yes you have to do yourself a favor and book a tour. No regrets. They also pick you up at your hotel !

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: First wine tour of the Texas Hill Country and Cottonwood did not disappoint. Our driver/guide Diane was AMAZING! She was super friendly, knowledgeable, and gave great insight into the wines and even hooked us up with a great BBQ joint in Fredericksburg. This was a wonderful experience and we are looking forward to exploring more wines with Cottonwood.

reviews.author: Jen O.
reviews.description: Matt and Brandy were so wonderful! Brandy helped guide us to the best wineries! Matt was our driver and he was very kind, a wealth of knowledge, and a great guide. I would highly recommend working with them for your next wine tour. The pick up and drop off at home were well worth it. Thank you guys for a great time!

reviews.author: Teresa W.
reviews.description: Such a great tour... We did the Guadalupe River Wine tour. It was a surprise for the husbands of the group! Matt was our guide and he was so knowledgeable, friendly and accommodating. A group member left something in the bus and Matt was kind enough to bring it back on his day off. We will definitely tour again!

reviews.author: Manuela F.
reviews.description: A few of us from Houston wanted to do a wine tour birthday party for a friend.  Brandy was super accommodating in the reservation process and her husband Matt picked us up the day of at the hotel we were staying at in San Antonio.  He assured us it would be a very different tour from what we're accustomed do and he was right!  He was so knowledgeable that we really enjoyed the tour.    We had shopping time in Fredericksburg and we never felt rushed.  Excellent recovery on their part too when there was a slight hiccup in our reservation and with what was available to tour, he didn't skip a beat.  He  made other arrangements and we continued our tour.  Additionally, I left my iPhone charger in the van and they had it delivered the same day.  One of my girlfriend's left her sunglasses at the Sisters Creek Vineyards and Matt was able to recover the sunglasses and had them mailed the same day.  That's true service!  We would most definitely enjoy doing another tour with Cottonwood Wine Tours in the future and we plan to do so soon.

reviews.author: Lindsay K.
reviews.description: This wine tour was for my niece to celebrate her birthday. I did not expect much but I was not impressed with the timeline, the first winery, the driving, or the mask mandate. To start, we were one of 3 stops and that should have been planned better. One pickup and drop off only. Second, the first winery was not pleasant, friendly, or poured enough wine to have two sips. The second winery was more energy and fun. The driving was a little unsettling. Before ever sipping wine, I felt sick in the van with the disruptive swerving and plowing over bumps. I was uncomfortable with the lack of ventilation as well. While I do not expect a lot for $125 a person, I did expect a fun experience. My recommendation is drive yourself, get a hotel, and not be confined to a timeline, other people, car sickness, or bad wine.

reviews.author: Kristie W.
reviews.description: What a great tour!  Diane picked our group of six up at our hotel and the adventure began!  We had our first stop at the Saint Tryphon winery, which was the cutest place with an amazingly knowledgeable and friendly staff!! Tres  presented our tastings and was great to talk and listen to.  Our group of six bought several bottles of wine.  We then journeyed to another gorgeous winery with a little less on the customer service.  We gave our feedback immediately to Diane, who said that she would have a discussion with that winery and I believe she will!  Diane then took us into Fredericksburg and pointed out many local establishments.  Throughout the day, Diane provided many facts and tons of information about the area.  She even managed a quick detour to drive by Luckenbach for us!  We chose this company because it is a small business and were very pleased with the personal touches, snack bags, and intimacy of this tour.  We would highly recommend this company for your wine tour adventures!

reviews.author: James O.
reviews.description: I met my mom and sister in San Antonio for my mom's 65th birthday.  They came by way of Chicago and I came in from Portland, Oregon.  My sister did all of the research for the trip and found Cottonwood wine tours so we could get out of the city and into the hill country of Texas.  It was a Friday and my mom's actual birthday when Matthew picked us up at the hotel.  Right off the bat he was really cool and laid back.  He had a lot of fun facts about San Antonio as he is from there and the drive out to Sister Creek winery seemed like we were just hanging out with a friend.  Coming from the Willamette valley I have seen plenty of winery's but nothing like this one. It is an old cotton mill turned into a small winery that produces some great Bordeaux varietal blends and even a Pinot Noir!  Matthew was very knowledgeable on the topic of wine and wine making.  After the wine tasting we headed to Luckenbach for some beer and a little live country music. There is a lot of history to this place and we had been there 33 years prior when my sister and I were toddlers.  He told us no rush and let us enjoy this little country music Mecca, he even had the famous song loaded up on his phone when we got back to the car.  We had him take a picture of us that emulated the one that had been taken so many years before.  Next stop was some Texas bbq, like real bbq, he said we couldn't expect any city bbq to be better and I would say he was right!  All in all this tour was awesome, I would have loved to take other tours with Matthew, like the Alamo or some of the other missions but I don't think he offers those yet, maybe an idea?  He was very personable, knowledgeable and friendly.  The type of person you want to be around and I know my mom had a very special birthday because of this tour/guide.  I highly recommend Cottonwood wine tours for any tour they offer in San Antonio, it is run by Matthew, his wife and his mother in-law and I look forward to returning here to see their success!

reviews.author: Tam T.
reviews.description: A group of us did the Taste of Fredericksburg tour. We had a great time with Mrs. Diane! She was  friendly, knowledgeable, and had great energy! We visited two wine vineyards and were able to spend the last hour of the tour walking around Fredericksburg. Overall, the tour was amazing! It was put together well and worth the price! I highly recommend doing this tour if you're in town visiting or live in San Antonio. They also give military discounts

reviews.author: Laura S.
reviews.description: Great day. Matt was very knowledgeable in history and wine making! He designed tour to group's taste.  Thoroughly enjoyed the hill country and Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Kat O.
reviews.description: Matt was an amazing tour guide!!  I was down in San Antonio for a work trip and happily stumbled upon this tour company in an ad--they even pick you up from your hotel!  Great opportunity to visit beautiful Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Charles C.
reviews.description: My wife and I decided to take a trip to the Texas Hill country and do some wine tasting.  We noticed there were over 40 wineries listed and did not know which ones to choose.  So, we looked on the internet and chose Cottonwood Wine Tours.  Our guide was amazing. We learned so much and he chose some wonderful site.  We recommend them highly.

reviews.author: Isabella P.
reviews.description: I found Cottonwood Wine Tours while looking for things to do in San Antonio. We had a great time with our driver Diana. We did the 4 winery tour plus free time in Fredricksburg tour, and we had a fun time. Diana is very friendly, and gave us many good suggestions to places to eat in Fredricksburg and San Antonio. I am so glad we found this wine tour company. They are a small operation with Diana, her daughter and son in law.

reviews.author: Ryan P.
reviews.description: I'm visiting my friend in San Antonio who's here for work and she booked this wine tour for us. Matt picked us up and was super friendly and gave us a lot of information about San Antonio, the winery we were headed to, and was just overall really nice and friendly.  At the first winery at Sister Creek, we switched out with Brandy because she was doing the actual tour we booked, Matt was just doing our pick up. Brandy was super fun and every bit as good as Matt. She took us to another winery, let us walk around Fredericksburg (after some great advice on where to eat), then at the end decided she'd take us by a small local liquor distillery that makes some really cool stuff like jalapeno moonshine!  From start to finish, it was amazing. These two are friendly as can be, very knowledgeable, and nothing felt cookie cutter. They make it feel like a personal experience. I definitely recommend giving Cottonwood Wine Tours a try!

reviews.author: Nicole B.
reviews.description: I took 5 ladies today and couldn't have asked for better. Relaxed and fun. Educational and joyful. Perfect.  Wouldnt use anyone else. I cant recommend enough.

reviews.author: Andreea G.
reviews.description: My husband and I went on the A taste of Fredericksburg tour and we had a great time. When they say that you get a knowledgeable tour guide on hand they really mean it. The experience was great and although I am 8 months pregnant we still had a good time and got to purchase some wine to try for after the baby comes. Also they didn't charge me for the wine fee so that was a plus since I didn't get to do any of the wine tastings.

reviews.author: Debbie D.
reviews.description: Had a great time with Matt!  Did the Sisterdale, Lukenbach, bbq tour.  Matt knew a lot about the wine making and the San Antonio area.  Loved the muscatto at the winery.  Will definitely book with him again.

reviews.author: Shirley F.
reviews.description: One word: love. My group took a Sunday tour, and since we were the only ones signed up that day, Matt came to my apartment to pick us all up. He was so polite and interesting, genuinely knowledgeable when it came to wine and the Hill Country. After our first winery, we got back into the car to find goody bags with water and snacks waiting for us. He had extra chocolate if we needed it!    I really liked having time to eat and shop in Fredericksburg between drinking. He pointed out suggestions for places to eat or to drink more on Main Street before dropping us off. He even took us to a bonus winery not on the schedule since we were doing so well on time.   I highly recommend Cottonwood. Matt was easy to contact and professional throughout, even when we were all a bit tipsy. He was a very safe driver. Great job.

reviews.author: D H.
reviews.description: We loved our wine tour with Taste of the Hills. We visited three wineries with two other couples on the tour. Each stop was unique and Jodie was especially knowledgeable and friendly. She is completely worth trying the tour!   Bonus: we got engaged after the tour!

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Jodie was the best!  I found Taste of the Hills on yelp.  I messaged Jodie in April to see what her pricing and availability was for Memorial Day weekend and she responded quickly. Paid deposit through venmo and paid the other half day of our tasting. We did one winery, one distillery and one brewery. She gave us a small history of each of the places we went too. Her cheese board setup was amazing! Very sweet and easy going. I highly recommend.

reviews.author: Chandler W.
reviews.description: Jodie made my day all I could have dreamed of. Her bus is super nice, well air conditioned and plenty of space, her knowledge of each winery was very cool to hear and she made sure we were always comfortable! On a warm summer day we were kept cool, fed, and full of wine! Must book with Jodie for a trip around the hill country. Delicious wine and charcuterie board! Thank you Jodie!

reviews.author: Cheryl J.
reviews.description: OMG, Jodie is FaNtAsTiC! My bff and I were on our annual girl's trip and wanted to book a wine tour before we left the Hill Country of Texas. We were staying in the adorable town of Wimberley so I researched tours in the area.  Jodie's Taste of the Hills Tour got great reviews and went to wineries close to the Wimberley area. The day of the tour ended up being chilly and rainy. As soon as Jodie pulled up with her spectacular shuttle-like van she was out like a flash with pretty umbrellas for us! We went to 3 different wineries which we thoroughly enjoyed! After the first one, we returned to Jodie's vehicle and she had a gorgeous tray for us of cheese,  sausage,  crackers,  grapes,  olives, dips.....simply divine!!! The tour was also just the 2 of us and we loved that Jodie still did ALL of this for a tour that I believe takes up to 12 people! The next time we plan a trip to the Hill Country we are going to do one of Jodie's Beer tours!! We had such great conversations with Jodie too! Thank you sooooo much for the GREAT time! Sooooo much fun!

reviews.author: Kyle D.
reviews.description: Amazing tour!!! My wife and I came into Wimberley during Spring Break to relax from teaching and this was the perfect trip to do so! Jodie made us all feel like we were old friends, even though we had never met anyone else on the bus.  She was very detailed with the stories of each winery, and explained all the different varietals, answering our every question along the way. The bus was very comfortable and clean, and she stored each bottle we purchased until the trip was over, but we could have had the bottles on the bus had we chosen to.  The wineries all seemed to know her, so they were expecting us and were incredibly friendly. We were not rushed anywhere, and still managed to make it back into town to enjoy shopping on the square.  My wife and I were pretty hungry by the time we had lunch, since we didn't have breakfast, but the tapas style lunch was perfect for the glass of wine we purchased to have with it. The lunch was delicious and filling.  Overall this was an amazing experience and I will be recommending this tour to everyone I know.

reviews.author: Samantha K.
reviews.description: The owner, Jodie, went above and beyond to make sure my birthday with 12 of my friends and family was a moment to remember and it was just that. She recommended the best of Driftwood and ended up going to Driftwood Estate Winery and Vista Brewery. We spent around 5 hours commuting, tasting, and even an impromptu cellar tour. Thanks again, Jodie! I highly recommend Taste of the Hills to everyone.

reviews.author: Jeffrey R.
reviews.description: Jodie is an exceptional chauffeur.  We had a blast for a friend's birthday! She knew all the great stops and her ride is smooth, comfy, and had a great sound system. We had so much fun!

reviews.author: Sona E.
reviews.description: This wine tour with Jodie is a must.  We got Serenity Inn on a Wednesday so we were lucky to be on the wine tour with only one other couple.  Jodie is such a pleasant and inviting soul. She asked about each person's preferences as to be able to personalize the tour and pick which wineries she decided to take us too.  She is very knowledgeable of the town and the wineries.  The lunch she provides is just amazing. By the time we were done I felt like I had made an incredible new friend. I can't wait to go back and do more tours.

reviews.author: Amber N.
reviews.description: This was such an incredible experience. Jodie picked us up at the Serenity Farm House Inn. She was so friendly and knowledgeable and super sweet. She knew all the best places to go. The picnic lunch she provided was amazing. I wouldn't change a thing about today. I would love to bring some friends and do it all over again.

reviews.author: Brooke K.
reviews.description: Myself,  my Aunt and my cousin took Jodie's winery tour yesterday and had an absolute blast! Jodie really personalized the tour based on our taste in wines. She has an extensive knowledge of wines, the wineries, the towns, etc. Our favorite part was lunch because of the views and the wonderful spread that was provided for us. I highly recommend this tour and in fact will probably we doing it again, soon, I hope.

reviews.author: Amber D.
reviews.description: Perfect - the highlight of our trip!  Jodie was the best, most fun, knowledgeable and coordinator.  We went to Driftwood, Duchman and Fall Creek Vineyards.  We were fortunate enough to have great people touring with us, and it made the tour all the more fun.  She prepared the best picnic lunch I've ever had.  Sugar Shack cake balls, meats, cheeses, crackers, hummus, a goat cheese something served on crackers (that I LOVED, and I hate goat cheese), spinach feta rolls, and I'm sure I'm forgetting something.  She was fully prepared for everything.  Boxes for the wine we bought, umbrellas in case in rained (it didn't), plenty of water...this wine tour couldn't have been more perfect if she tried.  Thanks, Jodie!

reviews.author: Charles J.
reviews.description: Jodie was amazing!  Very knowledgeable and informative.  Has some great stories and makes it very fun.  And the wineries she took us to were fantastic!  I've been to some bad wineries and the Wimberley area has a lot of options and can be daunting to do yourself.  Plus, nice to have a driver.  . Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Anita Y.
reviews.description: Jodie was amazing! She asked what our preferences in wine were and brought us to wineries that best fit our palate. She had a delicious charcuterie board waiting for us. Super friendly and very knowledgeable on various places in Wimberley. I highly recommend Jodie!!!

reviews.author: Gwen L.
reviews.description: This was a Fantastic tour. The winery's were lovely and Jodie was the perfect host. Would do it again and recommend to anyone visiting Wimberly.

reviews.author: Amer S.
reviews.description: Jodie was an amazing host and she really made the evening perfect for my wife's 40th birthday! She took us to amazing tasting locations, she knew everyone and we received first class service. She even helped with dinner reservations! It really was an amazing evening largely due to Jodie and the exceptional service she provides! If you are looking for a fantastic wine tour, get in touch with Jodie and she will ensure that happens.

reviews.author: Vicky W.
reviews.description: Ahhhh! So very relaxing! Jodie Meyer knew all the tourists' names and made sure we got to know each other. She provided an excellent variety of foods including a hot portion and gluten-free (just in time `cause I was lit after the 1st vineyard). The three vineyards for that day were selected based on the wine preferences of the tourists that day (A+ perk). We never felt pushed or obligated to buy wines, but we all did because they were very good (!), and Jodie kept our purchases organized and stored for us. She also gave a good background on each vineyard and on the Wimberley area in general. We learned a lot about Wimberley and wine and were able to get tipsy knowing Jodie was an excellent driver of her comfy bus. And have you been to Wimberley? That hilly countryside is beautiful!

reviews.author: Linz N.
reviews.description: We recently went on a fabulous wine tour with Jodie on 4/15 and had a great time!  Our tour was originally scheduled for 10:30a, but got pushed back to 1:15p due to shuttle trouble (we had the option to receive our money back, but actually liked the later time).
