reviews.description: Great romantic place with decent tasting prices.  The wine was great and fruity.. my husband and I didn't feel the alcohol until later  but it was a great time.   Staff was very personable and fun to talk to.

reviews.author: Max G.
reviews.description: Wine, Food , and atmosphere was good! Social distancing, masks, and friendly people. The BBQ was great and the staff is so sweet! We had the BBQ Mac and Cheese was awesome!

reviews.author: Timothy W.
reviews.description: One and done.  First time visit yesterday day will be our last.  Wine was decent.  Server was lousy with zero personality and no desire to do anything more than ring you up for your purchase.  Told her we were first timers and her response was do you want to do a wine tasting, a glass or a bottle.  Told her 2 glasses.  Which  kind?  How about showing me the menu?  All with a frown and no smile or welcome.  The covered patio was not comfortable or aesthetically pleasing either.  Better places to spend my money in Gruene.

reviews.author: Martie E.
reviews.description: Very friendly and knowledgeable, being very careful about social distancing, and tasting prices very reasonable. We purchased the Sweet Red Memories. We will definitely stop again the next time we are in the Hill Country!

reviews.author: Tamara C.
reviews.description: So my experience was around wine grown on property not this type of  winery where the grapes are imported from other growers then produces different flavors of wine. Very charming staff and was helpful on wine tasting. We choose four wines to taste from their menu and have different emo fave on what we thought of the wine. I must say the tasting serving are healthy pour and provide the opportunity to enjoy a little more of each wine.  For me most of the wine was somewhat sweet and berry tasting as the Merlot wine has a hint of sweet berry. Reminded me of when I was had my first drink of Boonesfarm wine but not that sweet...lol.  Charming with that modern industrial farm decor.  I would come back to just sit on the porch with glass of vino. Cheers.

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: What yummy fruit infused wines!!! We all took home bottles after our tasting bc they were so good AND so cheap! Plus, the service was amazing.  I do wish they had a bit more space- the tasting area can feel cramped. Feels like they need a bit of an upgrade/refurbish!

reviews.author: Melanie U.
reviews.description: Yes to finally finding wine that I like! My best friend comes here frequently and was excited to bring me when I visited for the weekend. I'm not a wine drinker at all, so I only go for the sweet tasting liquids. These fruit wines are so fun and delightful, and they had a great deal on flights ($4/4 samples, $1 for each additional sample). They have indoor and outdoor seating, and service was attentive and helpful. I definitely plan on ordering some wine online!

reviews.author: Samantha R.
reviews.description: Super friendly staff. They offer a wide variety of wine. While this place is cute, quaint, and has awesome customer service, the wine we sampled was too sweet for my taste. We did a sampling and I chose a variety and was not impressed. This is just my palette though. If you're a sweet wine drinker, you will love this place. They do offer cheap tastings and a free glass which is also cool. I say go and see for yourself. Like I said the staff makes it a great experience.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Still amazing as ever. I love their wines and I love sharing them with friends and family. They are always so kind and accommodating and I just love supporting local. A few years ago, my husband and I bottled our own wine wand added labels for our wedding party- it was so fun since we had some bottles of wine with our parents while bottling and were also allowed to bring in snacks and sandwiches.  They have updated their back outside area and allow doggos- yay!

reviews.author: Gloria S.
reviews.description: Very quaint, several seats and small tables. Service very friendly and knowledgeable  Wine and you can bottle and label your own for gifts  Couple things to eat Only one restroom for both genders  Very loud and echoey if you are sensitive.

reviews.author: Kevin Z.
reviews.description: Very nice staff.  They know the wine very well and are very helpful.  Honestly, the wine is "ok" but, the rest of the experience makes it worthwhile!

reviews.author: Andres S.
reviews.description: Stopped by for wine tasting for the first time with my wife and Travis helped us out. He made the experience very enjoyable and made us feel very comfortable.. would definitely recommend. Cost/quality was pretty reasonable and just want to praise the service that was provided.. we will definitely make our way back :)

reviews.author: Allen B.
reviews.description: What a gem.   All the wines we tasted were amazing.  And staff (Spring) was super kind and attentive.  Thinking about joining their wine club this was such a chill place.

reviews.author: Rosemary G.
reviews.description: A nice place to enjoy an evening with a great glass of wine. The staff is so friendly and knowledgeable.

reviews.author: Ursula F.
reviews.description: This was a great place to try a flight of wines. They make them themselves but with grapes from other places than TX since TX grapes are not so consistent. Our server was Spring and she was very knowledgeable and fun. She helped us have an excellent time there.

reviews.author: Debi L.
reviews.description: This was an awesome place to relax and have a glass of wine after a day traveling the TX backroads.  Would make it a point to stop in whenever I'm in town.

reviews.author: Hope C.
reviews.description: Love Love Love Water 2 Wine, New Braunfels.  The wines are yummy, but the staff is what really makes this a favorite.  Brandy, Johnny, and Marty are The Best!  This little wine bar is the perfect spot for friends to gather.   Easy parking in front or in the back.  Wonderful selection of tasty wines.  Fast and friendly service!

reviews.author: Jessica N.
reviews.description: This is a small little winery, but I love it! Super cute and quiet. The wine selection was great. I loved that you could make your own wine labels for special Occasions. I thought that was super cute. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable.

reviews.author: Keyana S.
reviews.description: This was a very nice setting! The people are warm and welcoming. John was our server I believe and he was super knowledgeable and had him pick a few wine flavors for my flight, which were amazing! Got introduced to this lovely place by someone and will definitely be returning soon with my friends!

reviews.author: Bethany W.
reviews.description: This is my favorite local wine place. People there are so nice and personable and the wine is always amazing.

reviews.author: Melissa H.
reviews.description: always a great time here, my happy place! Brandi and Johnny makes you feel at home always!

reviews.author: Justin B.
reviews.description: Free tastings-- need I say more. Good ambiance, knowledgeable and friendly staff, good selection of wine and decent prices. You can create your own wine and customs labels.  No food available, other than the standard chips and crackers; but you can bring in food with you. Definitely worth a stop and taste.

reviews.author: Shaun S.
reviews.description: Amazing service. Three free samples. An amazing selection of wines. Adorable gifts to purchase. Very relaxing cozy and comfortable. Downtown location.  I can't add more to what has already been said by previous Yelpers. The staff is still knowledgeable and answers all of your questions with ease. The staff was extremely accommodating.  The server kept moving back and forth, checking on us, pouring wines at other tables, and had a smile on his face.   I had one of his award winning wines.  And, my friend tried a different award winner.  They did not disappoint.  This cute lil gem accommodates the vino aficionado as well as the novice.

reviews.author: Monique L.
reviews.description: We have been going to W2W for years. We love the wine with no sulfates, no nitrates because they make their wines on site. They have all different kinds of wine so you will be able to find something you enjoy, especially since you get some free tasting. We go a least once a month for a date night. Some Saturday nights they have live music. They have a wine club you can join to get bottles at a discount and many more benefits. You should visit if you like wine.

reviews.author: Steve T.
reviews.description: Thanks for sharing the twin river red with me. My new favorite.  This is the funnest place in to for some great vino, friends and laughs! Love you all, Steve

reviews.author: Greg Z.
reviews.description: Disappointing after trying to go to water 2 wine two other times. We finally made it a day they were open only to be disappointed in the wine. No one in our party of 4 liked any of the samples enough to want a glass.. So we just moved on

reviews.author: Donna S.
reviews.description: Another fun place to try wine. As a bonus, you can make your own batch and come back in 45 days with friends for a bottling party! What a cool concept!! Great wine and super nice people.

reviews.author: Shani S.
reviews.description: After I'd stopped in to ensure I had the necessary items for a trip (ie: a few bottles of really awesome wine) at the Water2Wine in Austin... I forgot them at home.  Yep.  That's me.   However, Water 2 Wine in Seguin came to my rescue!   Not only are the folks here really friendly, they go out of their way to make you feel welcome and make sure you leave happy.   The place is very welcoming and warm, as well.   If we ever take a road trip, I have to admit, this might be stop on the way.  :)

reviews.author: Magdalena T.
reviews.description: This was our first winery ever. 8 years ago. Joseph did fantastic today. So good to be back and become members.

reviews.author: Jordan S.
reviews.description: We came here for our first wine tasting, at this spot. The service is amazing. The people, Joseph and Jane made us feel  wet welcome and comfortable. Out of the five wines we tasted, we only liked one wine. But that's ok, we will always keep our tastebuds open for you! The environment is incredible. Beautiful oak trees, beautiful building, bathroom was clean and nice. Had a great experience, $20 each for a wine tasting? Yes! Sooooo worth it. Live music and great food trucks!

reviews.author: Shelly G.
reviews.description: Very rude customer service. We were the first customers of the day and they had no desire to serve us. They are an outdoor only venue which is totally fine but don't have any outdoor heating yet they have a huge firepit that they wouldn't start. Then our friend showed up with their 4 year old and wouldn't let them come in. So not kid friendly, bad customer service and no outdoor heating.

reviews.author: Matouš P.
reviews.description: First time here, but definitely will not be our last!  Lovely outdoor space, plenty of room to space out, great covid protocol. Friendly staff, dog friendly, and some unique and very tasty wines.   After our tasting on the patio, we moved to a nice table in the yard, each had a glass of wine (they recorked the left over), and enjoyed a nice sweet crepe from the food trailer.    We will be back.

reviews.author: Stacy B.
reviews.description: Totally chill relaxing place to enjoy some wine with friends.  Nestled back among the oak trees off 46, this place is a little gem.  Patio has a view of the vineyard, and when the weather cools off there is nothing better than sitting under the trees enjoying the fire pits. Community tables make for great conversation and an easy way to meet people when new to the area. Check Facebook for date nights and various events. To really get the feel for this spot, it's best to go when there is a band and food trucks.   Experienced friendly staff really make this place stand out. I don't know much about wine so staff was great about helping me select an excellent "Wurst Red" wine. This place probably deserves a 5 star for good time, but I lowered it to 4 since seating indoors is limited.   And chairs on the patio are not very comfortable. I will certainly update my review if changes are made. Would love to see some comfy coffee house style couches indoors to make it more comfortable.   Pro Tip:  Order the red or white frozen sangria. It is the BOMB!!  Tastes like a fruit slushy in the most delicious way.

reviews.author: D C.
reviews.description: We had a great time.  It was a beautiful day in a beautiful setting. The wines we tasted were all good.  The tasting was slow and even paced.  We bought a charcuterie plate to nosh on and it lasted through all 6 wines.  It was one of the more enjoyable tastings I've ever done.  I would definitely come back.

reviews.author: AA P.
reviews.description: We liked every single wine on the tasting list and took home two bottles that were not on he list.  They offered for us to try the two bottles we selected before we purchased them which was excellent customer service, above and beyond.   The staff was pleasant, had a sense of humor and were quick to accommodate guests to keep them dry and happy when a wild rain storm blew in.  We made reservations to return at the end of the summer when their wine list changes, they gave us lots of information!  Lots of outdoor space and a great ambiance.   Very enjoyable afternoon.

reviews.author: Joseph G.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem. Shiela is awesome and very nice all the time! Try their wine tasting, my wife and I enjoy it every time we go. Make sure you make a reservation.

reviews.author: Taylor B.
reviews.description: I wish I could give Dry Comal Creek Vineyards over five stars. The wine was incredible, the patio seating was spacious, and the staff was VERY friendly and helpful. We didn't realize we needed a reservation until after we arrived, but the sweet lady at the entrance helped us make a reservation so we could get seated. The outdoor seating was very spread out, and there was a lot of shade from all the large trees. Our server helped us choose a bottle, and brought us any sample we wanted before purchasing a bottle. The wine was so good we left with a couple bottles to bring home. The pricing is very affordable ($20-$30 a bottle). I would highly recommend visiting this gem near New Braunfels.

reviews.author: Gloria S.
reviews.description: Nice but pricey  Wish there were more comfy places to sit inside for a very very hot summer day Outside there are vast areas to choose from to sit and relax   Love the fire pits scattered around one side with chairs .  Vineyards were on the other  Good for private gatherings  Wine was not cheap but it was good It's not from the grapes they currently grew but their own brand   Took a quick video at Yelp check in

reviews.author: Katelyn J.
reviews.description: I love this winery, but I'm a little in shock after being kicked out because I had a 10 week old baby with me. We were there for an hour, then we were told we had to leave because kids aren't allowed. I totally understand a child who can run around, but this was a nursing baby. Underneath a blanket. The winery wasn't enforcing their mask rule, but doesn't allow newborns.

reviews.author: Dellaney W.
reviews.description: Had a great experience at this winery. Everyone was so friendly and laid back. The grounds are beautiful, there was a BBQ food truck the day we went which was delicious as well as a great singer there for entertainment. Don't pass this place up.

reviews.author: Natalie C.
reviews.description: My experience was amazing! Joseph was such a great server. He took pictures of me and my boyfriend, was easy to talk to, and knowledgeable of the wine. It's such a relaxing and beauty area. We will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Pam S.
reviews.description: Loved it! The layout is great and spacious! We sat on the patio and loved the big fan. Bottle wine priced right. The bbq food truck was there with yummy food. Only thing missing was music! Enjoyed nonetheless!

reviews.author: Kimberly K.
reviews.description: What a wonderful little hill country winery tucked away from the fast paced world! My fiancee and I have come out here several times on a motorcycle ride to enjoy the peaceful surroundings and get away from the traffic in the city. We love their frozen sangria and the Comal Red. They offer a plastic boot for $20 that they fill with their delicious frozen Sangria. Bring the boot back and refills are only $10!   The staff here are so nice and helpful too. On our last visit we were going to each have a glass of wine and the lady told us for a few dollars more we could buy the whole bottle. You don't have to tell me twice! Grab a seat outside, either by one of the many oak trees, or under the shaded pavilion and enjoy the beautiful surroundings.

reviews.author: Britney G.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed this winery on the TX wine trail! Super close to Canyon Lake and New Braunfels, this gem has lots of outdoor space and some delicious wine offerings. They are dog friendly too. I really appreciated the hospitality of the servers, who were kind enough to give the hubby our tasting outside since we had the pup. We ended up getting the cheese plate (which was yummy) and ordered two glasses of wine. We also bought a bottle of rose for the road. Great spot!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Very quaint and peaceful winery. There is a gift shop, indoor seating as well as outdoor seating (in the shade and in the sun). There are a bunch of wines to sample as well as one champagne and their famous sangria slush (my favorite).  The ladies are so helpful with the samplings and very knowledgable about the wines and where the grapes come from (not all can be grown on site due to certain bugs and climate reasons). I was very intrigued that they decanter their wine when you buy a bottle. I have always heard of this but have never seen a place do it. We were able to taste a wine before and after decantering and WOA what a difference!! I'm not sure why more places don't do this  This is a fun place to get away to with the country feel and relaxing atmosphere.

reviews.author: Alysha N.
reviews.description: Great outdoor area with live music makes for a relaxing winery visit. The wine is great!

reviews.author: Doug G.
reviews.description: So this was an absolute lovely vineyard.  We really liked the grounds, the out door gazebo and the building.  The furniture made of wine barrels was really nice.  We paid 15.00 for these really tiny tastes. We didn't really like their wines and do not enjoy sweet wines. We ended getting 3 glasses of their Sangiovese. Total bill was over 50.00.  This was pricy for a tasting and 3 glasses.  Normally if you end up buying glasses most wineries don't charge especially if the tasting pours were so non committing I don't think we even got through our tasting before deciding just to buy full glasses. So you should Be a little more generous with your pours if you are going to charge 15.00.  You all need something a little dryer and bolder.

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: I love this vineyard. Just picked up the 2017 Foot pressed red wine. It is not available to the public but available to those that participated in last years stomping event. People are very friendly and outgoing. The different wines are delicious. I like all of the reds, especially the Black Spanish Dark Red Lenoir 2012 Reserve , which has a nice bold berry flavorI am not a fan of white wines but their French Colombard is amazing. It is a great light summer wine that is soft, fruity and mellow and so is the Spanish black and white wine. The vineyard is a great place for weddings and parties. It is a very quiet and restful place.

reviews.author: Darin R.
reviews.description: Relaxing and a great place to connect with family and friends over a cold beer or glass of wine.  Great environment for everyone.  Live music is always a plus.   Highly recommend to everyone looking for that one spot to just sit and enjoy.

reviews.author: Melissa V.
reviews.description: This store/wine local is in the center of Gruene. It is across from Gruene Hall and Mozies restaurant.  The store is filled w wine glasses and coasters (other items relating to wine) w funny quotes. They have a very large variety of wine that they sell by the glass and by the bottle.  We got 2 glasses of their "best seller", the Texas Southwind Blackberry Wine and one of my friends bought a bottle ($29) bc she loved it so much. Each "glass" was $9 and it came in a small plastic cup. I have an eye for a serving of wine and this was DEFINITELY short. Our cup wasn't even HALF way full.  Unfortunately, they do not do offer Wine Flights. I'm not sure why. This could be such a great addition to their business. They have a huge variety of wine. It'd be nice to try 4-5 wines and then be able to buy a bottle (or 3 ) of your favorite wines to take home w you. IMO, they are hurting their business by not offering flights. If we had been able to try more wines and not have to pay so much for each tiny glass just to TRY the wine, I'm sure our group would've walked out w more than one bottle.   There is a small courtyard next to the store where you could just sit and drink if you wanted to. There were numerous dogs w their owners. (So, dog friendly! ) We chose to walk around w our tiny glasses  and find a place w live music. (and find a place that offered wine flights...lol)

reviews.author: JaDee W.
reviews.description: This place is really nice. They have a ton of different wines, beers, etc to choose from and a beautiful outdoor seating area to enjoy. It's covered with trees so mostly shaded but I thought it was really cool that they had misting fans going for muggy hot days like today.  If you're in town and want to hang out with the girls or spend time with your significant other, this would be an amazing place to come and try something new while relaxing.  Everything was also labeled: sweet, red, white, rosé, and even organic. I didn't know organic wine was a thing but apparently it is and they have it.   The guy working today was not the nicest. He barely said anything and didn't really help us out much. It seemed like he didn't want to be there.

reviews.author: Lana Y.
reviews.description: One of my favorite spots to stop by for a drink and to stop and relax for a little while. We visited on a Saturday, which it wasnt too busy, and enjoyed people watching while waiting for a table to become available at the Gristmill.  I enjoyed the frozen sangria and my husband enjoyed a beer while live music started playing outside in the court yard. Great weather although a little warm for a fall day in October. They did have misters and a bar outside so people didn't have to go inside if they didn't want too.   Plenty of parking nearby. Clean restrooms. Friendly and Quick service.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: The Grapevine is a great place to a cool drink or a glass of vino, catch some music, or people watch. We did not partake of their wine but on a hot October, Saturday a cold beer or two was in order.   The beer line moves fast and there is a good selection of local and corporate beers. Masks are required indoors while you order and the outside tables are set pretty far apart.   There is a good-sized shaded courtyard with live music (on this Sat afternoon). We opted for the people watching section by the street and we were not disappointed.   Like most places in Gruene everything is a bit overpriced but if you know where to go there are good (nontourist priced) deals. The Grapevine is a cool place to hang while planning your next stop in Gruene.

reviews.author: Albert T.
reviews.description: Came here on a busy weekend, line was out the door, but definitely did their best to stagger the line. While there was plenty of out door seating, and a live band playing...definitely still crowded.   Drink wise...we got the frozen wine-a-rita - sangria and peach bellini......very sugary.. but very good if you like sugary drinks. Also kinda on the pricier side for 2 slushy type drinks after tip.  You'll probably make your way here while waiting for your table at the Gristmill to be ready.

reviews.author: Ken S.
reviews.description: This place had a nice relaxing atmosphere, you can walk in get you an adult beverage and walk outside and sit under all the trees. All this trees provide a nice sheltering shade where you can sit down and enjoy some live music. You can just simply sit there and enjoying the day and watch all the patrons passing by...

reviews.author: Laura L.
reviews.description: I always stop in at The Grapevine when in town.  Friendly, knowledgeable staff are happy to assist in choosing wine.  The retail selection is diverse to please any pallet.  Great gifts sold here too'

reviews.author: Diane W.
reviews.description: Used to be super friendly, great tastings, and buy-by-the-glass to sit inside or out.  No more tastings. No more inside seating. Now "what do you want" as they stare you down and short you on a $10 glass of something we aren't even sure you're going to like.  There are WAY better places up the way in Wimberley, San Marcos, etc.

reviews.author: Britney G.
reviews.description: This is a wine tasting room, not a winery. Just thought I would throw that out there since most people like to go to actual wineries when up in the hill country region. This is a super cute spot (that can get extremely busy) where you can sit outside and enjoy sipping on fermented grapes while listening to live music. It's dog friendly. It's family/children friendly. There are plenty of seat options outside. And it's very reasonably priced! Especially when you consider that your 3 wine tastings are FREE. I recommend!

reviews.author: Jessica N.
reviews.description: This is a very cute spot In Historic Gruene. The offer 3 free tastings for beer and wine. The tasting room inside is small but there's is a ton a seating outside. The have a decent selection of semi sweet to sweet wines which are my favorite as well about 6 draft beers. The staff was friendly and very nice. They were very helpful when picking what wines to taste. We purchased a glass of wine and went and enjoyed outside. They have cute little table and benches as well as a stage outside. If your stopping through Gruene,  this tasting room is a great spot to stop and enjoy a glass of wine.

reviews.author: Ron M.
reviews.description: What better stop while you're in Gruene than to stop in to taste a few wines.  You never know what you'll find.  My friend and I had gone in for a tasting to see what might be tempting.  It never hurts to buy a bottle of wine, right?  Well, it was fairly crowded, being such a beautiful day out.  However I have seen it busier.  Anyway, we had walked up to the counter and were greeted and asked what we would like.  We took a few minutes to decide and got our sample.  A little dry for me, so we got another.  Now a few minutes have gone by as we've been standing there.  People come up to the counter and get help.  We finally decide what to get and the person who is been helping us keeps on walking by, as she is helping others.  But there are a few other people working the counter, including a gentleman less than four feet away.  Well, we stand there, just looking, waiting for someone to help us.  That help never came, so we decided to walk out without a purchase.  It's always important to keep track of everyone that comes into your business.    Because I did like the wine I will be back at some point in the future, hopefully to get the bottle that had caught my attention.

reviews.author: Shelli S.
reviews.description: Weekend at Gruene did not disappoint. Peach Bellini s and Coors Light while listening to live music is the best!  Great service with a smile! They were even super busy!

reviews.author: Steve C.
reviews.description: They will not hold open a tab anymore, but demand to hold on to your driver's license over a bucket of ice.  SMDH.

reviews.author: Kyra H.
reviews.description: I LOVE The Grapevine and I tell everyone I know about them! It is my favorite place to go, especially this time of year when the weather starts to cool off they will light up a fire pit. It is the perfect place for a date or group of friends to hang out. Before ordering, you are aloud to taste three wines. There is a wide selection to choose from with categories: sweet/dessert, red, and white. My husband and I usually will take one small sip of our glass and then switch so that we can try six and then buy a bottle of the one we love the most. They give you the option of having a chilled wine in a bucket of ice. In the summertime, we will do this with one of the sweeter wines. Our favorite thing to do is to get them to open the wine and bag it, then give us two plastic cups. This allows us to carry the bottle around and sip on the wine while we walk around town to the different shops.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: GREAT customer service and they are really cool and subtle when it comes time to close up shop.  You can still hangout on the porch and finish your beer after they close everything up.  Domestic beers abt $4 each and $5 for an average plastic up of wine.  Chill place to hang out before a show at Gruene Hall.

reviews.author: Samantha R.
reviews.description: Great place to try samples of wine. They have a reasonable selection to choose from. They offer samplings, by the glass and by the bottle. They staff is very friendly and helpful. The best part of the experience is the atmosphere. They have a cute patio and outdoors area where live music is played. They also offer cute gifts. The only thing I would recommend is more of an appetizer selection. It is definitely a must stop if you are in Gruene for the day or the weekend.

reviews.author: Melyn G.
reviews.description: Great weather to be out at the annual Clay festival enjoying some Texas wine and a cheese tray and of course live musix

reviews.author: Paul P.
reviews.description: Nice selection of Texas wines. Was cool to see that they carry a selection of Rohan meadery and honey wines. This will save a trip to LaGrange. Come here on and off, usually to show out of town guests which was the case today. They loved the hospitality and selection.   The only negative is that it can get so cramped inside and the AC is not up to the challenge of cooling the place with the constant traffic opening the doors. It was pleasant sitting outside today, cooler than inside.

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: You get 3 free tastings of either wine or draft beer. OR you can choose to do 5 tastings with a souvenir wine glass (stemmed or stemless, you pick.)   The customer service here cannot be beat. On a weekend day, you will find it to be a happening place, but you won't be waiting in line as you would expect. Sometimes they even have Peach-A-Ritas and Frozen Sangria!   The Grapevine offers a plethora of bottled wines for sale, or you can buy a glass..   There is ample seating outside of the Grapbine building, where you can enjoy a glass of wine, beer or maybe you bought a bottle to share. They will give you a bucket with ice to keep your wine cool in.   The bathroom situation can get a bit tight, as there is 1 male restroom and 1 female. But there are plenty of restrooms available at Gruene Hall which is not far at all.   I like that you can open a tab, so you can grab a beer or glass of wine, walking around Gruene and shop, then stop by when you need a refill.   I was bummed they no longer offer any of the wines from Val Verde in Del Rio, but the waiter did suggest a few wines for me to try that were comparable.   They also have small cheese and cracker boards available.

reviews.author: Greg S.
reviews.description: What an incredible hidden gem!  I have lived in the area for 20 years and just recently found Blue Lotus Winery.  This is by far, my favorite Texas Winery.  The wines and mead were wonderful, Allie and Katy were fantastic behind the counter and there was even a Cajun food truck there serving up some of the best gumbo I've ever had.   Although I'm not a huge fan of Strawberries, the Wild Strawberry Melomel is a must try!  There is even a Jalapeno Mead which I will be purchasing to bring with me when I visit out of state friends!  The main tasting room is beautiful with full views of the vineyards.  There was even a Loggerhead Shrike putting on a show for us on the shrubs along the driveway.  I can only imangine how specular the grounds will be in the spring once the vines have leaves.  We left with a bottles of Strawberry and Red Lotus.  We also grabbed a 64oz refillable jug full of Blackberry Mead.  In addition to the tasting, we had a bottle of Raspberry mead with lunch.    Everything we tried (with the assistance of the Allie and Katy) were incredible!  I have a feeling we'll be back very soon to refill that big jug of Blackberry Mead!  My new favorite winery!

reviews.author: Megan E.
reviews.description: What a lovely experience! We went on a Thursday afternoon (3/34/2022) and the woman working there was an absolute joy, very personable and knowledgeable considering she hadn't been working there very long. We did a sampler and tried some of the meads, which were lovely and we bought a few bottles as well as some other swag. We talked about other local places to get food and drinks and site seeing. They do serve food, appetizers and pizzas and have a BBQ truck on the weekends as well as other special weekend events seasonally. They recently updated their hours, she mentioned being opened on Wednesdays too though yelp and Apple Maps have not updated with the new hours so be sure to check out the website for hour and other fascinating information about the actual winery.

reviews.author: Estie R.
reviews.description: Cute little place, but no shade outside. VERY QUITE, like a library.  Wine is good. Food was ok. Pretzels were chewy.

reviews.author: Dustin T.
reviews.description: As far as I could tell, at the time of writing this review this is the only winery in the immediate area of Seguin. After visiting wineries in Fredericksburg/Hye/Stonewall area, this one falls a little short. The wine itself is okay, but I didn't like it enough to buy a bottle. The building is a little strange, as is the decor inside. There's a lot going on in there. There were tons of kids running around which for a kid-free date weekend sort of dampened the mood for us.  I failed to get her name, but the young woman behind the bar serving was working hard, helped all the customers, and was courteous and friendly - probably the best thing about this place.  All said, we do not regret the visit, but there are definitely areas for this business to improve on.

reviews.author: G G.
reviews.description: Big selection of meads. A few nice wines i tried. Mix the blackberry and cran-orange spice. Yum.

reviews.author: Joe I.
reviews.description: What a fabulous winery just 6 miles north of Seguin. A wonderful selection of dry reds, dry whites and very nice sweet wines as well. They also have mead wine. The perfect place for a weekend trip

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: Whoa! A winery in Seguin? I had not idea. Met friends here for a surprise birthday get together. The tasting room is quaint with 4-5 tables. Was very shocked to find out they started as a meadery. And very impressed by the mead selection. There was 3 meads on tap, raspberry champagne on tap, and a plethora of wine and meads by the bottle available for tasting or a glass.  They do sell growlers, so you can enjoy the tapped mead and champagne at home. I was impressed with the meads and champagne. I did not try any of the wines.  Beautiful landscaping and large windows, which allow you to look out into the vineyard and at the property.

reviews.author: Cathy P.
reviews.description: They have the best mead and one of the best wines I've ever tasted!!!!  If you like sweet wines (like I do) they have great wines, especially their white wines. They flavors are so complex and have underlying subtle flavors that come out as well.   The meads are really sweet and very smooth.   The wine tastings are 5 tastings for $5 which is an amazing deal. Their selection is somewhat limited so if you go with someone else you practically get to try everything they have.   The only downside is that t is out in the country, and looks a bit shady... But they are expanding so it's starting to look more legit.   If you're ever in Seguin area, I definitely suggest this be one of your stops.

reviews.author: Leon W.
reviews.description: This is a new winery  very organized with a great amount of wines to choose from. There are different activities planned for the upcoming months, check their website.

reviews.author: Yesenia H.
reviews.description: Loved the tastings. Very inexpensive. 5 tastings for $7. The jalapeño mead had a very overpowering honey taste, I didn't like it. But really liked the Red Lotus and the Blueberry Jasmine Mead. I highly recommend this winery.

reviews.author: Diana B.
reviews.description: If you are looking to escape the city and explore the local wineries this should be a stop on your list! Personable, authentic, great tasting wines and mead wines. Mead wines are based with honey. They offer delicious food and a beautiful property to walk. They will even show you things like fresh picked grapes fermenting from the morning to unbottled wine tastings in their winery.  The couple that runs this winery are amazing and down to earth. I will definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Jay T.
reviews.description: Very high priced tastings fee.$30. NO CREDIT towards purchase of $30+ bottles of wine. Place was empty. I wonder why?

reviews.author: Brian P.
reviews.description: Awesome mead and wine! They let us in 20min before close and gave us a full sample and full pours. It was great drinking mead in sequin and the owners were incredibly nice! Highly recomended

reviews.author: L S.
reviews.description: Great lineup of wines and mead (malomel). It's a lovely family-owned business. The estate wines were very good, and I think the Golden Lotus is very special and would make a lovely gift. I think this would be a great facility to host a celebration of any sort, whether a wedding or a family get together. I am so glad that I stopped by!

reviews.author: Amber M.
reviews.description: We had a great experience at the winery. They had a wonderful line up of wines and meads. Prior to this experience, I was not a fan of meads..their fruit meads  (blackberry and strawberry were my favs) were delicious!! The owner was fantastic and we enjoyed our tasting with her. Next time we are in Seguin, we will definitely be making a return stop to Blue Lotus. Thank you for a great afternoon!

reviews.author: Kristin L.
reviews.description: This place was so much fun! We just left from a bachelorette party and a wonderful time. Mike and Melissa were so sweet, and their girls are ADORABLE! Katlin (she's two) gave me some great recommendations before our dance party :) definitely try this place! They have some delicious and unique wines. I can tell mike has really been mixing and matching to find the perfect flavors! We will definitely go back!

reviews.author: Alyssa R.
reviews.description: Thank y'all so much for the wine tour. Our bachelorette party had a great time!

reviews.author: Debbie J.
reviews.description: We went in for a quick tasting and wanted to try the mead, which was excellent.   The tasting was 5 for $7.  The cranberry orange spice is a must try for the fall season.  Our server was nice, knowledgeable and made good conversation.   We'll definitely go back.  The only recommendation that I would make to the owner is to put chairs at the bar.  The tasting room opened earlier this year so that may already be in the works.

reviews.author: Stephanie C.
reviews.description: Had an absolutely amazing time visiting here!  The husband and wife team are amazing people with beautiful property.  My girlfriend and I both did a tasting, of which I bought a bottle of the Black Lotus (amazing) and my girlfriend tried both the ports.  She ended up getting a bottle of that.  We also got a bottle of the strawberry mead to drink there on the property.  It was a perfect start to our wonderful valentines weekend we spent in San Antonio.  We will definitely be going back and telling our friends about this wonderful spot!

reviews.author: Lina F.
reviews.description: We came here for my sisters bachelorette weekend! Had an amazing time! :) The harvesting was fun and the grape-stomping was great! I loved the variety of wines - all of us found something we liked. We also devoured the lunch they offered. The spaghetti lunch was amazing and the salad dressing was divine!! We need that recipe! LOL. Thanks for a great visit!

reviews.author: Mark N. T.
reviews.description: Gruene is an old town near San Antonio. I walked around the town. The stores were so unique that I had to take a lot of pictures. There were a lot of restaurants that made me feel hungry. I got Tex-Mex. Please stop by when you visited San Antonio. You will find very authentic Texas culture.

reviews.author: Michelle J.
reviews.description: Not pet friendly at all, not even in outdoor spaces! We were told to leave our dog in our car and come back without him and they would be more than happy to seat us!! SMH! If your pets are like family I would definitely not recommend this area at all!

reviews.author: JaDee W.
reviews.description: This area is the CUTEST and perfect spot for a little day trip. All the locals we met were super friendly and were very excited to have us out of towners stop by. I love old historic buildings and this is the perfect place to come learn some history and see how well they preserved their town. Tons of restaurants, wineries, and little shops to explore. I wouldn't say it's necessarily kid friendly but a nice romantic getaway or girls trip would be perfect here. Everything is within a five minute walk of each other which was nice.  Parking was easy for us to find, the biggest parking area we found was behind the grapevine winery so I would head there first before wasting time circling in front of the store you wanna go into.

reviews.author: Carol I.
reviews.description: Gruene was once a Ghost Town...   ... I remember it well ...   Gruene is now the place to see AND to be seen  Dance, Drink, Sing, Sleep, Shop, Eat, and People Watch

reviews.author: Joy W.
reviews.description: This is my favorite old town in Texas.  It makes me so happy every time I go.  From vintage style stores, cowboys, great wine, live music, floating the rivers, blue bell ice cream, and all of old Texas nostalgia... I won't go a year without coming back.  Stay wonderful Gruene!

reviews.author: R N.
reviews.description: Too much traffic and too noisy (not talking about the music). I was born and raised in New Braunfels and now live only 20 minutes from the city. We come to Gruene often, to shop and/or eat. Recently we stayed for a couple of nights during the week just for a get away. We stayed at the Gruene Mansion Inn which was fantastic. Gruene itself, however was awful. I walked early in the morning and it was like walking on the side of the freeway. The traffic was non-stop, including big trucks. Cars were moving fast. I had to run to cross the street, in between cars, no one stopped. After my walk (probably around 0800), I headed back to my room and noticed that there were lawn workers cleaning at Gruene Hall with leaf blowers. At around 0930, we walked to go shop and they were still blowing leaves at all the shops in the area......lunch at Mozie's......still blowing. Tried to go back to our room at 1300, still blowing. My husband tried to take a nap at 1430, couldn't because of the leaf blowing. It was ridiculous! Not so cozy or peaceful.

reviews.author: Cheryl J.
reviews.description: Gruene is such a wonderful,  cute and fun town! Great restaurants,  a ton of fun and cute shops, tastings for wine and olive oils! I just can't get enough of Gruene! Would be a dream to live and work here! This was our 2nd girl's trip here and can't wait to return!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: It's always fun to visit during Market Days (3rd weekend of the month). You can always find some cute, original arts and crafts or some yummy local food (i.e. honey, Chicken vindaloo, etc.).  It can get crowed and you may have to be patient while looking for a parking spot, but fun nonetheless.

reviews.author: Brad F.
reviews.description: We just keep coming back every year! Love it.  Customer service and friendly environment

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: It's pronounced, "Green" Gruene is a historic district outside of New Braunfels, along the Guadalupe River. It's an old Civil War era cotton town that was once somewhat of a ghost town. It's bounced back with tourism!  Gruene is a place to go to hang out for an afternoon, and take in the antique shops along Gruene's main street. They also have a wine sampling spot. The Gristmill is a great place to get some German food, and then head to Gruene Hall for some live music at Texas' oldest dance hall.  Gruene, Texas was founded in the 1840's by German settlers. The entire area is all German. The downtown area is mainly made of old brick buildings that have been restored. They're cool architectural designs that make up the shopping district. During Gruene Market Days, local vendors come out for a public market in the streets. As far as I know, you can't really go tubing through Gruene, as it's a bit out from all the tubing spots. The water comes rushing through here, and it seems like it might be difficult to tube it here. Try closer to downtown New Braunfels.

reviews.author: Ly D.
reviews.description: Located between New Braunfels and San Marcos is a beautiful and quaint little gem named Gruene ("Green"). Gruene Historic District is embellished with historic buildings, antique stores, specialty shops, quirky restaurants, and beautiful landscapes. It is small enough to walk by foot, but big enough to discover new things to do and see for an entire day. There are restaurants for coffee, pecan candies, ice cream, and even pickles! And there are shops for toys, unique t-shirts, plants, and pottery. The possibilities are endless.  There are a few unconventional hotel and cottages conveniently located nearby that are walk-able distance. Otherwise the drive from New Braunfels is about 10 minutes. I came here on a Sunday and there were quite a few people walking around, but it wasnt so crowded that I couldn't feel a breeze. There are also plenty of street and parking lots scattered throughout, but there is a main lot located near Got Toys and Typsy Gypsy.

reviews.author: Alice C.
reviews.description: i really enjoyed visiting gruene!  i think with the combination of gruene hall and gristmill restaurant, it creates the perfect atmosphere and ambiance to relive historic days.  everything is perfectly landscaped.  and a quick walk down towards the bridge gives you a gorgeous view of the river and tubing.  it's not a large area, but they employed traffic police to help pedestrians cross.  parking situation is also really well managed with street parking and lot parking!

reviews.author: Saunya O.
reviews.description: Beautiful area! Very picture worthy shops and old fashion signs everywhere. Many good places to eat. I happened to stop by during a Festival of some sort with live music, BBQ and beer. This place is a must see and visit.

reviews.author: Liliana M.
reviews.description: What a great little place to visit and possibly stay at one day. Lots and lots to do from nice shopping to enjoying a great glass of chilled wine!

reviews.author: Ron M.
reviews.description: Nothing quite like visiting Gruene as a getaway from the big city.  Although you will get your traffic jams and crowds on a busy weekend.  But it's a nice cool, overcast day. Shops, food, wine. . . enough to make everyone happy.  If you've never visited, do.  If you've visited before, what's taking you so long to come back?  I promise you'll find something to enjoy.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: About 45 minutes outside Austin.  Gruene is my new favorite getaway from it all weekend day spot.  My friend and I were early coming back to Austin from a weekend getaway in San Antonio on a Sunday afternoon.  Being newish to the area I wasn't familiar with Gruene.  We saw the highway signs advertising Gruene, and usually my curiosity gets the better of me and I will find myself driving out to these places that end up being nothing.  However, Gruene is the first time the signs haven't lied.  My friend and I fell in love instantly with the magic of Gruene's historic wooden downtown main street buildings.  There is something for everyone here,  restaurants and cafes galore, an amazing historic music hall that has some fantastic bands regularly playing, little boutique shops, a winery, a wine tasting room highlighting the best of Texas wines + a couple of beers on tap, numerous adorable BandB's, outdoor market days highlighting local artisans, and of course the token water tower.   I recently spent an afternoon here enjoying the market days, tasting great food, and sipping some great wine.    Time moves a bit slower here, and even though you are 45 minutes from home, you are on a mini holiday.

reviews.author: T T.
reviews.description: Super crowded this last Sunday afternoon and the traffic control officer was just about the rudest person I have experienced in a long time. He clearly hates his job and wants everyone to know it. He will be my reason for not returning to the area.

reviews.author: Kat C.
reviews.description: Great town to visit. It has something for everyone. If your in the mood to eat and drink, you have many options. If your in the mood to shop, the choices are endless of selection of stores to check out. Great place to go see a show and enjoy. Worth a trip to eat, drink, and be merry.

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: Great historic spot to wander around.  Many interesting shops and restaurants/bars to visit.  Enjoyed ourselves !!

reviews.author: Anita C.
reviews.description: Nestled in New Braunfels this is a great place to people watch, taste some wine, eat good food and hear live music. A few times a month they have something called Gruene Market Days where artists/bakers/creators of all things hand crafted come out and sell their goods.  Restaurants like Gruene River Grill, Grist Mill, Adobe Berde and La Cantina offer great dining and nice views. Gruene Hall is a must stop! Lots of antique shops too. Parking can be hard but be patient and something will open up.

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: I went in there without my husband looking to get him some good beer, I know nothing about beer-- at all. Just the type he likes.   I got the 6 pack (and got a % off for buying a pack) and brought them home. My husband LOVED the nitro beer I got him. I also got my mother in law a coffee ale. She said it was the best beer she had ever had and she doesn't even like beer. My father in law drank the White Stout. He said it was phenomenal.   Hats off to the owner, for helping me pick out the best beer. And hats off to this store for carrying such a great variety and quality of product! It was amazing!

reviews.author: Brandy B.
reviews.description: I am new to the area and wanted to check this place out and grab a dry cappuccino after pizza yesterday, Monday October 18th around 7pm. I was unenthusiastically greeted by a girl who acted as if I was bothering her by coming into get coffee. I was asking her questions about the place and what they had and she was incredibly rude and continue to answer my questions with one word answers. No smile ever came across her face and she really made me feel uncomfortable as I was just trying to get some information about the store. My family is really big on cigars /coffee/ whiskey and I was very disappointed in the customer service or lack of customer service. I decided to push through and continue with ordering a coffee and when I asked her for a dry cappuccino she proceeded to roll her eyes and told me she didn't know how to make it and asked me what a dry cappuccino was. When I asked her "isn't this a coffee place?" she said "I don't know how to make the coffee I just push the buttons". As somebody that has been a barista and worked at a coffee shop I tried to explain to her how to make it and she just increasingly became annoyed with me. I decided to scratch the dry cappuccino just ordered a double shot of espresso which was awful by the way. As I continued to try to make small talk it was very apparent that I was not welcome there. I even asked her if she wasn't having a good day because of the way I was being treated. As I was paying, I asked her if there was a place that I could leave a review for the store she looked me dead in my eyes and said no. I confusingly asked her, " oh you don't have a Yelp?" She straight up told me no. As somebody that has worked in customer service I have got to say this is the worst customer service I've ever experienced and I would never treat a customer the way that I was treated. I just hope that the owners can see this and know what goes on in their store when they're not there because if I was the owner of the store I would want to know about one of my employees making people feel very uncomfortable And not being helpful at all. I made several attempts to try to turn this experience around and give her the opportunity to create a pleasant experience for me but she just acted like I was interrupting her day of sitting on the stool behind the counter. Customer service was awful coffee was awful she didn't even know how to make a dry cappuccino. If I were you I would steer clear of this place it's not worth it.

reviews.author: Houston R.
reviews.description: WOW!  SO much to choose from!!!  Steve is amazing at helping choose something if you are new or even a novice of cigars, wine, beer and coffee.     Clean, well stocked and excellent customer service. Floor to ceiling stocked with variety!  Something for everyone!  Get your gifts done here!  Cheers!

reviews.author: Dan A.
reviews.description: They have about a billion craft beer brands and types. The carry an assortment of cigars. (I don't smoke though). The gentleman behind the counter, Steve, is super knowledgeable about his beers and stogies. If you enjoy the nicer things, here is your place.  Better pricing than other places on both beer and cigars.   This place intentionally protects it beers and cigars from harmful UV light by putting reflective tint on the front windows and the right amount of illumination inside. That shows seriousness in what they do.

reviews.author: Sean P.
reviews.description: Great customer service. I came for a wedding and was able to find a nice selection of wine from Texas wineries as well as California wineries. Thebseems to have a lot of great cigars everywhere, and the humidors were in great condition. I would definitly come back!

reviews.author: Adrian H.
reviews.description: Loved this place! Great for picking cigars and beers, coffee is really good too. Look forward to going back for more supplies

reviews.author: Alison K.
reviews.description: Great espresso!   Very nice place. Easy stop for great coffee and an excellent beer selection.

reviews.author: Wesley F.
reviews.description: Stopped in after my haircut next door, because I got 10% off after showing my receipt as a promotion, since it just opened. The staff was very courteous and professional; additionally, the store was well stocked with everything, especially different types of sodas from Texas. I would highly recommend this location to anyone looking for a variety of beers, cigars, coffees, wines, and sodas. I am definitely going back soon to get more of the soda!

reviews.author: Chris B.
reviews.description: Great craft beer selection and love the idea that I can pick and choose what beers make up my 6pk. Nothing worse than buying a whole 6pk of a beer that you don't like and then stare at the next 5 cans.

reviews.author: G G.
reviews.description: Nice staff Interesting palette of meads S9me good wines too (Rubus was good, Tigers blood mead was good too)

reviews.author: Heather R.
reviews.description: Short visit reaped great rewards.  Mr R had called ahead and been told they had no snack bar/restaurant on site but standard cheese/fruit/charcuterie were available for tastings.  Circumstances changed and I arrived alone at the tasting room's last hour of business. No offer of munchies but the employee was personable, knowledgeable, enjoys his work and I got to taste some *great* stuff in short order. If I'd arrived earlier I'd have asked about a few solids or in hindsight packed a bento box of them in the car to visit between flights.  In wines I tend towards dry, Pinot Grigio's what you can always find at my house and usually in my glass. I also love mead, although what I've consumed over the years is quantum territory compared to my impressive wine quaffing.  I tried four meads and one wine, enjoyed them all. A tasting of 5 selections as I got is $15 and you get to keep the glass. Took home traditional mead (drier), raspberry, Oatmeal Monster, and Vermentino (a drier white wine).  Seriously, if you have a friend who likes sweet wines, you have a shower or other small party on your calendar, come stock up on this oatmeal monster. It's like drinking an oatmeal cookie, it's ridiculously satisfying and giggle-inducing.  The drive's less than 40 minutes from San Marcos, it's near 123 in Seguin not far off my usual path to my parents' and the landscape's as nice as any in this part of Tx. As I said, I didn't have time to wander about on an extensive tour but it looked nice. The map option through Yelp was quite sufficient to get me there easily for a first visit.  They have events throughout the year, the wine club (quarterly delivery/pickup) has no membership fee and I think I'm going to sign up for it. Bottles start around $15 each and there are discounts offered on certain labels/quantities; I saw a few postings for those. The facility's nice if you are making an event of it and there's reasonable parking for split parties to meet up here.  What more can I say? Highlight of my day and now I have new hostess gifts or treats for myself stocked away.

reviews.author: Janean D.
reviews.description: I've visited this winery a few times. Lovely place. Wine and food is great. The staff is very helpful. Patio is beautiful.

reviews.author: Debbie B.
reviews.description: Since trying mead in New England I've been dying to have some more. I'm a new mead fan and enjoy the sweetness and smoothness of it compared to wine. Therefore I was super excited to see this place on a recent trip to the area.   We came in and it was slow. We were the only customers in the tasting room. The super sweet intern was so accommodating and attentive. We really enjoyed chatting with her and trying her recommendations. The property is also very beautiful and scenic. I recommend coming to check this place out!

reviews.author: Bryan B.
reviews.description: Awesome spot, we came for a day trip out here, and I was totally shocked this place existed. Loved every aspect of this place; it was very home-like and welcoming. Ours hostess was kind enough to explain the different styles of mead and wine conjured on the campus. With various samples, I cannot imagine how to choose just one. Their blueberry, raspberry, and original honey take the cake. This place was a real surprise and I would definitely come again and enjoy the scenery and drinks.

reviews.author: Jesse B.
reviews.description: So, really I am surprised that this meadery exists in the middle of "nowhere I'd be going randomly". My mom has been getting into making mead with the fruit trees back home and so, when in Texas, try Texas Mead. Again, this place is way off the beaten road so unless you're aware of their existence, I'm not sure there will be too many coming here.  To start, it was nice and quiet the day my mom and I stopped in, which meant that we got the undivided attention of our hostess. She was highly informative and gracious. My mom had many questions on account of making mead herself, so I just quietly sampled my mead.   Mead is traditionally quite sweet, so if you're not much of a sweet person, find yourself to the wine menu with some drier options. (Yes, along with mead, they have wine here.) The unfortunate ending to our tasting was that the tasting was not comped upon purchase of bottles of wine. (Hmm, maybe with time an popularity this one will go?) Anyway, small gripes, small gripes. So, there is definitely a selection if you're not one who is traditionally into mead.  The last little tidbit I must relish again was their "Hopped Mead". My mom and I decided to drink a glass outside, wandering the winery, and it was incredible. Think somewhat sweet mead but carbonated (that doesn't happen often folks) and hopped for taste. It was so good, my mother bought a growler and we went on our way hoppy. And maybe a little loopy.

reviews.author: Hector B.
reviews.description: Solid experience.  Focused on meads, not the wine.  The meads are not as sweet as expected.  They angled towards port wines to Riesling in taste.  Service was solid and  enjoyable (melinda).  Worthy of a visit! Enjoy!

reviews.author: L S.
reviews.description: Wonderful meads! The blackberry had such incredible flavor. I loved the Desert Pear Pomegranate - very fruit forward. I brought home plenty of mead to share with my friends. I am already looking forward to my next visit!

reviews.author: Rickey B.
reviews.description: Very cool place have fun. Great place to go and spend some time. If you've not been go today opens at noon

reviews.author: Whitney M.
reviews.description: The location is beautiful, the owners are friendly and easy to talk to, and the drinks are delicious. We did the tour and tasting and it was a great way to spend an afternoon.

reviews.author: M H.
reviews.description: Passed this store many times and wondered how serious could a store named "lol" be. Finally stopped and was I wrong! This place super surprised me, it is decked out with liquor from top to bottom, pretty much anything you could ask for. And if they don't have it, they'll get it, just for you. I was looking for a bottle of a special Asian wine, this location didn't have it but another did... and the owner, Paras, delivered it himself within an hour to the store. Owner, Paras, great person, super knowledgable, and way cool. It was Friday night and he had about 6-8 bottles out for samples and gave recommendations on best ways to drink and mix. Gotta try this place. And if you want "high-end" bottles, Paras is the man to talk to.
